story:
WHO ARE WE?

Time Spanners was created by John Vourlis, a graduate of USC Film School and a published author, and Jaime Lombardo, a successful graphic artist and illustrator who’s done hundreds of illustrations for role playing games. John and Jaime grew up together in Wickliffe, Ohio, and a drawing that Jaime did was the initial inspiration for Time Spanners (you can see it in the video here). When John saw the drawing, he was so blown away he immediately wanted to write a movie based on it. He and Jaime toiled long and hard on that screenplay, and when it was finished, they were lucky enough to have it read by several Hollywood producers who were intrigued by the idea. Like many a movie script, though, it never got made. John and Jaime were disappointed, but realistic. Movies like this cost tens, if not, hundreds of millions of dollars to make. Undaunted, they toyed around with turning their screenplay into a novel, but that didn’t feel right.

Then one day, John was talking with his pal, the talented filmmaker and comic book artist Ted Sikora, about how much he loved the idea of comics, especially the purity and simplicity of the storytelling. Ted told John that nowadays it’s not hard to self-publish a comic, and then Ted said the magic words, “Why don’t you turn one of your scripts into one? You’ll have a blast doing it.” And thus Time Spanners as a comic book was born.

There was just one small problem. With Jaime busy running his own graphic design company, and John incapable of drawing anything but stick figures, the two friends needed to find an experienced comic book artist to collaborate with on the project. John then had the good fortune of meeting Brendan Kelly at a bar in Cleveland. Brendan turned out to be a multi-talented artist: an actor, musician, and author of his own cool comics. Over corned beef sandwiches a few weeks and a few beers later, John pitched Brendan the idea of turning the Time Spanners script into a series of comic books, and Brendan was hooked. The rest, we hope, will be history. To find out MORE ABOUT THE COMIC and the STORY click on the GALLERY TAB.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

If you're not familiar with Indiegogo or crowd-funding in general, here's a brief overview: 

For the next 45 days, you'll be able to make pledges to help support the creation of Issue #1 of Time Spanners, ranging from $5 to $250. You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only helping us out, you are also receiving some cool stuff in return! 

Our goal is to raise $2500 to finish Issue #1 and get started on Issue #2. Our dream is to turn the entire script into a graphic novel one day, which will ultimately be composed of 10 or 12 issues of the comic. We have the first 7 pages penciled and inked, and you can see some of the results here:



The money we’re raising now will go towards paying Brendan to finish inking and then coloring all of Issue #1, and if possible for us to get started on Issue #2. Anything we raise above our goal will go towards completing Issue #2 and any future issues possible.

We have chosen a Flexible Funding program so that whatever money you donate will go directly to completion of Issue #1 (and any potential future issues), no matter if we reach our goal of $2500 or not. If we don’t make our goal, Indiegogo just takes a slightly larger percentage (9% instead of 4%), so it’s in our best interest, and yours, for us to reach or surpass that goal!

YOUR IMPACT

Without your help, we won’t be able to realize our dream of turning Time Spanners into a comic book, and hopefully down the road into a graphic novel.  It takes lots of time, no pun intended, and lots and lots of effort to draw each panel of a comic book. You can see the detailed work that goes into one such panel (of at least 22 needed) in the video.  Brendan has been kind enough to create the first seven pages gratis, but an artist can only get so far on corned beef sandwiches alone, and we've been fortunate to get someone as talented as Brendan to help us get this far. The average cost per issue for an experienced comic book illustrator is $3000 and up. Brendan, with our help, is happy to work for less because he loves the project so much. So now it’s time for us to pay the man and finish the job. We’d love to be able to just write him a check, but without your help, that’s not possible.

As artists, we ultimately rely on the public’s support, one way or another. If you like the products we create, you buy them. In the bad old days, we’d have had to pitch this to comic book companies to get them to publish our comic, but in this day and age of crowd-funding and self-publishing, we don’t need those guys. All we need is you!

So if you like what we’re trying to do here, if you’re as excited about it as we are, then by making a pledge, you can help us launch the Time Spanners comic. Your donation will make you a comic book producer just like Marvel or DC! How cool is that!?  And with so many avenues out there to sell the comic, including our favorite great local brick and mortar store, Comic Heaven, as well as websites like Comixology.com, Indyplanet.com, and of course Amazon.com on the internet, you will be able to point to Time Spanners and say, “I helped get that comic made!”

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can’t contribute much, if anything—as starving artists ourselves, we understand that.  That’s why we’ve made it possible for you to pledge as little as $5 to get a reward (in our case, a digital download of Issue #1). For those of you who can’t donate for whatever reason, we ask you to help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, via email, Facebook, or word of mouth. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools to help!

If you can, make a pledge, help us realize our dream, and get a cool reward to boot! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

NOTE: THANK YOU FOR MAKING THE COMIC BOOK A REALITY!!!! Whatever additional money we raise will be for promotion such as flying our DC/Marvel Comics artist Dave Beaty to the Phoenix Comicon Film Festival during June 2-5, 2016 and Florida Supercon this July 1-4, 2016 where the feature film itself is playing since the Comic Book is directly tied to the film itself.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi, my name is Russ Emanuel and I am working with my associate producer Eric Kask and Marvel and DC Comics Artist Dave Beaty to create a 24-page comic book tie-in to our already completed science fiction horror feature film “Occupants” (http://occupantsthemovie.com).  Starring Robert Picardo of "Star Trek: Voyager", the film is currently in the Film Festival and Comic Con circuits such as Florida SuperCon.

“Occupants”, a film we successfully crowdfunded on Indiegogo (https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/occupants/x/...), is about a young couple who discover a parallel version of themselves through a documentary they are shooting.  Based on this premise, our comic book tie-in deals with parallel universes, doing things that were not feasible in the feature film due to budgetary constraints.

We will not only complement the film but indeed create a related comic book universe with unlimited possibilities! We also want to do an outreach to the anime community and its potential in expanding the target audience for the film!

What We Need

With the first two pages already drawn, we need $4050.00 to create the rest of the 22 pages for our comic book one-shot (24 pages total).  This include 3 DIFFERENT COVERS: one is the Standard (Official) Cover, two is the Alternate Cover, three is the Theatrical Photo (showing people from our film) Cover.

1. Initial interior black and white art work (Dave Beaty artist) - $2,200.00
2. Color for Standard Cover (Hi-Fi)  - $200.00
3. Alternate (Variant) cover artwork - $100.00
3. Alternate (Variant) cover artwork - $100.00
4. Alternate (Variant) cover color - $200.00
5. 250 unit print run of standard cover book - $400.00
6. 50 Limited run theatrical photo cover - $250.00
7. 50 Limited run alternate art cover - $250.00
8. 10 Artist Dave Beaty and the Feature Film Cast and Crew signatures - $250.00
9. Contingency fund (5% of total budget) - $200.00

TOTAL BUDGET: $4050.00

Rewards

We will be offering various rewards including variant covers signed by the artist himself, as well as those signed by the cast and crew associated with the feature film.  Not only that, we will offer a reward to have your physical likeness drawn into our comic book as one of our characters!

Background

Eric Kask and I have the experience necessary to create a such a comic book tie-in because we already have several films screened at comic book conventions.  These include the action and stunts-oriented “Girl With Gun” which screened at the San Diego Comicon, “P.J. A Journey of the Heart” which debuted at the Phoenix Comicon and starring the “Battlestar Galactica” actor John Heard, and “The Legends of Nethiah” starring the aforementioned Robert Picardo which showed at the Hal-Con Sci-Fi, Fantasy & Comic Convention.

In Conclusion

With the first two pages already completed, along with a detailed script and budget already in place for the rest of the project, we hope you will join us in making the “Occupants” comic book tie-in a reality and in return reap the benefits.

And of course, to join us at one of our comic book conventions where we will unveil the finished product to the world. And if our goal is met for this comic book, we would like to create further stories down the line.

Thank you for your time and we look forward to working with you!

story:
Ultimate Power Duo 

is a demolition rock band from Saskatoon, about to release their fourth album, a double concept album called Ad Astra featuring an 88 page full color comic "jam" of 12 different artists interpreting each song on the album.  The album is complete, all the art for the comic is ready for print, and we have over half of the money needed for full color printing, but we are short funds needed to bring this project to a close.  To date we have invested almost 20g into this project and ask you to pre-buy the album/ comic in order to help complete it.  The cd/ graphic novel combo is a limited edition.

Ultimate Power Duo

has released four full-length albums, four eps, and have played through the UK, US, and Canada incuding SXSW, the Great Escape, Warped Tour, Vancouver Olympics and have opened for Bad Religion, Nomeansno, the Vibrators, Sloan, Bif Naked, and many more.

 

"Next up are Saskatoon’s brilliantly named Ultimate Power Duo. Naturally enough, UPD are in fact a classic power trio of riffs, pummeling drums all kept in check by a low end rumble to make Mike Watt jealous. Fresh from being handpicked as a support act for Bad Religion by Jay Bentley himself and a handful of dates with Canadian punk legends NomeansNo under their belt, The UPD are a vacuum tight punk rock unit, playing a self proclaimed ‘Demolition Rock”- theirs is the music that would be made if the neo-garage rock of The Hives or Rocket From The Crypt played a game of Chicken with The Minutemen and The Ramones and neither backed down. Clad in an all black uniform they know they’re r’n’r history, nodding to The Minutemen’s “If Reagan Played Disco” during the intro to the no-wave onslaught that is “Noam Disco”. The beauty of UPD is the clear delight they take in playing- a reminder that life is too short to not enjoy yourself and a celebration of living in, and for the moment. Their set ends with both non-drumming members performing Pete Townesend-esque windmills before launching their guitars into the roof of the building." www.thelineofbestfit.com Canadian Blast Review, The Great Escape Festival UK

 

Ultimate Power Duo: Space Joe: Ad Astra The Graphic Novel

 

“It would not be too much to say that myth is the secret opening through which the inexhaustible energies of the cosmos pour into human cultural manifestation.  Religions, philosophies, arts, the social forms of primitive and historic man, prime discoveries in science and technology, the very dreams that blister sleep, boil up from the basic, magic ring of myth.” Joseph Campbell –The Hero with a Thousand Faces

Vishnu.  Gilgamesh.  Beowulf.  Ulysses.  Buddha.  Jesus.  Luke Skywalker.  Neo. 

Prepare to meet the new name in mythic, epic story telling. 

Space Joe.  

Ultimate Power Duo presents the next character in humanity’s mono-myth, a near future character who, while exploring his true inner meaning and life path, changes humankind’s perceptions of reality and existence. 

Space Joe: Ad Astra  follows the story of a boy named Joe, an Air Force army brat who has his first experience with zero gravity in high school, before finally making his full ascension to the stars as an adult.  Once among the regions of space, Space Joe meets an amazing array of characters, discovers a new meaning to his life, and creates a celestial course previously uncharted by any other human being.  

Ultimate Power Duo has taken on their biggest challenge yet; a twenty two track concept album following a single, continuative story line released simultaneously in audio and sequential art formats. 

The Adventures of Space Joe: Ad Astra is a jam comic in the true sense of the word; twelve different artists represent their individual artistic styling to the twenty two songs turning the Ad Astra concept album into Ad Astra the graphic novel.   Based on notes regarding song lyrics, story lines, character descriptions, and plot points, each artist created their own distinct storyline and script while retaining a plot driven story. 

The Adventures of Space Joe: Ad Astra-The Graphic Novel is a true conglomeration of multi-genre artistic endeavour.  The artwork ranges from the Golden Age inspired Donny Sparrow, the neo-Silver Age work of Nathan Wall, the Iron Age look of Ken Davis, the cartoon inspired Jordyn Bochon and Elaine Wall, and the feathered lined abstractions of Cate Francis.   

A project of immense scope, artistic outlooks and varied styles, Space Joe: Ad Astra The Graphic Novel is an immense work representing Canada’s greatest talent.          

Ad Astra The Album: Ultimate Power Duo has taken on their biggest challenge yet; a 22 track concept album following a single, continuative story line while simultaneously displaying themselves at their most musically innovative, daring to explore previously un-delved genres and styles. 

Produced by UPD and Barrett Ross (Colour Field, Foam Lake, The Bloodlines) and mixed and mastered by  Dave Carswell of JCDC (New Pornographers, Tegan and Sara),  Space Joe: Ad Astra – To the Stars is highly accessible and highly dynamic featuring straight-ahead driving rock songs (“Chasing Airwaves” and “Gyles Coyote: Inspirational Speaker”), slower, introspective melodies (“My Memory” and “Captain Joe and the Wayward Star Ship (Star-Crossed Lovers Cross the Stars)”), long narratives with ambient keyboards, space sounds and historical news footage regarding space missions and moon landings (“Noveture”), and spoken word musical theatre accompanied by thick, trudging guitar riffs and robotic anti-humanity ranting (“An Oral History of the Robotic Revolution, Liberation and Subjugation of Spero Spondeo”).  These diverse elements elucidate essential UPD in delivery and attitude pontificating intelligent song writing, dry humour, outrageous creativity and wit. 

In the vein of The Who’s Tommy and Quadrophenia, The Kinks’ Arthur (Or the Decline and Fall of the British Empire) and Pink Floyd’s The Dark Side of the Moon, Space Joe: Ad Astra is a beginning to end musical journey and epic story-telling experience. 

Ultimate Power Duo has reclaimed the art of true album making. 

List of Artistic Contributors: 

Casper Konefal

Jordyn Bochon

Tyler Jenkins

Elaine Will

Owen Gieni

Tom Bagley

Riley Rosomo

Tyler Jenkins

Nathan Wahl

Donny Sparrow

Cate Francis

Ken Davis

Cover Art:   Casper Konefal

 

Story/ Song Titles:            

“Noverture”

“Chasing Airwaves”

“Gyles Coyote: Inspirational Speaker”

“My Memory”

“Space Joe: Ad Adstra”

“Welcome to the Moon, Man”

"An Oral History of the Moon Satellite Colony, the Pursuit of Scientific Scrutiny and the Dark Matter Mission"

“Gyles Servo: Cybernetic Junk Dealer”

“Alien Attack”

“Victorious!”

“Point-To-Point”

“Saeculum: Heroic Pathos”

"An Oral History of the Robotic Revolution, Liberation and Subjugation of Spero Spondeo"

“Escape to Star Ship Algo”

"Captain Joe and the Wayward Star Ship (Star-Crossed Lovers Cross the Stars)"

“Keep It Under Control”

"Gyles Milgram: Holographic Guidance Counsellor"

“An Anti-Universe Apart”

“11:11”

“Cast Off the Electric P.I.E.R.”

“Avatar Illuminated”

“Hail the Conquering Hero”

Produced by UPD and Barrett Ross (Colour Field, Foam Lake, The Bloodlines) and mixed and mastered by  Dave Carswell of JCDC (New Pornographers, Tegan and Sara),  Space Joe: Ad Astra – To the Stars is highly accessible and highly dynamic featuring straight-ahead driving rock songs (“Chasing Airwaves” and “Gyles Coyote: Inspirational Speaker”), slower, introspective melodies (“My Memory” and “Captain Joe and the Wayward Star Ship (Star-Crossed Lovers Cross the Stars)”), long narratives with ambient keyboards, space sounds and historical news footage regarding space missions and moon landings (“Noveture”), and spoken word musical theatre accompanied by thick, trudging guitar riffs and robotic anti-humanity ranting (“An Oral History of the Robotic Revolution, Liberation and Subjugation of Spero Spondeo”).  These diverse elements elucidate essential UPD in delivery and attitude pontificating intelligent song writing, dry humour, outrageous creativity and wit. 
In the vein of The Who’s Tommy and Quadrophenia, The Kinks’ Arthur (Or the Decline and Fall of the British Empire) and Pink Floyd’s The Dark Side of the Moon, Space Joe: Ad Astra is a beginning to end musical journey and epic story-telling experience. 
Ultimate Power Duo has reclaimed the art of true album making. 
List of Artistic Contributors: 
Casper Konefal
Jordyn Bochon
Tyler Jenkins
Elaine Will
Owen Gieni
Tom Bagley
Riley Rosomo
Tyler Jenkins
Nathan Wahl
Donny Sparrow
Cate Francis
Ken Davis
Cover Art:   Casper Konefal
 
Story/ Song Titles:            
 “Noverture”
“Chasing Airwaves”
“Gyles Coyote: Inspirational Speaker”
“My Memory”
“Space Joe: Ad Adstra”
“Welcome to the Moon, Man”
"An Oral History of the Moon Satellite Colony, the Pursuit of Scientific Scrutiny and the Dark Matter Mission"
“Gyles Servo: Cybernetic Junk Dealer”
“Alien Attack”
“Victorious!”
“Point-To-Point”
“Saeculum: Heroic Pathos”
"An Oral History of the Robotic Revolution, Liberation and Subjugation of Spero Spondeo"
“Escape to Star Ship Algo”
"Captain Joe and the Wayward Star Ship (Star-Crossed Lovers Cross the Stars)"
“Keep It Under Control”
"Gyles Milgram: Holographic Guidance Counsellor"
“An Anti-Universe Apart”
“11:11”
“Cast Off the Electric P.I.E.R.”
“Avatar Illuminated”
“Hail the Conquering Hero”

story:
Our Story

We are a circle of recovering addict artists who create comic strips on history. Generally the different religious groups are treated seperately. We want to show  what on the very day of different assassinations the holy-book-reading groups were learning in Jewish, Christian and Muslim groups.

 The Impact

We just want to propagate by comic strips  this new way to look at some historic clichés: that besides messianic warmonger movements there were also heretic therapy movements...

 

What We Need & What You Get

 
Of course we start with a comic strip exhibition in Paris, (since my Great Aunt whi inspired this project has lived there 100 ys ago, and we will create a commemorative exhibition - its mounting may cost 1300 EUr which is appr. 1500 USD - I asked a galerist there)
 
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, try to grasp the impact of helping addicts by this funny new vision of the history of "self-help" !  ...But first you may want to check the facts around the topic in my English novel at www.sfsalvo.com and at www.tormay.blog.com or the already existing comics at my Facebook site (Cosmos Geo) in the Photos files.(In English: "Dixicosmix):https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1375010128138.54345.1018377009&type=3

story:
L'édition d'un ouvrage sur les femmes migrantes dépend de tous, vous pouvez diffuser et partager ce lien. Les fonds promis pour l'impression de la prochaine BD sur "les migrantes" ne viendront pas, aussi nous prenons l'option d'un financement participatif et de diffuser les ebooks créés de manière généralisée. La prochaine édition dépend donc des réseaux sociaux.

 

Paroles d'Hommes et de Femmes

L’association Paroles d’Hommes et de Femmes utilise la mémoire recueillie dans tous les lieux et sous toutes ses formes, pour créer du lien social. L’histoire individuelle et collective peut être une source d’animation interculturelle et intergénérationnelle, une source de création, une source de pédagogie. La mémoire des aînés migrants, peut permettre de construire l’avenir des jeunes si on leur donne la possibilité de créer des liens intergénérationnels directs, d’écouter et de vivre le quotidien des personnes qui les ont précédées.

http://www.parolesdhommesetdefemmes.fr/

https://www.facebook.com/frederic.praud?fref=ts

 

La Bande Dessinée "Parcours de Migrantes"

Après avoir édité trois tomes de la collection BD "Les Migrants", nous souhaitons finaliser une œuvre spécifique favorisant la connaissance sur la migration féminine en France.

L'objectif est de créer un ouvrage de récits biographiques illustrés, pour diffuser et partager les témoignages réalisés avec des migrantes originaires de pays francophones et non francophones. Cet ouvrage est réalisé dans le cadre d’une collection destinée au grand public, aux femmes migrantes, à la jeunesse, aux établissements scolaires, aux réseaux sociaux francophones.

http://www.parolesdhommesetdefemmes.fr/les-migrantes-article001102.html

http://www.lettresetmemoires.net/bandes-dessinees-200041.htm

L’ouvrage présente six récits de femmes migrantes issues de différents pays : Mongia - Tunisie, N'deye - Sénégal, Diana - Liban, Deepa - Inde, Mai Ling - Vietnam, Alice - Portugal.

Ces parcours s’articulent autour des mêmes thématiques : l’enfance dans le pays d’origine, le contexte historique et économique, les raisons du départ et le départ, l’intégration en France.

Sélectionnés à partir des biographies réalisées par Frédéric Praud,  ces récits sont mis en dessins par deux dessinateurs Kiel et Hamed Borsali et scénarisés par Florence Brèthes.

 

Présentation des récits

Mai Ling - Vietnam

Mai Ling naît en 1940 à Hoa Lu, qui fait alors partie de l’Indochine française. De sousmissions en violences, c’est par les mots et l’écriture qu’elle a repris en mains le cours de sa vie. Ecrire les blessures de son histoire, afin de faire comprendre que la vie de la petite fille soumise et solitaire qu’elle était à la femme volontaire mais rejetée qu’elle est devenue, correspond au poids de sa culture.

N’deye - Sénégal

N’Deye naît en 1961 à Dakar. Séparée de ses parents, elle grandit avec ce sentiment d’injustice, et mène une carrière professionnelle au service de l’autre. Porteuse d’une double culture sénégalaise et française, elle en reconnaît une troisième, la culture vendéenne, à laquelle elle reste attachée, même si aujourd’hui, elle vit et travaille à Niort.

Deepa- Inde

Deepa naît en 1948 à Calcutta. Issue d’une famille brahmane et bengalie, elle s’attache à promouvoir et faire connaître la culture indienne en France. Aujourd’hui française de nationalité et indienne de personnalité, Deepa participe, par le biais de son association, à la rencontre de ses deux cultures.

Mongia - Tunisie

Mongia naît en 1951 à Lamta près de Monastir. De son enfance difficile, elle n’a de cesse de faire sortir les femmes des ténèbres en les aidant à accéder à leur indépendance. Devenue animatrice, sa vie est à Angers, mais elle reste fière et attachée à sa culture tunisienne, qu’elle a transmise à ses enfants.

 Diana - Liban

Diana Saad naît en 1960 à Aïchié, près de la frontière israélienne. D’un pays adoré au déchirement de la guerre, c’est par amour qu’elle vient en France. Malgré les difficultés, elle s’adapte, travaille, élève ses enfants. Une Française au cœur libanais.

 Alice - Portugal

Alice naît en 1955 à Souto da Casa. De son petit village au Portugal à sa vie en France, elle n’a cessé de se battre pour vivre pleinement son indépendance. Reconnaissante à la France, elle reste portugaise et transmet sa culture à ses enfants, qui aujourd’hui, continuent d’agrandir cette famille multiculturelle.

 

Pourquoi un financement participatif?

 

La valorisation des parcours de femmes migrantes est un de nos objectifs majeurs. La bande dessinée est un vecteur de valorisation de la mémoire de l’immigration féminine et d’action éducative.

 Paroles d’Hommes et de Femmes est une association. Pour l’édition des précédents tomes de la collection, nous avons pu bénéficier du soutien de partenaires institutionnels et privés. Pour ce 4ème tome, bien que convaincus par l’intérêt d’un tel ouvrage, ces partenaires ne peuvent nous suivre.

Nous pensons qu’il ne peut y avoir de meilleur partenaire que les personnes elles-mêmes à qui ce projet s’adresse.

Les dessinateurs ont commencé le travail de création graphique de la bande dessinée. Trois récits sont d'ores et déjà terminés, la création des trois autres est en cours et sera terminée à la fin de l'été 2013.

Nous avons  besoin de vous pour l’impression du tome "Parcours de Migrantes".

La somme de 13000 euros nous permettra d'imprimer 4000 exemplaires (52 pages, format 21x31, couverture cartonnée), ce qui correspond à l'édition des tomes précédents de la collection.

Si nous atteignons notre objectif, la BD pourra sortir à la fin du mois d'octobre 2013.

Nous avons choisi un financement flexible, afin que, quel que soit le soutien qui nous sera apporté, nous puissions éditer l’album, aussi minime en soit le nombre d’exemplaires.

 

Les Contreparties :

Chacun est important et peut prendre part à la création d’un ouvrage unique sur des parcours de femmes édifiants, mis en valeur grâce au talent des dessinateurs Kiel et Hamed Borsali.  

Pour toute personne souhaitant participer à l'édition de la bande-dessinée "Parcours de Migrantes", nous proposons différentes contreparties :

10 euros : un ebook format pdf à choisir parmi la collection des récits

15 euros : deux ebooks format pdf à choisir parmi la collection des récits

20 euros : trois ebooks format pdf à choisir parmi la collection des récits

40 euros : une bd de la collection et trois ebooks (frais de ports compris)

60 euros : trois bd de la collection (frais de port compris)

100 : soutien au projet incluant trois bd de la collection (frais de port compris)

 

Ce projet permet de décloisonner chaque génération, de mieux faire comprendre la diversité des parcours de femmes francophones et non francophones, de redonner un rôle social à la mémoire des migrantes. La bande-dessinée est un outil pour faire vivre cette mémoire.

 

Tout soutien  est le bienvenu, n’hésitez pas à le faire connaître autour de vous, à partager cette page en  utilisant  les outils de partage Indiegogo.

 

Merci  pour votre soutien. La création se fera avec vous et grâce à vous !

story:
The first thing I would like to say is ALL images, video, artwork & sound belongs to the project/me and are ALL original, nothing has been copied or stolen.

              

“An epic fantasy fiction graphic novel based on an existing written novel”

In a world of swords shields & sorcery, the fate of the real world and the gods will be decided by the actions of mortals...

This is the fight for existence.

 

 

Who Am I?

I am K Massop and I am the writer / founder of the “Fate Of The Gods” project.

I have spent the last 19 years developing a storyline that spans 4 novels with 1 already published though it is currently being reworked into a second edition.

When people ask “what is this story about?” it’s hard to put into a short sentence as it scales to epic proportions. All I can say is that this is a story that starts as your usual good vs. evil epic but as it progresses it takes more twists & turns than anything I have ever seen or read.

Last year I setup a Facebook group which focused on discussing the first novel and of the 300 members at the time around 200 said that this must be brought to the illustrated theatre as it has a lot of events that would be better portrayed as images. After unsuccessfully funding a graphic novel (I only managed to get to 10 pages before I was dead broke) I realised I will need help to make this dream a reality.

 

 

So what is it exactly are we doing?

 

I have got together an elite group of artists to make this graphic novel. With the money raised I will be able to pay them to make this happen. I am going for the highest quality possible so I will only be working with artists such as Jeremy Raapack who works for DC comics I have also spoken with other artists regarding cover art & colouring from imaginary friends to Udon entertainment so this project is very scalable.

If we hit the $30k target I will be able to pay the artist (Pencilers, colourists) to produce a 100 page full colour graphic novel printed in high quality materials, (Full colour throughout printed on 210mm X 297mm 115GSM Coated silk finish paper inside, the cover will be the same size but finished in glossy laminate with a heavier 250GSM paper quality).

If we Exceed our target I will be able to upgrade the already high quality of the project such as print quality & hardback copies as well as bring in more high profile artists.

 


I want to know more about this story, give me more info!!

“It began when the gods themselves took up arms against each other”

“My people were charged to protect this world from the evils that threatened it. We had to protect the gateway that leads to the dead world we call Vis Vires.”

“It was not long until one of the monsters on Vis Vires found a way back and entered this world”

“This monsters name is Azmond’e and he has conquered the entire western world. His ultimate goal is to return to us with these conquered men and women, and force the divine gateway we call the Velox out of our hands”

“If he is successful with this plan he will call forth his entire race of demons from Vis Vires and bring them into our world. I need not explain what this will mean for all life here”

“I fear we will not be able to stop him.”

 

This story begins in a fictional world set in a middle aged era of swords, shields & sorcery. To begin with it follows 2 unrelated heroines & their quests to overthrow / kill a powerful avatar from the dead world called Vis Vires.

Eventually their paths cross but the results of their actions will cause a butterfly affect that will uncover the greatest threat to life the universe will ever know.

Not even the gods will be safe from what will come of these events..

 

 

Ok I get it, so what about the rewards?

I have put together so much exclusive content this could end up being the “Ultimate limited edition” project.

The original 10 page graphic novel is up for grabs.

The original sound track produced by Enjoylife Productions in London. This classical orchestrated soundtrack is also something that has never been released and I have no plan to do so. ( samples can be heard in the video & on the main website www.kmassop.com )

Posters of some of the artwork done by Deviantart’s greatest (Genzoman, Garang, Raapack etc)

The first rights to the 2nd edition of the written novel (this will be made available to backers at least 3 months before official release)

Become a Fate Of The Gods character in the graphic novel (and not some character who will die in the first scene, a character who will feature throughout the story and on the front cover*)

Vote for the Fate Of The Gods cover and much much more.

Every penny raised will go to the production & publishing of this project and should we go over our target I WILL EXTEND THIS PROJECT to include sequels illustrated shorts or simply upgrade the rewards.

I have enough written material to put down approx 2000 pages of story (and counting). 20 years of story building bears enough fruits believe me.

If you can't afford any of the rewards but still want to show your support, there's loads of ways you can show some love for our project! Spread the word, share our project via Facebook, Twitter  and other social media. Tell your friends and let them know all about us! And be sure to like us on our Facebook Page (Twitter here) and come and say hi!

Without your help the universe will be destroyed... Just saying :)

Eventually their paths cross but the results of their actions will cause a butterfly affect that will uncover the greatest threat to life the universe will ever know.
Not even the gods will be safe from what will come of these events..
 

 
Ok I get it, so what about the rewards?
I have put together so much exclusive content this could end up being the “Ultimate limited edition” project.
The original 10 page graphic novel is up for grabs.
The original sound track produced by Enjoylife Productions in London. This classical orchestrated soundtrack is also something that has never been released and I have no plan to do so. ( samples can be heard in the video & on the main website www.kmassop.com )
Posters of some of the artwork done by Deviantart’s greatest (Genzoman, Garang, Raapack etc)
The first rights to the 2nd edition of the written novel (this will be made available to backers at least 3 months before official release)
Become a Fate Of The Gods character in the graphic novel (and not some character who will die in the first scene, a character who will feature throughout the story and on the front cover*)
Vote for the Fate Of The Gods cover and much much more.
Every penny raised will go to the production & publishing of this project and should we go over our target I WILL EXTEND THIS PROJECT to include sequels illustrated shorts or simply upgrade the rewards.
I have enough written material to put down approx 2000 pages of story (and counting). 20 years of story building bears enough fruits believe me.
If you can't afford any of the rewards but still want to show your support, there's loads of ways you can show some love for our project! Spread the word, share our project via Facebook, Twitter  and other social media. Tell your friends and let them know all about us! And be sure to like us on our Facebook Page (Twitter here) and come and say hi!  Without your help the universe will be destroyed... Just saying :)

story:
THE BOOK

Panda knows what hoomans are thinking: how does panda write a book that is so good? The answer is because panda is very smart, talented, and handsome. 

"Panda is Still Fat" is a new collection of haikus written and illustrated by Nolen Lee panda. The book contains 90 pages and is available in paperback and hardcover. The book is already completed with over 40 illustrated haikus including several double-paged spreads.

The funds raised will go towards printing, fulfillment, and to supplies and production costs for perks. Below are some page spreads from book.

 

 

WHAT CAN HOOMANS GET

Paperback book: A 90-page perfect bound, high quality book (unsigned).

Hardcover book: The book in hardcover form with a matte finish, signed by panda.

 

Sticker pack:  A sticker pack containing nine die-cut vinyl stickers with one of each character.

 

Art prints: Two giclee fine art prints (shown below) available in 8x10.

Mini & large panda plush: Panda plush with pleather boxing gloves, tested and certified for ages 3+. Available in 10-inch and 6-inch sizes, limited quantities.

Original art: Original 8x10 art commission, limited quantities. Below is a sample.

STRETCH GOALS

Panda now introducing stretch goals for hoomans. Panda will introduce more stretch goals as project gets funded. Hoomans can share Indiegogo campaign with others and get more panda goods. (updated 6/26/2019)

  • $3k: New 5x7 vinyl sticker sheet for every backer. STRECH GOAL UNLOCKED!

  • $5k: 1-1/2 inch panda button for every backer.

  • $7k: Panda also have hooman friend, Penny the Panda Courier. All backers get special 8x10 print.

  • $10k: 3-inch embroidered iron-on bomber patch.

REFERRAL CONTEST

Panda is offering a new referral contest for hoomans. When hoomans back Indiegogo, hoomans can use referral links on listed below that are unique. If another hooman backs the project through these shared links, Indiegogo can track that referral. 

Panda plans on giving out two pieces of original art to hoomans who can get 1) the highest number of referrals and 2) the highest number of contributions through referrals. The highest number of referrals will get Krang Panda, and highest number of contributions will get Elsa Panda.

 

NEW CHARACTERS

Panda is Still Fat features new friends and family of panda. 

Panda’s legal name is Pak P. Panda, but "Panda" is fine too, it's only for paperwork.

Petunia (Mrs. Panda) is avid foodie, craft-maker, and a power planner who always wants everyone to be happy no matter what.

Baby Jr. is always curious and getting into trouble looking for the next biggest thrill.

Randy is Panda’s best friend and is enthusiastic overachiever. He dreams of going to moon.

Topher is good friend of Panda and always like to party hard… sometimes a little too hard.

Chimu has a successful modeling career as world’s cutest cat, but is only in it for the money.

Nop is always there to help out even though he don’t know what he’s doing most of the time.

Summer is very talented and shy painter. She dreams of having her work in museum, but she always gets interrupted.

Buxton is very handy friend. One day he wants to build dam around ocean.

Evil Steve is not really Panda’s friend. Panda not sure why he hangs around.

 

ABOUT PUNCHING PANDAS

Punching Pandas®  is independent brand started by Panda in 2007 in the Seattle area. Panda also has pet hooman named Nolen Lee who does all the work assists Panda with all the artwork and writing. Pet hooman Nolen might say crazy things like he created Punching Pandas®; that he earned a masters in engineering before switching to art; that he worked on games and Disney comics; and that his merchandise has been featured at bookstores (Kinokuniya, Handmade Showroom, Third Place Books), comic conventions (Emerald City Comicon, Rose City Comic Con, Designer Con), and group shows (Q Pop, Gallery 1988). That is why Panda do not let pet hooman out of cage that much. 

"Panda is Still Fat" is the second book from Panda. Panda hopes to make more books like this to take over the world for hoomans to enjoy, so panda need hoomans to spread the word.

 

Panda out.

 

Punching Pandas® is a registered trademark of Nolen Lee. ©2019 Nolen Lee.

story:
Autobiographical Conversations Comic Book

My name is Ryan Claytor and I write and illustrate a series of autobiographical comics titled, And Then One Day.  With your help, I’d like to publish my most recent story arc, Autobiographical Conversations, as a 96-page collected edition.

Autobiographical Conversations centers on a discussion between Harry Polkinhorn (a professor of English who teaches classes on the personal essay) and me (at the time, a graduate student studying Comics and Fine Art) about autobiography, comics, and the intersection of the two. 

I have spent several years researching, developing, and illustrating this project and I’m eager to share it with you in its final collected edition, as I envisioned it from the start.  My hope is that the comics medium will provide a more visual approach to understanding autobiographical theory and framing the subject matter in the context of a conversation will allow the reader to feel more engaged, almost as though they were part of that conversation unfolding. 

What is Needed

The $3,000 goal will allow me to have 1,000 copies of this project professionally offset-printed in a single volume.  While the original mini-comics had print-runs between 100-300 copies per issue, this larger quantity will give me the opportunity to reach a broader audience through national distribution. 

Additions to the collected edition of Autobiographical Conversations:

  • Black-and-white pages have been remastered and will be printed in duotone color;
  • Paper upgrades for both interior and cover stocks;
  • Cover design will feature French folds and foil stamping;
  • New pages featuring supplemental material and behind-the-scenes process information about the creation of this project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you’re not able to make a monetary donation, that’s okay!  I can use some help to spread the word about this new project.  You might consider:

  • Using the Indiegogo share tools;
  • Posting about this project on your website/blog;
  • Tweet/Tumble/Facespacing this website’s URL on your social media outlets;
  • Telling a real, live, person about it when you interact with them in the analog world!

(A personal video is on the way!)

Me and my goal

Hello! My name is Marie Louise, I'm 19 years old and I'm a university student. I'm currently attending the study 'Business IT & Management', which is basically a mix between the regular IT study and a Management study. I'm in my second year, out of the total four years. Halfway there! My life long dream job is something else though.
My campaign us all about my hobby: drawing. I've loved to draw for as long as I can remember and I've started draw 'professionally' around the age of 13. When I started drawing professionally, I also started investing in my materials. I discovered the magic of Copic Markers! They are wonderful tools for traditional coloring and I've used them ever since I bought my first couple of markers. Not only is this my hobby, it is actually my dream to be able to support myself with a job in the drawing/art industry. 
As some of may know, with nice equipment usually comes a nice price tag! Copic markers are pretty expensive. Besides from the coloring tools, I also have to buy Copic marker suited paper (the marker ink will bleed terribly on printer paper :( ).
As I am a university student and live on my own, I don't have much money to fund my hobby with anymore, or anything else for that matter. Not to sound pitiful, but I can barely afford clothes, aiii! I already have a job on the side, but that is only enough for me to be able to pay my gas/electric bill.
To achieve my goal of being able to support myself financially with my hobby, I've noticed that today's art consumers are loving digital art and traditional (cartoon/anime) art is slowly fading to the background. This is why I want to broaden my horizon by also entering the digital art market!
So I've been thinking: in what way should in contribute to the digital art market and hopefully get customers for commissions? What is the one thing you need for producing digital art? Right! A graphical tablet. So I've done some researching a tried out a couple of drawing tablets. So what kind of tablet do I need? One with a screen, because it is closest to traditional drawing and I'm very comfortable drawing with it. So what do I need funding for? The Wacom Cintiq companion, which came out not too long ago. It is the perfect tablet AND laptop in one. I feel very comfortable drawing on it, I can use it just like a laptop and install any drawing program I want to use (unlike the Wacom Cintiq Companion Hybrid, which runs on Android).

So, what's in it for you?

So why the Cintiq Companion and not a cheaper alternative like the Wacom Cintiq 13HD? My current laptop has pretty low specifications and it doesn't run any art programs smoothly, Adobe Photoshop for example. This means it won't get any better on a regular screen tablet. The Cintiq Companion does not only have the benefit of being a laptop, it is also very portable and can be used without having it plugged in! This makes it a lot easier to sketch/doodle directly on my tablet/laptop and makes practicing my digital skills possible anywhere at any time!
  • By donating €5, you will receive a personal thank you e-mail from me!
  • By donating €10 or more, you will receive a personal thank you letter, written on custom stationary, from me!
  • By donating €25, you will receive an original custom sketch drawn by me. This sketch will be of the subject of your choice, so basically it's like a commission!
  • By donating €50, you will receive a custom flat colored drawing by me. This drawing will be of the subject of your choice, so again, basically like a commission! Flat colored means it's colored, but not shaded.
  • By donating €80, you will receive a custom full colored drawing by me. This drawing will be of the subject of your choice, basically a commission, yay!
The subject of the drawing will be discussed by you and me together. Of course I have my things which I won't draw for you, like explicit pornography and explicit violence. You will also get to pick whether you want original art or digital art! Keep in mind though, when you pick digital art it won't come your way immediately since I will first have to buy a graphical tablet haha.
If I do not reach my goal and do not raise enough money for the Wacom Cintiq Companion, I will either save up more money until I do have enough to buy the tablet OR I will have to compromise and buy a cheaper tablet, like the Cintiq 13HD.

So, what if I reach my goal?

This project would not only help me be able to reach my dream, it also means something for you and the rest of the world! You will gain a digital artist who will keep on broadening her horizon and practicing her skills to become the best! You will be able to commission me for digital art commissions and receive some fabulous art to frame and hang somewhere in your house!

Not able to contribute?

Don't worry, I won't get mad at you. I understand that there are a lot of people who are in a similar situation like me, financially wise. So it's not all about money! But then what else can you do to help me with my campaign?

Share this campaign and tell your friends about it! It's not much work and doesn't cost a dime.

Contributors and non-contributors: thank you all and hopefully together we can help another artist get her hobby on track and direct it to becoming more than just a hobby! 

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me :)

story:
Summary

The Zombie Combat Command guarantees the survival of the United States in the event of the impending and inevitable Zombie apocalypse.

It also had its own comics. The two comics that ran side by side were the pre-outbreak series, which was a simple one to four panel standalone episodes and the post-outbreak series, which followed a fireteam from the 10th Mountain Division which is a part of a larger Zombie killing operation in Manhattan, New York.

What We Need & What You Get

The series itself needs to be revitalized and brought back. For that, it needs to justify the time it takes to make a comic series. If we can get enough fans to back the cause, we very well could see the return of Fireteam Bravo and their continuing blood bath in Manhattan. There will be explosions and dead bodies everywhere. All they need is YOUR support!

Those who back their struggles will be rewarded with either a highly coveted Zombie tab, the comic book, or both, depending on the level of support.

    The Impact

    Every bit of support for Zombie Combat Command helps. On a more serious note, the folks at Zombie Combat Command create doctrine and training material containing real life emergency procedures and techniques and use the Zombie medium as a means of student memory retention. So by supporting Zombie Combat Command, you support a bit of everything:

    - Emergency and survival preparedness.
    - Entertainment.
    - Cool gear.

    Also, so far we have kept all of our products 100% American made. By helping us, you are helping us help other American businesses.

      Risks & Challenges

      Our tabs and patches are of the highest quality. However, this also means that production times are not the fastest in the world. We do not have a warehouse full of Chinese made tabs, scrolls, and patches. So delivery could take up to a month after the crowdfunding phase is complete. However, for three years running, everyone who has earned a reward has gotten them.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Join our Zombie Combat Command facebook and subscribe to our website at www.zombiecombatcommand.com. Also we have a twitter @ZombieCombatCMD. Stay connected, and discuss. :)

story:
The Stryde Comic has been in production since 2015.  This limited series is about a retired sidekick Vincent Patterson, otherwise known as Stryde. Stryde has lived a quiet life for 14 years, but when a serial killer is bent on bringing chaos to his city, Vincent must once again become the hero he has always been.

My name is Thomas Retzke and for as long as I can remember I have wanted to make comic books. With completing Stryde, I will be accomplishing that dream.

With your help, we will raise enough funds to print physical copies of the book, help pay our valued team members who have worked so hard on the project with me, and help fund the first issue of the Stryde Series!

Anything you can give is appreciated, we look forward to producing more of these books in the future for all of you!

story:
Stretch Goal Achieved!

Because Jim and Holly were both influenced by the fantastic Red Sonja and Vampirella comics of the past, we wanted to share those influencial visions with you!  Because we achieved this goal, every supporter will receive a free digital pdf edition of Red Sonja Adventures Volume 2 (featuring the story that inspired Jim's cover) and Vampirella Archives Volume 4 (which features some of the stories from the Vampirella Magazine Annual that influenced Holly)!  

Once Upon A Time...

Way back, not quite in the days of yore, but yore-adjacent if you will, two young and talented artists were inspired by tales of a fiery warrior and a fierce creature of the night. Those characters' comic book adventures would grow like magic seeds in our heroic creators' minds and eventually lead to this great adventure in art!  

Jim Balent

As you saw in the video, Barbarian Jim was inspired by the incredible work of Frank Thorne on Red Sonja.  In fact, his special cover is actually an homage to the story "Eyes of the Gorgon" from the legendary Marvel Feature #4 - She Devil With A Sword.  This tale written by Bruce Jones brings Red Sonja face to face with a gorgon turning the townspeople into stone.  If you haven't seen this classic tale from 1976, this is the perfect opportunity to discover it here as we've commemorated the issue with Jim's new cover and are representing the story inside!

 

Holly Golightly

Holly was inspired by the beautiful rendering of Jose Gonzalez so much that she put Vampirella on her yearbook page from high school.  As a youth she identified with the daughter of Drakulon and has channeled that passion into incredible works of art.  Her favorite issue of Vampirella Magazine was the 1972 Annual that featured a cover by Aslan and had a rogues gallery of incredible artists inside including Jose Gonzalez, Wally Wood, Jeff Jones, Tom Sutton, Jerry Grandenetti, Jack Sparling, David Sinclair and Neal Adams!  Its no wonder this issue left such a mark on young Holly as it was 64 pages of pure Vampirella ferocity!  

ORDER ANY OF THE COVERS ABOVE, SIGNED OR UNSIGNED!

PLUS ADD THESE ONE-OF-A-KIND COVERS BY HOLLY!

All sketches shown here are examples of Holly's artwork but do not literally represent the finished product you will receive. All sketches will be unique and at the direction of Holly.

DIGITAL GRAPHIC NOVEL COLLECTIONS!

Read where it all began with this set of TWO DIGITAL graphic novels featuring several classic stories of Red Sonja and Vampirella. "The Adventures of Red Sonja" reprints the first 7 issues of Marvel's classic series. "Vampirella Archives" reprints the first 7 issues of the original "Vampirella Magazine".

T-SHIRTS!

Vampirella or Red Sonja, the choice of one or both is YOURS.

LITHOGRAPHS!

Each premium, oversized lithograph measures 18x24" and is printed on high-quality paper stock.

CGC GRADED COPIES!

Every copy is graded and slabbed by the CGC and guranateed graded at 9.8 or higher.

FRANK THORNE INSPIRED RED SONJA STATUE

This hand-painted, resin statue is modeled after Frank Thorne's iconic cover art and marks the 45 anniversary of Red Sonja. The statue is sculpted by veteran, Steve Kiwus, and stands 12.5" high.

JOSE GONZALEZ INSPIRED VAMPIRELLA STATUE

A hand-painted, resin statue, modeled after Jose Gonzalez's Vampirella magazine cover art marks the 50th anniversary of Vampirella. The statue is sculpted by veteran, Steve Kiwus, and stands 12" high.

EXCLUSIVE TRADING CARD SETS

Your choice of Red Sonja or Vampirella in their own 6-card sets, or get them both and save!

CUSTOM COLLECTIBLE U.S. COINS
story_txt: Stretch Goal Achieved!Because Jim and Holly were both influenced by the fantastic Red Sonja and Vampirella comics of the past, we wanted to share those influencial visions with you!  Because we achieved this goal, every supporter will receive a free digital pdf edition of Red Sonja Adventures Volume 2 (featuring the story that inspired Jim's cover) and Vampirella Archives Volume 4 (which features some of the stories from the Vampirella Magazine Annual that influenced Holly)!  Once Upon A Time...Way back, not quite in the days of yore, but yore-adjacent if you will, two young and talented artists were inspired by tales of a fiery warrior and a fierce creature of the night. Those characters' comic book adventures would grow like magic seeds in our heroic creators' minds and eventually lead to this great adventure in art!  Jim BalentAs you saw in the video, Barbarian Jim was inspired by the incredible work of Frank Thorne on Red Sonja.  In fact, his special cover is actually an homage to the story "Eyes of the Gorgon" from the legendary Marvel Feature #4 - She Devil With A Sword.  This tale written by Bruce Jones brings Red Sonja face to face with a gorgon turning the townspeople into stone.  If you haven't seen this classic tale from 1976, this is the perfect opportunity to discover it here as we've commemorated the issue with Jim's new cover and are representing the story inside! Holly GolightlyHolly was inspired by the beautiful rendering of Jose Gonzalez so much that she put Vampirella on her yearbook page from high school.  As a youth she identified with the daughter of Drakulon and has channeled that passion into incredible works of art.  Her favorite issue of Vampirella Magazine was the 1972 Annual that featured a cover by Aslan and had a rogues gallery of incredible artists inside including Jose Gonzalez, Wally Wood, Jeff Jones, Tom Sutton, Jerry Grandenetti, Jack Sparling, David Sinclair and Neal Adams!  Its no wonder this issue left such a mark on young Holly as it was 64 pages of pure Vampirella ferocity!  ORDER ANY OF THE COVERS ABOVE, SIGNED OR UNSIGNED!PLUS ADD THESE ONE-OF-A-KIND COVERS BY HOLLY!All sketches shown here are examples of Holly's artwork but do not literally represent the finished product you will receive. All sketches will be unique and at the direction of Holly.DIGITAL GRAPHIC NOVEL COLLECTIONS!Read where it all began with this set of TWO DIGITAL graphic novels featuring several classic stories of Red Sonja and Vampirella. "The Adventures of Red Sonja" reprints the first 7 issues of Marvel's classic series. "Vampirella Archives" reprints the first 7 issues of the original "Vampirella Magazine".T-SHIRTS!Vampirella or Red Sonja, the choice of one or both is YOURS.LITHOGRAPHS!Each premium, oversized lithograph measures 18x24" and is printed on high-quality paper stock.CGC GRADED COPIES!Every copy is graded and slabbed by the CGC and guranateed graded at 9.8 or higher.FRANK THORNE INSPIRED RED SONJA STATUEThis hand-painted, resin statue is modeled after Frank Thorne's iconic cover art and marks the 45 anniversary of Red Sonja. The statue is sculpted by veteran, Steve Kiwus, and stands 12.5" high.JOSE GONZALEZ INSPIRED VAMPIRELLA STATUEA hand-painted, resin statue, modeled after Jose Gonzalez's Vampirella magazine cover art marks the 50th anniversary of Vampirella. The statue is sculpted by veteran, Steve Kiwus, and stands 12" high.EXCLUSIVE TRADING CARD SETSYour choice of Red Sonja or Vampirella in their own 6-card sets, or get them both and save!CUSTOM COLLECTIBLE U.S. COINS

story:
We made it to $700!! You guys are so awesome! If we make it to $1000, we'll print t-shirts and you guys get another two-update week! See the campaign updates for more details.~

Our Story

Hi, Sam and Cayt here from Walking on Broken Glass with our third printing project, Issue 3: Of Monsters and Men! This comic is a labor of love from this Artist & Writer duo and it is a labor we're very proud of. For the next 30 days, we're looking to you guys out there to help us realize an important part of this endeavor: printing our work. So I guess you could say, it's a labor of love from all of us, not just Cayt and I!

We've felt extremely lucky to have the fans and support we do. From day one, you've all been behind us in this and it's been so moving! So thank you so much!

As for our comic, Walking on Broken Glass is a supernatural office dramedy romance about MURDER. Itâ€™s about a man dealing with a dark fate looming over his future and his quest to make up for the wrongs of that future in the present. Itâ€™s about a woman with enough strength, determination, love and stubbornness to stand by his side through thick and thin. Itâ€™s about monsters. Itâ€™s about magic. Itâ€™s about werewolves! And witches! And vampires! (Oh my?)

Issue three deals with the mysterious incursion of monsters in the city, and the new recruit to the Wolf pack that protects it. If you like your urban fantasy with a sense of humor as well as gravitas, you'll enjoy our comic.


The Impact

When we set out to create this comic, we knew we would be putting it page by page on the web, but always intended it to be released issue by issue. The end goal for each page and each issue is to see it in print, and we love the idea of getting it to the audience in its intended format.


What We Need & What You Get

We're going to be printing a 40-page comic via RA Comics Direct. It'll be black and white, and in addition to the material you can read on the website, there will be bonus material in the back, such as extra comics, commentary, and sketches! These will only ever be available in the print copies (and ebooks). Now to the nitty gritty! This time, the goal is $500. I'll break that down for you, as far as what the money is going to, exactly.

$300.11 for printing 100 copies of the issue
$15 to ship books to Caytlin
$150 to ship incentives to you guys
$35 for IndieGoGo fees


If we don't make our goal, we'll be printing fewer books -- at least enough to cover the incentives though. And if we're *really* low on donations, the books will be at a lower quality than we were otherwise planning on paying for. So we hope that we make our goal! And we're hoping it so hard that we've made some tiered incentives to unlock (as it were) if we go over the $500. More on that ... right now!


If We Make It Above $500...

There's lots of exciting stuff in store for you!

At $500, $1000, and $1500, we will release an extra page update that week instead of a Thursday sketch bonus!

At $700, we can get two posters printed:


At $1000, we can print t-shirts!

At $1200, we can print some geeky ties!

These extras are priced at these tiers to handle the additional production cost, shipping costs, and IndieGoGo fees likely to be incurred at the higher donation price.

As For the Rest of the Incentives...

Firstly, everyone who donates will get your name in the book and access to our bonus art blog. At the moment there's a ten-page comic "prequel" that was done before the first page of WoBG was complete, as well as some other art. Already in the works to add in is a process walk-through video for drawing the comic, some paper dolls, and more bonus art work and stories!


Secondly, if you are not in the US, please add $5 to your donation to account for shipping. Thank you so much~!


Lastly, if your donation tier says, "plus your choice of one/two/all extras," it means that if we make it to the milestones above $500, you can select your choice from the extra cool stuff we got to make. If we do not make it to a milestone, this part of your incentive tier will be unavailable. Sorry! Please note that each poster design counts as its own "extra." Therefore, if you get the choice of "one extra" you may only choose one poster design.


Now on to the rest of the donation incentives:

At $5, you get a copy of the ebook version. This will include, of course, not only the pages available online but the bonus material too.

At $10, you get a print copy of the book. Huzzah!

At $15, you can get an ACEO sketch card, with an inked sketch of your favorite WoBG character on it!

At $20, you get a copy of the book, in which the artist will do an inked sketch for you, along with a personalized message! Sadly, as we live far apart and can't afford to either get together or ship oodles of books back and forth, they will not be signed.

At $30, you can get all three books! You may choose one to get an inked sketch and personalized message! Plus, you get a bonus bookmark! I like exclamation points!

At $40, you get a copy of the book, a bookmark, plus you can pick some jewelry! I make a lot of jewelry, so if that tickles your fancy, this tier is for you. **Please note: some of the jewelry on that page is not available. We will have a more definite selection available for browsing when the campaign is over. Also, you get a cool dice bag! Plus, if we make it to the extras above the goal, you get to pick one!

Also at $40, you get a copy of the book, a bookmark, and access to a special, private livestreaming event where the artist will take requests and draw them while you watch! It will be three hours long, and it will have limited availability, so make sure you get in now! (Also, you get to pick one of the extra cool things we'll make, if we make it to a milestone above the goal!)

At $60, you get a copy of the book, a bookmark, and you get to commission a short story from me! These will be worked out in private when commissioned. Plus you get a choice of one extra, if we make it above the goal!

At $80, you get either your choice of 2 books or copy of a sketched & personalized issue 3, PLUS a bookmark, your choice of eight pins (we will have NEW PIN DESIGNS this time to choose from as well! Designs forthcoming!), plus a Grey Incorporated mug, plus your choice of TWO of the extras.

At $100, you get either your choice of 2 books or copy of a sketched & personalized issue 3, PLUS a bookmark, your choice of eight pins (we will have NEW PIN DESIGNS this time to choose from as well! Designs forthcoming!), plus an awesome dice bag, plus a Grey Incorporated mug, plus your choice of TWO of the extras.

At $150, you get a copy of issue 3, plus you get to have a cameo in a crowd scene on a page of WoBG, plus a print of that page when it's complete, plus a bookmark (plus your choice of two of the extras!).

And finally, at $500, you get pretty much everything! You get all three comics, all with inked sketches and personalized messages, plus access to the private livestream, plus one of EACH pin, plus a bookmark, plus one of each extra, plus a personalized short story and your choice of jewelry! WHEW!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't pledge money, that's totally fine! You can still help us out by spreading the word! Friends, family, Facebook, Twitter, G+, whatever your fancy! We'll be holding a raffle at the end from people who spread the word via the various social networks. Just let us know by tagging your tweets with @cvilbrandt or @samanthajmathis, or sending us links to your posts or blogs at cvilbrandt@greyinkstudios.com, or sjmathis@greyinkstudios.com.

Please note, if you do it on Twitter and do not get a reply from us that says it's received, poke us. We may have missed it in the truncation that Twitter does on messages.

Thanks so much for checking out our print run and for all the support! You all rock.

story:
RECAP

Hello! Thanks again to everyone who decides to fund this project! All pledges are greatly appreciated, no matter the level. This book means a lot to me, and seeing it funded in any form fills my heart with rainbows and matte black printing.

 

BOOK

Like I said, this baby is going to be sexxy with two x’s. I’m a bit of a print design nerd, so I’ve had a really strong vision of this book ever since I started it. I’m combining the intricacies of Victorian style with sharp modern design. This touches on both the visual content and thematic content of Vixen.

 

The comic itself is 41 pages long, and the book will have at least a dozen pages of exclusive Vixen art and extra material—including original character designs and never before seen illustrations.

 

Here are the book specifications again:
-56 black offset pages (70 lb matte)
-12pt matte cover, ext: black offset + magenta foil press, interior cover: magenta offset

 

The foil press will wrap around the cover like so:


 

And matte covers always feels amazing, so prepare your fingers for touching. It’ll look really hot with the foil press, so you should probably prepare your eyes for seeing as well.

 

REWARDS

Everyone loves rewards! And do you know what the best reward is? MY ETERNAL LOVE.

 

No? Well, okay. Good thing there are actual rewards then.

 

All rewards are cumulative—so whatever level you pledge at, you get every reward below it. (With the exception of the shipping and sketch options, of course.)

$80 LEVEL SKETCH CARDS:

Please indicate which available card I have already made you would like or what character you would like me to draw in your donation. This page will be updated with new art/availability.

#1: TAKEN



#2: AVAILABLE



#3: AVAILABLE



#4: TAKEN


#5: AVAILABLE


Aaand since apparently Indiegogo only lets you have 12 perk options, HERE ARE THE ONES NOT LISTED:

 

GIVE $120 OR MORE:
You get an exclusive, original 9”x12” b/w watercolor art for Vixen! This includes shipping to anywhere in the world.
LIMIT 3

Please indicate what # you would like in your donation. This page will be updated with new art/availability.

#1:

 

STATUS: TAKEN

#2: WIP

#3: WIP

GIVE $240 OR MORE:
You get an exclusive, original 11”x14” color watercolor art for Vixen. This includes shipping to anywhere in the world.
LIMIT 2

Please indicate what # you would like in your donation. This page will be updated with new art/availability.

#1:

STATUS: AVAILABLE


#2: WIP

SHIPPING: 

All books/prints/art will be shipped First Class via USPS in a padded envelope. Larger prints will be shipped in a tube, and original 9”x12” and 11”x14” original art comes matted and shipped in a box.

 

If you have any questions about the comic, book, campaign, or rewards, feel free to shoot me an email at Lucid_K@hotmail.com.

story:
Último UPDATE:
ESTA CAMPAÑA HA TERMINADO / THIS CAMPAIGN IS DONE.


Con la cantidad recaudada se imprimirá una pequeña tirada muy limitada, y únicamente en idioma español. Casi todos los ejemplares ya están adjudicados, pero quizá sobren unos pocos para la venta. Si estás interesado en obtener un ejemplar, síguenos en nuestra página de facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/HOME-the-comic/114414695366958 o en nuestro blog http://homebd.blogspot.com.es/ para mantenerte informado y conocer el avance del proyecto.

 

¡Muchas gracias a todos por vuestro apoyo!

Thank you very much for your support!

+

 

(Para leer esto en ESPAÑOL: https://www.facebook.com/note.php?saved&&note_id=121446667997094&id=114414695366958 o búscalo en la sección UPDATES, en la parte superior de esta página)

HOME está disponible en español e inglés, y es un cómic exclusivo de esta campaña. Una vez terminada ya no podrá comprarse. 

HOME is available in english and spanish, and it's an exclusive comic for this IndieGoGo campaign. It will be not available anymore.

 

Good morning, recruits!

Our names are Raul and Oscar, and we’d like to introduce you our comic series called HOME.

All the great stories always begins with a crashed spacecraft

HOME is a futuristic Sci-Fi Comic Miniseries about a military rescue spacecraft crashed in an impossible planet. Trapped there, the stranded crew of Space Marines must fight against the first extra-terrestrial life form discovered by humans: a brutal and vicious alien species. But there they will discover something else: a huge mystery that puts in risk the survival of all life in the galaxy. 

Who watch the watchers?

But actually, this is a story about characters. They are space marines, medical, scientists, but men and women in the end that need to trust in one another to survive. A hard duty, as they are all hiding many dark secrets. 

Welcome to the future, a vast dark place

So this is a Sci-Fi story, but it is about revenge and forgiveness, regret and honor, anger and love, and of course, the discovery of the secrets of the universe. These are the elements that form an intricate puzzle between the past of the characters and the future of the human kind. 

The castaways

HOME is a classic Sci-Fi inspired adventure recommended for grownups, looking like a Hollywood movie mixing Blade Runner, 2001 and the Alien trilogy, and with a narrative style inspired by some of the best Sci-fi-drama TV series like Battlestar Galactica, Firefly or Lost.

These are some pages:

Volume # 1 cover
Page # 3
Page # 4
Page # 20
Page 23
Page 24
Page 40
Page 2

___________________________________________________________________________________

The HOME project background:

HOME # 1 was published in France in 2008 and it was part of a 6 volumes miniseries. Unfortunately only that volume # 1 was released. Now, we want to revive the series our own way and publish a NEW VERSION in English and Spanish, if we meet our goal.

We want to print this new version of the volume # 1, but in a REDUX version: a remade and extended softcover edition with about 64 full-color pages including some unpublished pages that extends the plot, full of extra and unpublished material (sketches, deleted material, character design, concept art, and much more).

In addition to that we want to print also a hardcover Deluxe Limited Edition (English only).

Softcover edition and hardcover DELUXE LIMITED EDITION + extra material

Some content included in the Hardcover Deluxe Limited Edition, now in the Softcover Edition too:

Extra stuff: character design
Concept art
Sketches (starship USS U-426, characters, aliens, weapons, props...)
United Nations Marine Corps personal files (censored until now)

___________________________________________________________________________________

The challenge:

The remake of the volume # 1, the creation of the Limited Edition and the character prints, the translations, the print, the platform fees and taxes, and the manufacturing and shipping costs for an endeavor like this would be roughly $20,000, and that’s where we’ll need your help. If you’re interested in giving us your support, please take a look at the list of rewards and perks. If we meet our goal, the comic will be printed this winter, and you could pre-order one if you like.

And then, maybe, we could bring you the rest of the episodes of this exciting story about these survivors that will change the course of the human history while trying to come back home...

Volume # 2 cover...

You can see some art and read more about the project in our HOME blog here. And don't forget to follow us in our page of Facebook and help us to spread the project!

Thank you SO MUCH for your help.

Dismissed!

Trailer credits:

Trailer: Raúl Arnáiz (Facebook and Blog)

Music: "Proditionis" by Epic Soul Factory http://epicsoulfactory.bandcamp.com/
