story_txt:
Último UPDATE:ESTA CAMPAÑA HA TERMINADO / THIS CAMPAIGN IS DONE.
Con la cantidad recaudada se imprimirá una pequeña tirada muy limitada, y únicamente en idioma español. Casi todos los ejemplares ya están adjudicados, pero quizá sobren unos pocos para la venta. Si estás interesado en obtener un ejemplar, síguenos en nuestra página de facebook https://www.facebook.com/pages/HOME-the-comic/114414695366958 o en nuestro blog http://homebd.blogspot.com.es/ para mantenerte informado y conocer el avance del proyecto.
 
¡Muchas gracias a todos por vuestro apoyo!
Thank you very much for your support!
+
 
(Para leer esto en ESPAÑOL: https://www.facebook.com/note.php?saved&&note_id=121446667997094&id=114414695366958 o búscalo en la sección UPDATES, en la parte superior de esta página)
HOME está disponible en español e inglés, y es un cómic exclusivo de esta campaña. Una vez terminada ya no podrá comprarse. 
HOME is available in english and spanish, and it's an exclusive comic for this IndieGoGo campaign. It will be not available anymore.
 
Good morning, recruits!

Our names are Raul and Oscar, and we’d like to introduce you our comic series called HOME.

All the great stories always begins with a crashed spacecraft
HOME is a futuristic Sci-Fi Comic Miniseries about a military rescue spacecraft crashed in an impossible planet. Trapped there, the stranded crew of Space Marines must fight against the first extra-terrestrial life form discovered by humans: a brutal and vicious alien species. But there they will discover something else: a huge mystery that puts in risk the survival of all life in the galaxy. 

Who watch the watchers?
But actually, this is a story about characters. They are space marines, medical, scientists, but men and women in the end that need to trust in one another to survive. A hard duty, as they are all hiding many dark secrets. 


Welcome to the future, a vast dark place
So this is a Sci-Fi story, but it is about revenge and forgiveness, regret and honor, anger and love, and of course, the discovery of the secrets of the universe. These are the elements that form an intricate puzzle between the past of the characters and the future of the human kind. 

The castaways
HOME is a classic Sci-Fi inspired adventure recommended for grownups, looking like a Hollywood movie mixing Blade Runner, 2001 and the Alien trilogy, and with a narrative style inspired by some of the best Sci-fi-drama TV series like Battlestar Galactica, Firefly or Lost.
These are some pages:

Volume # 1 cover

Page # 3

Page # 4

Page # 20

Page 23

Page 24

Page 40

Page 2
___________________________________________________________________________________
The HOME project background:
HOME # 1 was published in France in 2008 and it was part of a 6 volumes miniseries. Unfortunately only that volume # 1 was released. Now, we want to revive the series our own way and publish a NEW VERSION in English and Spanish, if we meet our goal.
We want to print this new version of the volume # 1, but in a REDUX version: a remade and extended softcover edition with about 64 full-color pages including some unpublished pages that extends the plot, full of extra and unpublished material (sketches, deleted material, character design, concept art, and much more).
In addition to that we want to print also a hardcover Deluxe Limited Edition (English only).

Softcover edition and hardcover DELUXE LIMITED EDITION + extra material
Some content included in the Hardcover Deluxe Limited Edition, now in the Softcover Edition too:

Extra stuff: character design

Concept art

Sketches (starship USS U-426, characters, aliens, weapons, props...)

United Nations Marine Corps personal files (censored until now)
___________________________________________________________________________________
The challenge:
The remake of the volume # 1, the creation of the Limited Edition and the character prints, the translations, the print, the platform fees and taxes, and the manufacturing and shipping costs for an endeavor like this would be roughly $20,000, and that’s where we’ll need your help. If you’re interested in giving us your support, please take a look at the list of rewards and perks. If we meet our goal, the comic will be printed this winter, and you could pre-order one if you like.
And then, maybe, we could bring you the rest of the episodes of this exciting story about these survivors that will change the course of the human history while trying to come back home...

Volume # 2 cover...
You can see some art and read more about the project in our HOME blog here. And don't forget to follow us in our page of Facebook and help us to spread the project!
Thank you SO MUCH for your help.
Dismissed!
___________________________________________________________________________________
Trailer credits:
Trailer: Raúl Arnáiz (Facebook and Blog)
Music: "Proditionis" by Epic Soul Factory http://epicsoulfactory.bandcamp.com/
SFX: freeSFX http://www.freesfx.co.uk/

story:
Please click on the image of Pitch Book Cover above to explore the Interactive Pitch Book for The Misguided Adventures of Cadiman!!!

In 2008, Kevin Amodia, the creator of Meltin' Pot Productions began the creation of his dream and in 2013 he is ready to share it with the world on a whole other level...

About the cartoon:

The Misguided Adventures of Cadiman is the first "Almost Reality Animated Series" developed by Kevin Amodia as a way to showcase the music, comedy, acting, and talents of fellow East Bay, California artists that are trying to make a name for themselves. It is an animated comedy, following the misadventures of a cape sporting, urban entrepreneur who solves mysteries with the help of his often eccentric and loose lipped friends.

Starring the comedy stylings of Stephen "Smiddy" Smithey, ToneWeez (Tony Patten), Schol@r (Kevin Amodia), Ron Tate & voices from Jesus Garcia and Dennis Hazleton, Cadiman is a cartoon about a day with your closest friends making jokes about each other and each others moms with a dose of adventure in every episode.  Cadiman has a way of dropping an extremely subtle, yet very apparent message, camouflaged by gratuitous dirty jokes,  hip hop references, ethnic and gender slashes that are sure to have you rolling and/or appalled. Either way you will totally LOVE it!

On the next page you can watch the edited version of our PILOT episode, Never2old.com!

The Next Step...

Kevin has spent hours upon hours creating this cartoon from scratch. He is the illustrator, the writer, the editor, the animator, and the producer of this whole production. It is his goal to make his dream come true and bring along all of his closest friends with him. 

In order to do this...we need your help.  We are planning to pitch this series to as many tv networks as we can. (HBO, Comedy Central, AdultSwim, etc.) We have created a proper Pitch Book for the networks and an Online Interactive Document. However there are a few other things that we need your help and support in putting together and below or just a few examples of some of the things we need to accomplish.

  • We need to find a Literary agent.
  • We need to print out copies of the Pitch Book and put together a supreme presenation that won't be forgotten.
  • We need to develop a toy or other merchandise that will show that the cartoon is marketable.

By Aug 1, we plan to be residents of Los Angeles and really go for it all...

This is where you come in...  :)

So many of you have helped in so many ways by sharing episodes, helping us get likes and support on Youtube and Facebook and we appreciate it all. Every little thing helps us get exposure and get more fans. 

We are asking for our family, friends, fans and potential investors to come together and help us with this one last step.  Any donation is greatly appreciated.  Even if it is $1.00, that is $1.00 closer to making Kevins dream come true. His talent, dedication, and motivation are meant to be seen.  

Help be a part of this incredible journey and see Cadiman on a primetime slot sooner rather than later! Please donate today!

 

Warmest regards,

The Cadiman Crew & Meltin' Pot Productions

 

To see more about Meltin' Pot Productions and to explore the Interactive Cadiman Pitch Book...please visit 

http://www.meltinpotpro.com/cadiman-pitch.html.

Please also visit both our facebook pages and "Like" each one! 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Meltin-Pot-Productions/323724017750524?fref=ts

https://www.facebook.com/cadimancartoon?fref=ts

 

© Meltin' Pot Productions, 2013 All Rights reserved

story:
The Story

Hannah grows up in the American Midwest, and one day while exploring with her trusty dog Mojo she comes across a secret government lab. As she sneaks into the lab a terrifying tornado creates a massive electrical storm which electrocutes the computer that she and Mojo are hiding in. They are instantly "Departicalized" and uploaded to the Internet.

Hannah and Mojo become half human and half data.

The eGirl story is a coming of age story in a technology driven world. It is full of excitement, death, action, heartbreak, passion, vigilence, truth, drama and of course love!

eGirl grows up to be the toughest and most ruthless fighter of cybercrime and the 1st Superhero of the internet. Follow her and her trusty sidekick Megabite through their battles in Cyberspace and around the world.

Through an interesting turn of events a bizarre situation will eventually put her in a position where she can save the world.

 

Read the first 2 Chapters - eGirl.com

 

A few sample pages

 

 

The People

Robert Jennings - Creator and Writer - Studied Fine Art and Computer Design at the University of Cape Town. At University in 1991/92 he tutored computer graphics, (Photostyler, Freehand, Pagemaker, Corel Draw) on Windows 3.1, ever since he has created along the ever expanding nerve of the digital revolution. Robert is a full time artist and a keen Technologist. He is co-founder of Arte por Los Ninos (Art for Children).

 

David Thrasher - Storyboards and Illustration - Studied art in Hamilton , Ontario, Canada and animation at Sheridan College, Ontario. He has had a  long career in animation doing storyboards for major intenational companies like Disney and Nelvana, working on projects like Care Bears Movie, Doug, Rollie Pollie Ollie, Inspector Gadget, Duckman, Rock n Rule, The Devil & Daniel Mouse, Ghost Busters, Ninja Turtles, Where on Earth is Carmen Diego, Noddy in Toyland and Heavy Metal. He has an Art Gallery and continues to teach Art at his own school while doing illustration. "The eGirl project I am working on now is a wonderful adventure in the Cyberworld with interesting characters and  a strong storyline. I hope the viewers enjoy the comic and follow Hannah & Mojo's unfolding drama."

 

Funding and Incentives

To Finish Book 1 we need to finish off Chapter 3 and 4. Your funding will allow us to focus our time on completing this goal. We will complete the rough script, the rough story boards, the final script, the finished art and then the final publications.

 

Most of the money will be used to create:

Limited edition giclee (canvas) - only 150 will be made of each artwork.

Limited edition prints - only 250 will be made of each artwork.

Limited edition coffee table book - only 1000 will be printed, EVER!.

Soft Cover Book 1

T-Shirts

Posters

Post cards

Stickers

 

We really do need your help and in return we will send you some cool stuff!

 

Here are the 4 panels from the story that we will make into the limited edition prints, Giclee's, Posters and Postcards for the incentives. They will be numbered 1 through 4.

 

Panel 1. Hannah and Mojo get shocked and departicalized in the Super Computer



Panel 2. Hannah realises what has just happened to her and Mojo.


Panel 3. Hannah realises where her new knowledge comes from.


Panel 4. Hannah and Mojo get pulled into the Internet



Here is what a Limited Edition Giclee (Canvas) print will look like on your wall. Only 150 of these will ever be printed. They will be editioned and signed.



Here is a limited edition print on paper. Only 250 of these will ever be printed. They will be editioned and signed.



Here is the Limited Edition Coffee table Book. Only 1000 of these will be printed. It is signed and editioned with your name inside!



Here is the eGirl T-Shirt.

 

 

Here is the eGirl Bumper Sticker.



 

Our Packages




 

 

 

 

 

 

 



 

 

 

*SHIPPING*

Any BOOK shipments to Canada or Mexico please add $10 and any to Europe and the rest of the world, please add $15.

Any BOOK and ART shipments to Canada or Mexico please add $15 and to Europe and the rest of the world, please add $20.

 

Your Contribution

We really do need your help to finish our project and any pledge is very much appreciated. 

We will work tirelessly to make the first book of eGirl a memorable one which you can treasure for a lifetime.

If you cannot contribute we understand but please do pass on our project to your contacts so they might make a pledge. You can just click on the Indiegogo share tool and share it on Facebook or Twitter.

 

The Future of eGirl

We are currently making a 3D doll, Gadget belt, fashion outfit and Halloween costume so look out for those items soon at eGirl.com.

 

Thank you for looking at our project and have a great day on the internet!

story:
Hi, my name is Kris, and I'm in the middle of creating an awesome horror-fantasy comic. Imagine the anime "Berserk" mixed with "The Walking Dead" comic. It's deep. It's dark. It's graphically violent. It starts off pre-zombie apocalypse and then builds up to the dead rising and the living falling.

I have approximately 11 pages of the 22 needed for completion already done. I've been working on this with an illustrator for about 2 months now, and he needs 8 more weeks to finish illustrating. 

My goal here is to raise money for a printing of 1,000 copies of this comic to distribute to you guys, and to comic stores in the region. I'm doing this to try to build a fan-base or readership of my work. 


Besides being just awesome for it's artwork and story, I think my comic has social value because I have characters from all across the LGBTQ spectrum fully represented in my work in non-stereotypical ways.


I also have the first mentally challenged special needs character in a comic book. I focus on his heroic life and heroic actions. I'm writing him from my personal experiences with my mentally challenged special needs friends. 


Check out the gallery for more bits about the story with each piece of art!

Or check out my successful Kickstarter Campaign:




What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,250 for this printing. This includes the Indiegogo and payment processing fees, and shipping. All money raised is going towards this print.

If we don't reach our goal here, the money will go towards a smaller print run. 

In return, you will get the digital copy emailed to you when it is completed by September 2016, and at least one physical copy mailed to you (signed or unsigned up to you) by October 2016.

Pictured above is the line-art for "Sorengaard". See him fully colored in the gallery section.


Pictured above is a Gottlieb shirt. Check the pledge tiers to get yours!


Above is a Sorengaard shirt. Check the pledge tiers to get yours!


Above is the front side of both the Sorengaard and Gottlieb shirts. A third graphic will be released in a couple of days!! 

Your Impact

Without your support, cool indie horror-fantasy comics like this one won't ever be produced, printed and shipped to stores for others to see and discover. You can help propagate new ideas and unique stories that are not necessarily commercial blockbusters like the typical super hero comics are, but are all the more important for that very same reason.  


Risks & Challenges

My illustrator and I are working very closely and well together. I have funding for the completion of issue 1 of this comic. The only complication might be in printing, where the printer has unforeseen delays.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help, but have no funds at hand to do so, please share this page to all your social media. Share it with friends and family that you think might want to donate, and give them a reason as to why you think they should. Nothing beats a personal message from a friend! 

Don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools as well. They make it easy to do all of this. 

Thank you!!! :)

story:
RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN! 

TOXIC FEMINISM and EXTREME MASCULINITY COLLIDE IN THIS EPIC ADVENTURE! 

"Two Army Veterans crash in a mystical jungle populated by a lost tribe of Warrior Women that hunt men, enslave them and then kill them. They must escape, adapt to survive, or die trying."

Prolific writer Mr. Chuck Dixon is known for his legendary writing at DC Comics on iconic titles such as BATMAN, where he helped create the key character of BANE. He has also written on other mega-hit titles for MARVEL Comics including The Punisher and many many more!

Mr. Dixon has joined forces with Benjamin L. Henderson, Founder, Writer, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief of Cautionary Comics to develop original action-packed comic book stories set in the CAUT!ONVERSE! They are joined on RAVAGE by Artistic Powerhouses Jimbo Salgado and Bryan Arfel Magnaye as well as the entire team at Cautionary Comics to create the NEW and ORIGINAL Title RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN!

We are well on our way to our next tier!! We have the entire 120pages of the RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Saga!  All we need is YOU!

MR. CHUCK DIXON

Chuck Dixon is a veteran comic book writer with thousands of titles to his name including a record run on  BATMAN at DC Comics (where he co-created the villain BANE) and seminal work on Marvel’s The Punisher.

BENJAMIN L HENDERSON

Benjamin L Henderson, Writer of over 50 original titles such as RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN, The Magus: Inner Demons and The Offworlder: The Protectors of Sa'Ra. Ben is the Founder, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief Cautionary Comics.

JIMBO SALGADO

Jimbo is Art Director and Artist currently working on RAVAGE #1 and THE MAGUS: Inner Demons. Jimbo has a unique and innovative expression all his own. His works include DC Batman Arkham Unhinged, Team 7 #3, Judge Dredd #7, Toy Packaging Art for Hasbro Publishing, Transformers More than Meets the Eye Annual work for IDW Publishing, Trading Card Work for Upperdeck Entertainment, He is also a Cover Artist for Different Publishing Studios like Heavy Metal Magazine, Zenescope Entertainment, Titan Comics and Valiant Entertainment.

BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYE

Bryan Arfel Magnaye is a comic book colorist wizard! He graduated in multimedia arts and design for post-secondary education as well as many seminars and trainings. He has worked for Glasshouse Publishing, God n Bone Animations, and Zenescope Entertainment.

Bryan is currently working on Ravage: Kill All Men and The Magus: Inner Demons.

THE STORY

The RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN saga takes place in the mystical land of The PROTECTORI, home to an Ancient Race of Warriors that are sworn to stop the Evil of The LIZZARSIN, The FIRST ONES, members an ancient Cult from a long forgotten race that worship nothing but their lust and the One-Eyed Demon. The Evil GENERAL RAK of the LIZZARSIN has spent an eternity hunting ANDRAMAK, The Queen Of The Protectori and her Warriors.

The "General" and his Cult of Devil Worshiping Assasians, attack all those that look, think or feel differently, Children, The Sick, The Elderly Protectori Women in the Old Temples, nothing is held sacred to the snakelike "warrior" cult. The tears of the Old feed their dark souls while the cooked bodies of children feed their bellies. All those that are not a part of their hive are an abomination to be ridiculed, attacked and enslaved. Women are simply meant to be used in their Dark Society.

Ravage is part of the CAUTIONVERSE, a fully developed comic book universe of over 50 NEW and ORIGINAL Titles!  Our leadership team is filled with experienced mature professionals with a track record of turning in projects ON TIME that benefit corporations and customers alike and now we are bringing our Professional Work Ethic to our new Comic Book Company and need help to continue to grow! Help us bring the CAUTIONVERSE into Existence!

The Cautionary Comic rocket ship is ready to launch! The last piece of this ship is YOU, our AMAZING future fans! 

 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
story_txt:
RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN! 
TOXIC FEMINISM and EXTREME MASCULINITY COLLIDE IN THIS EPIC ADVENTURE! 
"Two Army Veterans crash in a mystical jungle populated by a lost tribe of Warrior Women that hunt men, enslave them and then kill them. They must escape, adapt to survive, or die trying."

Prolific writer Mr. Chuck Dixon is known for his legendary writing at DC Comics on iconic titles such as BATMAN, where he helped create the key character of BANE. He has also written on other mega-hit titles for MARVEL Comics including The Punisher and many many more!
Mr. Dixon has joined forces with Benjamin L. Henderson, Founder, Writer, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief of Cautionary Comics to develop original action-packed comic book stories set in the CAUT!ONVERSE! They are joined on RAVAGE by Artistic Powerhouses Jimbo Salgado and Bryan Arfel Magnaye as well as the entire team at Cautionary Comics to create the NEW and ORIGINAL Title RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN!
We are well on our way to our next tier!! We have the entire 120pages of the RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Saga!  All we need is YOU!
MR. CHUCK DIXON
Chuck Dixon is a veteran comic book writer with thousands of titles to his name including a record run on  BATMAN at DC Comics (where he co-created the villain BANE) and seminal work on Marvel’s The Punisher.
BENJAMIN L HENDERSON
Benjamin L Henderson, Writer of over 50 original titles such as RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN, The Magus: Inner Demons and The Offworlder: The Protectors of Sa'Ra. Ben is the Founder, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief Cautionary Comics.
JIMBO SALGADO
Jimbo is Art Director and Artist currently working on RAVAGE #1 and THE MAGUS: Inner Demons. Jimbo has a unique and innovative expression all his own. His works include DC Batman Arkham Unhinged, Team 7 #3, Judge Dredd #7, Toy Packaging Art for Hasbro Publishing, Transformers More than Meets the Eye Annual work for IDW Publishing, Trading Card Work for Upperdeck Entertainment, He is also a Cover Artist for Different Publishing Studios like Heavy Metal Magazine, Zenescope Entertainment, Titan Comics and Valiant Entertainment.
BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYE
Bryan Arfel Magnaye is a comic book colorist wizard! He graduated in multimedia arts and design for post-secondary education as well as many seminars and trainings. He has worked for Glasshouse Publishing, God n Bone Animations, and Zenescope Entertainment.
Bryan is currently working on Ravage: Kill All Men and The Magus: Inner Demons.
THE STORY
The RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN saga takes place in the mystical land of The PROTECTORI, home to an Ancient Race of Warriors that are sworn to stop the Evil of The LIZZARSIN, The FIRST ONES, members an ancient Cult from a long forgotten race that worship nothing but their lust and the One-Eyed Demon. The Evil GENERAL RAK of the LIZZARSIN has spent an eternity hunting ANDRAMAK, The Queen Of The Protectori and her Warriors.
The "General" and his Cult of Devil Worshiping Assasians, attack all those that look, think or feel differently, Children, The Sick, The Elderly Protectori Women in the Old Temples, nothing is held sacred to the snakelike "warrior" cult. The tears of the Old feed their dark souls while the cooked bodies of children feed their bellies. All those that are not a part of their hive are an abomination to be ridiculed, attacked and enslaved. Women are simply meant to be used in their Dark Society.
Ravage is part of the CAUTIONVERSE, a fully developed comic book universe of over 50 NEW and ORIGINAL Titles!  Our leadership team is filled with experienced mature professionals with a track record of turning in projects ON TIME that benefit corporations and customers alike and now we are bringing our Professional Work Ethic to our new Comic Book Company and need help to continue to grow! Help us bring the CAUTIONVERSE into Existence!
The Cautionary Comic rocket ship is ready to launch! The last piece of this ship is YOU, our AMAZING future fans! 
 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

story:
My hooman is named Coree Spencer. She's been doing stand up comedy for 6 years and still can't get her shit together. She got booked for this comedy festival and can't even go because she's dumb.

  • My name is Milford. I'm a cat. I have needs.
  • This is important to me because if Coree -my hooman, can afford the ticket to California, I can throw a party and get some pussy pussy. (cat vag, don't judge me)
  • She got into this comedy festival and booked a few comedy shows (including a 30 min headlining spot in San Francisco) and the ticket was double the price it was the last time she checked. Now she's telling me she can't go and I am pissed off.
  • Did you know all comedians are broke? That's why she feeds me garbage off the street. (Okay, fine, but it's debatable that Friskies is garbage.) Any extra money will go to getting me better food than this crap.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The plane ticket from New York to San Francisco is averaging $500-$600 right now. Let's just get her there. I don't care what happens to her after that, She's on her own. I need a peice of tail and that can't happen as long as she's breathing down my furry neck.  
  • She's doing stand up and a live stage read show of Saved By The Bell in both the festival (Savage Henry Shits and Giggles Comedy Festival in Humboldt) as well as in San Francisco. There's at least 10 other people involved in the stage read show between both cities. But if she can't get there, there's no show. And I'm still horny.
  • I am offering my unique services as a cat to you. (selfies, short videos, songs etc.) I may include the hooman if I feel like it.
  • If I can't raise the money to send her away, I will make a cat paradise complete with concubines. Or I will give hooman the money for her to travel somewhere and put on a show closer to home, but really, I just don't want her here.

This is absolutely real and I am a great cat with many talents. I grew up on the rough streets of New York. Don't make me cut you. I'm desperate.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    No money either? I know the feeling. I'm a cat. No one pays me for anything. You can help us out by

    • Sharing this! Maybe someone you know wants to help a cat in need of pussy.

story:
Here's the deal:

My name is Greg Bach, I'm a comedian and I'm doing a show on Thursday 6/4 and I would like to raise as much money as possible to help at-risk LGBT youth here in Milwaukee. This issue is very important to me, because a child should NEVER feel the only option he or she has is life on the street, simply because they want to live open and honestly.

This show will feature performers from the community who will speak on their experiences. This is a comedy show and aims to present uplifting stories for all to hear and show that nobody is truly alone. 100% of the money raised from the show will go to Project Q, the youth services division of the LGBT Community Center of Milwaukee.

The statistics on at-risk LGBT youth are very well documented and frankly I could quote the Center for Disease Control on what they go through on a daily basis, but I shouldn't have to; they're children, they need guidance and you can help, so please, give what you can.

story:
Formerly titled Alphario Vol. 0: REMAKE.

Update 08/25/16: The final page count of Alphario: The World Before α is 48 pages! The book will be officially released this November 19 at Komikon 2016, but I'll be shipping the book to our backers as soon as they arrive. Stay tuned!

Meanwhile, we already sent the digital version of Alphario: The WIP Before α 1/3 to our $7+ backers last August 17 via warf@alphario.com. If you haven't received your copy yet, please leave a comment or hit us an email at alpharioplz@gmail.com!

Update 08/06/16: We released Alphario: The WIP Before α 1/3 (aka the first out of three parts of Alphario: The World Before α) at our local comic book convention Komikon Indieket 2016 a while ago and received great feedback from our readers! We'll be sending a digital version of this to our $7+ backers, so stay tuned these next few days!

Update 04/02/16: We hope you enjoyed our little April Fools' prank yesterday! If you missed it, here's a screenshot: [link]

Update 03/21/16: OUR INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED! THANK YOU FOR HELPING US REACH 124% OF OUR GOAL!

On behalf of myself and my team, thank you for helping us reach not just our campaign goal, but also our first stretch goal of $3,000! Now it's our turn. Rest assured that we'll be doing our utmost best in bringing you the most epic Alphario comic there is... not just in terms of the art, but also the story, publishing, et cetera!

Email updates will be sent out in a couple of days, but in the meantime, enjoy this work-in-progress cover of our upcoming book!

It's been a long ride. Here are some milestones we achieved during the course of our campaign:

  • 08/06/16: Released Alphario: The WIP Before α 1/3 at Komikon Indieket 2016
  • 06/15/16: Increased number of pages from 32 to 44!
  • 04/13/16: Renamed campaign to Alphario: The World Before α
  • 03/21/16: Alphario Vol. 1 DIGITAL sent to $5+ backers!
  • 03/21/16: Campaign ended at 124% of campaign goal!
  • 03/20/16: First stretch goal reached!
  • 03/19/16: Backer-exclusive wallpapers sent!
  • 03/16/16: Alphario Vol. 0 (original) DIGITAL sent to $5+ backers!
  • 02/27/16: Campaign goal reached!
  • 02/10/16: Partnership with FLY Health Hub!
  • 01/20/16: Alphario Vol. 0: REMAKE campaign launched!

Just because our Indiegogo campaign has ended, it doesn't mean that you should stop supporting us. Indiegogo has graced us with an "InDemand" campaign, and I'll get to that once I get everything set up. In the meantime, feel free to continue donating to our campaign if you feel generous and would want to help us reach our second stretch goal!

Hello! My name is Solomon Lim (aka Splgum), and I have been working together with my artist Wai Hoong Chong (aka Stryler) since 2012 on a comic series titled Alphario: The World Connection.

Alphario has been steadily gaining popularity in the Philippines, appearing in multiple television segments and receiving several awards within the past 2 years. Today, the entire lineup of Alphario products include 10 comic books, 2 plushies, assorted button badges, and multiple photo prints—with many more planned in the succeeding months.


What people do not know is that Alphario is commissioned work, and approximately 70% of my monthly income goes into funding the project. I have to admit that there were times that I went negative, but the thought of seeing readers smile and excitedly flip through the pages of a new book always makes me feel that the sacrifice was worth it. Unfortunately, it has come to the point that I need to save for the future. With much hesitation, I considered reducing our number of upcoming book releases and going into an indefinite hiatus... until some friends introduced me to a crowdfunding site called Indiegogo.

So here I am today, and with your help, we can make things happen! But first off...


Imagine winning an all-expense paid trip to the country of your dreams, complete with matching VIP treatment and a private villa for the entire duration of your stay. Life couldn't be any more perfect, you say to yourself. Being the thrill seeker that you are, you decide to go out and explore the nearby woods instead of staying in the confines of your luxury home. You were warned, however, that the place is infested with monsters. You shrug it off. Rumors are rumors unless there are pictures to prove it after all.

Enter the life of 20-year-old photographer Dennis Blake, and welcome to the story of Alphario: The World Connection.

Alphario is an action-adventure series that started as a prank back in 2004, developed into a novel in 2009, and evolved into a comic series in 2011. The story is a well blended mix of genres: from light-hearted ones like comedy and fantasy to much darker subjects like conspiracy and betrayal. Unlike the usual fantasy series, Alphario is unique with its unexpected plot twists. Imagine going through the hero's journey, following his/her steps in an adventure of a lifetime... only to later on discover that he/she is not the good guy we imagined him/her to be.

Last August 2010, Alphario held its first drawing contest in DeviantArt with the theme being prologue. The contest was unexpectedly successful, gathering 190 entries in less than 3 months. In April last year, memories of the contest inspired us to create Alphario Vol. 0, revealing the actual events that led to Dennis' good fortune. We believe in innovation, and in an attempt to make the comic better, we considered several options: experimenting on a new shading style, occasionally adjusting the price of the comic, and figuring out which combination appeals best to the public. Alphario Vol. 0 turned out to be a great success; however, we knew deep inside that we could do better. Much, much better.

With that said, it's time to tell you about our Indiegogo campaign.


We are remaking Alphario Vol. 0, with a target release date of November 19, 2016.

When we say remake, we mean starting with clean slate. While the overall idea of the original Alphario Vol. 0 will still live on, we will be replacing everything else. To make things extra special for our supporters, we are making the remake in full color. Every panel will be a finished illustration, complete with backgrounds drawn with incredible detail.

Below are the first two pages (with dialogues omitted) from the original comic. We took a panel and splashed it with color to give you a rough idea as to what art style we are going to use in the remake.

If you already like the preview as is, imagine how much more you'll enjoy the Alphario: The World Before α once it is in complete!

Also, we figured that it might be helpful for you to know about this:

And that's about it! To conclude, here is our vision statement for this campaign:

  • To create and publish the Alphario: The World Before α
  • To build an international fan base for the Alphario series
  • To promote the works of Alphario's artist Stryler

With your help and support, we'll be able to hit all three birds with one stone!


Alphario has been around since 2009, and while we already have a wide array of perks to offer, we have also prepared new and special ones unique to this campaign for our supporters. We understand that a lot of you might be limited by budget constraints, so we have loaded our lower tiers with added value. Also, keep an eye on our milestone goals; who knows what more you can get from us!

Check out our list of perks on the right side of the page and see if anything suits your fancy. For the price of a cup of coffee, your name will find its place in the comic. For $15, you can get your own copy of the final product. For $100, you will appear inside the Alphario: The World Before α yourself as one of the characters... and most likely appear in a future chapter too once we reach our $3000 milestone goal! If we manage to reach $3800, everyone who supported the campaign will also receive a plushie (just pay for shipping)!


Not at all! In fact, the our $2500 goal is so little and exact that there is only very little to no room for errors on our end. Have a look at our breakdown of expenses:


  • Drawing (48% - $1200)

    • Drawing costs are expensive, taking up the bulk of funds for the campaign. The comic is going to be in full color, and Stryler's asking price is $50 per page. This brings the cost up to $1200 if we do 24 pages.

    I have been working with Stryler for a long time now and have seen the wonders of his coloring. With his skills and my stringent perfectionism (trust me, it's not as bad as it sounds), there is no doubt that the Alphario: The World Before α will not only be a comic but also a beautiful work of art once it is complete.

  • Publishing (42% - $1050)

    • Alphario: The World Before α will have A5 (210mm x 148.5mm) dimensions and 24 pages. The cover will have a special foil stamping and the inside pages will have the same premium and glossy feel you find in the best artbooks.

    I have been working with a specific local printing company since Alphario Vol. 1, and am confident about the quality of prints that they can produce. For the fully colored Alphario: The World Before α, the printing company is requiring a minimum of 500 copies at $850 for 20 pages (+$200 for every additional 4 pages). Doing the math, that's $1050 if the comic ends up with 24 pages.

  • Miscellaneous (10% - $250)

    • You may think: drawing and publishing costs couldn't be the only expenses for the project, and you're perfectly right. While $250 wouldn't be enough to cover our food and electricity bills, it should be enough to provide for supporter giveaways including our special backer-exclusive wallpaper, prints, and other extras. The more you help us achieve, the more you will receive!


Our campaign is a success thanks to your help and support, and production is now in full swing. But why stop here? Help us reach our stretch goals and see how much more we have in store for everyone!

  • $3000 - 4 More Pages (REACHED)

    • Many of the events of Alphario actually happen before the main storyline, and because the Alphario: The World Before α tells the prologue of the series, it is easy expand the comic to reveal important tidbits that we have long kept hidden from the public. Help us reach $3000 and we'll add 4 pages to the book, as well as several elements of mystery that will keep your minds actively thinking!

  • $4300 - Eurid Plushies

    • We have so many big plans for this year, and one of them is to release our third Alphario plushie. If we reach $4300, we will have enough money to have our Eurid Plushies manufactured. And read this: no matter how much you contributed to the project (even $1 will do), our initial backers (those who supported us before our Indiegogo campaign ended) will receive our newest plushie for free... just take care of shipping! The rest will get a hefty discount!


With all the perks and benefits that we are offering, I pray that we do not reach the point of having to worry about not being able to raise enough funds. In the slim chance of this happening, rest assured that because we have set this campaign to flexible funding, you will receive your copy of the Alphario: The World Before α whether we exceed our goal or only earn a few hundred dollars. In worse case scenarios, the release date might have to be pushed to a later month because I have to gather the necessary funds through other means. Other than that, we're cool.

Let me repeat: the comic will be published regardless of how much we earn from this campaign, and you will receive your well deserved perks!


We understand that some of you are more than willing to support our campaign, but lack the funds to do so. No worries! You can help us immensely by spreading the word to your family and friends, be they in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, et cetera. Social networking can work wonders, and by sharing the campaign, you can help make a huge difference!

If you are able to help us monetarily, by all means please do so. Be it a dollar or a hundred, your contribution will help us inch closer and closer to our goal until the campaign is fully funded. By then, we won't have to worry about expenses, and can focus all our time and energy on bringing your our most epic comic release yet.

With all that said, thank you for your support, see you in our eleventh book, and keep warfing!

For $100, you will appear inside the Alphario: The World Before α yourself as one of the characters... and most likely appear in a future chapter too once we reach our $3000 milestone goal! If we manage to reach $3800, everyone who supported the campaign will also receive a plushie (just pay for shipping)!


Not at all! In fact, the our $2500 goal is so little and exact that there is only very little to no room for errors on our end. Have a look at our breakdown of expenses:



Drawing (48% - $1200)
Drawing costs are expensive, taking up the bulk of funds for the campaign. The comic is going to be in full color, and Stryler's asking price is $50 per page. This brings the cost up to $1200 if we do 24 pages.
I have been working with Stryler for a long time now and have seen the wonders of his coloring. With his skills and my stringent perfectionism (trust me, it's not as bad as it sounds), there is no doubt that the Alphario: The World Before α will not only be a comic but also a beautiful work of art once it is complete.
Publishing (42% - $1050)
Alphario: The World Before α will have A5 (210mm x 148.5mm) dimensions and 24 pages. The cover will have a special foil stamping and the inside pages will have the same premium and glossy feel you find in the best artbooks.


I have been working with a specific local printing company since Alphario Vol. 1, and am confident about the quality of prints that they can produce. For the fully colored Alphario: The World Before α, the printing company is requiring a minimum of 500 copies at $850 for 20 pages (+$200 for every additional 4 pages). Doing the math, that's $1050 if the comic ends up with 24 pages.
Miscellaneous (10% - $250)
You may think: drawing and publishing costs couldn't be the only expenses for the project, and you're perfectly right. While $250 wouldn't be enough to cover our food and electricity bills, it should be enough to provide for supporter giveaways including our special backer-exclusive wallpaper, prints, and other extras. The more you help us achieve, the more you will receive!



Our campaign is a success thanks to your help and support, and production is now in full swing. But why stop here? Help us reach our stretch goals and see how much more we have in store for everyone!

$3000 - 4 More Pages (REACHED)
Many of the events of Alphario actually happen before the main storyline, and because the Alphario: The World Before α tells the prologue of the series, it is easy expand the comic to reveal important tidbits that we have long kept hidden from the public. Help us reach $3000 and we'll add 4 pages to the book, as well as several elements of mystery that will keep your minds actively thinking!
$4300 - Eurid Plushies
We have so many big plans for this year, and one of them is to release our third Alphario plushie. If we reach $4300, we will have enough money to have our Eurid Plushies manufactured. And read this: no matter how much you contributed to the project (even $1 will do), our initial backers (those who supported us before our Indiegogo campaign ended) will receive our newest plushie for free... just take care of shipping! The rest will get a hefty discount!



With all the perks and benefits that we are offering, I pray that we do not reach the point of having to worry about not being able to raise enough funds. In the slim chance of this happening, rest assured that because we have set this campaign to flexible funding, you will receive your copy of the Alphario: The World Before α whether we exceed our goal or only earn a few hundred dollars. In worse case scenarios, the release date might have to be pushed to a later month because I have to gather the necessary funds through other means. Other than that, we're cool.
Let me repeat: the comic will be published regardless of how much we earn from this campaign, and you will receive your well deserved perks!


We understand that some of you are more than willing to support our campaign, but lack the funds to do so. No worries! You can help us immensely by spreading the word to your family and friends, be they in Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, et cetera. Social networking can work wonders, and by sharing the campaign, you can help make a huge difference!
If you are able to help us monetarily, by all means please do so. Be it a dollar or a hundred, your contribution will help us inch closer and closer to our goal until the campaign is fully funded. By then, we won't have to worry about expenses, and can focus all our time and energy on bringing your our most epic comic release yet.
With all that said, thank you for your support, see you in our eleventh book, and keep warfing!

story:
Overview

SOS Vol. 1 is an 80 page graphic novel written by me and art by Ibai Canales of successful Indiegogo campaigns such as Iron Sights, the Abductables, and Necromancer! This volume contains issues #1-4 of a multi-issue story line!

SOS is a comedy/action series that chronicles the misadventures of three brothers who were former super soldiers for the US Government during WWII. SOS find themselves coming out of retirement after demons invade earth from their home dimension called the Abyss, led by their brutal Demon King.

The brothers set up a monster hunting business in Brooklyn, New York as they work to stop the demonic invasion and make a profit from it at the same time. The three brothers are all New York has against the demonic invasion.

Combining bad ass action scenes with surreal and dark humor, SOS is a comic that will impress you and make you laugh at the same time.

Written by Chimera

Art, Lettering, and Interior Covers by Ibai Canales

Variant Cover by Alejandro Mirabal

$4000 Stretch Goal: Front Cover by Kim Jacinto

Variant Cover by Alejandro Mirabal

Issue synopsis:

#1: The brothers deal with a group of demons and setup up their monster hunting business SOS.

#2: The brothers are forced to get real jobs after a vigilante monster hunter takes away all their business.

#3: Doctor Mengele, an enemy SOS first encountered in WWII, kidnaps one of the brothers and makes a clone of him to do his dirty work.

#4: The origin of how the brothers received their powers is told. In the climax, SOS fight with Abyss the Demon King.

What We Need & What You Get

As the campaign is only $500 it should be doable to fund this bad boy and send you your book.

STRETCH GOALS

$4,000 - The front cover will be done by Kim Jacinto.

$5,000 – Add 8 pages of story to SOS Vol. 1 

$7,500 - All physical backers will receive a copy of Argonaut #1

$8,000 - Extend Argonaut #1 to 26 pages

$12,000 - Every backer will receive a 21 page digital preview of my next book SOS: Onslaught

ARGONAUT

I am also offering a 22 page cyberpunk comic called Argonaut as a stretch goal. It is the first issue in a six issue mini-series I hope to produce.

Written by Chimera

Drawn by Rafael C.

Colored by Irina Krieger

Lettering by Eric Weathers

Cover by Caanan White

Argonaut takes place in Kansas City in the year 2242. Twenty-five years prior to the series, earth was in a devastating war with another planet and its military force the Argon Empire. This was known as the Earth-Argon conflict.

After the war, technology from the Argon Empire advanced earth significantly. Crime is at an all-time high, corrupt corporations run the world, and police are unable to deal with the level of criminals, so they contract bounty hunters.

The main character is Jason Madsen a bounty hunter. What makes him different from other bounty hunters you may ask? Well, he was trained from birth by a shadowy organization to be a killing machine. He escaped from the organization as a kid and was raised by an Earth-Argon veteran named Jack Chapel.

Jason is tracked down by the shadowy organization to capture a rogue soldier named Erik. With his mentor, the sarcastic AI in his spaceship, a former Yakuza member, and a cyborg space marine, the crew of Argonaut work to capture the rogue soldier.

Cover by Caanan White; colors by Kid Ikaris

Risks & Challenges

This would be my first rodeo when it comes to crowdfunding. With a small crowdfunding goal, there's high probability this campaign will be funded and you will receive this awesome book! The goal is also flexible so whatever funds we have the backers will receive the comic regardless.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if you can't contribute no worries! Just help spread the word via Twitter, Gab, Facebook, Minds.com, and Instagram. Just make sure to share that Indiegogo link!

story: Here at Rymu llc we have been funding all of our own projects but we decided to change things up because "Late Justice" is so different and we are taking more of a chance with this project. Not just having the mini series but the movie as well. So we have paid for everything except for the editing fees which will be about $500. Ryan White and Allen Simmons started rymu two years ago but last November we made it official by actually making it an LLC. Under the banner of our company we have put out two comic books 2 music albums and one ep. we have more in the pipeline and a great 2017 roster still to come. This is to bring more awareness to not just this project but to the entire company. we work with indy talent all of the time and we are constantly looking for new ways to collaborate and make dreams happen

story:
Have you seen Jack? ...


Hello,

And welcome to my indiegogo Campaign Fund. For those of you who don't  already know me I'm Victoria Jeffrey - an actress, producer, comedienne and I'm bringing my brand new one woman show to the Edinburgh Festival. 

As an actress I've worked extensively in all facets of the industry and I've had a varied career ranging from playing Gertrude in Hamlet in front of 1000 people in Copenhagen, to performing in the West End and appearing at the famous Comedy Store in London as one half of the award winning female comedy double act 'The Totally Naff Tarts'. 

My many producing credits include bringing the celebrated Swedish actor Krister Henriksson to The Wyndham's Theatre in the West End in the Swedish National Theatre's hugely successful Production of Doktor Glas.  Krister is best known in the UK for his superb performance in the title role in the Swedish TV adaptation of Hennning Mankell's police drama Wallander. This autumn he will be appearing in final series of 'The Fall' with Gillian Anderson and Jamie Dornan.

I've appeared in many productions at the Festival before, as well as the aforementioned Totally Naff Tarts alongside the wonderful Janet Spike Fullerlove. The critically acclaimed sell out run was a  'Guardian’s Critics Choice' and this year I'm really excited to be going solo for the first time.

What is Dancing With Jack about? …

The show is a funny, sassy, bittersweet poignant look at life.

A tale about love, loss and everything in between ... Oh and then there's Jack ... Who is Jack? … Where is Jack? ... It's hard to go into too much detail about the show without giving the plot away. Suffice to say that there is a Jack for everyone and everyone has a Jack in their lives.

'Dancing with Jack' is based on an original idea I had a few years ago. It combines storytelling, stand up, improv and music.  It was put on hold for a number of years, but now I'm raring to go.  ... So this is where you come in.

What I need and some lovely incentives ...

  • So, what do you get for your buck? I'm trying to raise at least £5,000 to cover the costs of Edinburgh.
  • I have lots of lovely perks! … Well ok … Bribes to reward you with depending on how much you would like to contribute. This includes a virtual hug, to a 'I Danced With Jack T-Shirt' to tickets for the Edinburgh or London Shows with a glass of something bubbly with me afterwards. And maybe Jack as well … But I can't guarantee that … Because Jack is … Well he's just Jack ...

Where will your money go?

  • Venue Hire, 
  • PR and Publicity
  • Posters and Flyers
  • Accommodation 
  • T-Shirts 
  • CD's
  • Costumes, Props
  • Technical Crew

Where its on:

I will be performing at the SpaceTriples Venue 38                                                      
The Prince Building, 19 Hill Place, Edinburgh EH8 9DP.                                                      

It is part of theSpaceUK complex which is one of the most diverse and largest producers of new work at the festival . The venue offers 3 floors, two quite unique performance spaces and a social hub offering daily events and late night music/cabaret showcases. It really is a very special venue at the heart of the fringe.

Future plans for the production 

I am really excited about heading to New York in the Autumn where I have been invited to perform 'Dancing With Jack'.  There are plans for a London run followed by a tour in the New Year.  

Thank you! … 

Your support means everything to me. xx                                                                     

Any contribution large or small could make the all the difference in helping me bring 'Dancing With Jack' to a wonderful eclectic international audience that visit the Edinburgh Festival.  But the costs are much more than I can manage to raise alone. So thank you, thank you, thank you one and all for those of you who will take the time to support myself and Jack. It really does mean the world to me x


Some reviews for The Totally Naff Tarts

'Intelligent, musical &  very, very funny’ (The Heckler)

'It must be said that the capacity audience found the show hugely enjoyable (The Scotsman) 

'Brutal crude & irresistible comedy' (The Observer)

‘A touch of Comical Spice’ (Daily Express)

Other Ways You Can Help

There is a link to my 'Dancing With Jack' Twitter Account - @idancedwithjack   So please feel free to spread the word either by Twitter or by simply talking about it to friends or just random people you meet! ..  And let's get Jack busting some moves on the dance floor in Edinburgh! … Yay! xx

story:
Save Our Souls is that stunning new magazine that you’ve been waiting for. Featuring seriously great writing, comics and illustrations by brilliant writers, journalists and artists. You have to check it out!

The first issue featured creators and writers from UK, Ireland, America, France, Turkey and Sierra Leone.

Amongst them was a Pixar story artist, a Pulitzer Prize winner and the UK's Children's Laureate! Yikes!

The second issue will be just as mighty with work from as varied as Ireland, Philippines, Spain, New Zealand, The Mediterranean, Japan and even Liverpool!!

The mag will be in 16cm x 24cm format, full colour, perfect bound with high quality printing. (Page count to be finalized as creators are added but so far 56 pages and counting!)

At this stage of production we are aiming for a release no later that mid June. Earlier if we can.

The Save Our Souls manifesto...

  •  To be a place that promotes and encourages high quality work while being informative and fun.
  • To help fight the 'work for free and exposure' culture that is infecting the creative fields.
  • To work hard to be a publication that is unique, groundbreaking and 'must own'.


To meet our goals we...

  • We hand-pick and invite our writers and creators fresh from the farm to make sure this will be like nothing produced in the UK before.
  • Includes articles and reports on wide ranging topics and experiences by some of the best writers currently being published in major newspapers, magazines and websites.
  • We crowdfund each issue.

The funds we raise to publish Save Our Souls goes to...

  • High quality printing that does justice to the very lovely artwork and design.
  • So that the first 15 pages of the magazine doesn't have to be full of watch and perfume adverts.
  • We can pay the contributors for their work! The more crowdfunding we raise the more we can pay the creators so please support us all and spread the word!


  • It's also a great help to spread the word for us. Please stick this link wherever you go - http://igg.me/at/sosmag
  • Keep an eye on this page because more creator names and teasers will be added all the time.

  • Save Our Souls is edited by David Ziggy Greene. Best known for his years of illustrated journalism, he has also created work for BBC, Time Out London and numerous publications and created multiple graphic novels. His work can be found at samu.co.uk

    • Here is a taste of Save Our souls #1 available here - saveoursoulsmag.com

story:
Hi! My name is Mike,and i live in Athens,Greece.

I am a painter,tattooer and ink illustrator and usually go under the nickname ''Never Brush My Teeth''.

Sugar Coated Damage is the first comic book i aspire to publish, after a series of illustrated zines i have made the previous years. As a fan of zines and self publishing,i found the idea of crowdfunding suitable for this project and decided to give it a shot :)

To make this project alive,i will need any help that can be provided with this campaign to grab these comic pages i have drawn and conjure a risograph printed comic book out of them :)

 

 

About the Comic

 

Sugar Coated Damage is an ever twisting abstract story,that dives deep into thoughts and comes back to the surface with an uncertain confidence that being damaged or causing damage in any way, may or may not be nicely awful. It is more or less a psychedelic chain of events that transform and fuse together without any good reason.

 

 

It was fully drawn by hand,using a calligraphy brush and sumi ink,spontaneously capturing the abstract flow of the story,as i didn't use any planning sketches.

The whole book is black and white and silent (does not contain dialogue boxes).

Measures approximately 18 x 25,5 cm and is 52 pages long.

This project is entirely personal and of a ''DIY'' nature.When the campaign is completed,the edition will be printed by me using our risograph machine here at Sleep On It Press studio and will then be bound and shipped to you,along with the perks :)

 

What You Get

To make this book real,i will need your support,which you can provide me either financially by selecting one of the perks on the right column or by spreading the word.

I know of course that not everyone is capable of supporting economically, so sharing this campaign with people who might be interested is just as helping and i am just as grateful for :)

All the items in the perks are crafted with love.

These are all the items and more details about them:

 

Computer Screen Wallpaper 

An exclusive,never before published high definition illustration i made just for this project that you can decor your computer screen with.

It will be sent to you via email after the end of the campaign.This is the only non physical item provided in the perks.

Included in ALL the perks excluding the ''Thank you!'' perk.

 

                                                                         *^*^*

''Sugar Coated Damage'' Comic Book

 

Risograph printed silent comic book zine,printed with black, soy based ink.

18 x 25,5 cm

 56 pages total (approx)

paperback

Included in every perk, except ''Thank you!'' and ''Sugar First''.

 

                                                                         *^*^*

 

A5 Black Risograph Print

 

Exclusive risograph print.

Measures 14.8 x 21 cm, printed with black, soy based ink on fine paper.

Included in every perk, except ''Thank you!'' and ''Sugar First''.

 

                                                                         *^*^*

 

A4 Black Risograph Print

Exclusive risograph print.

story_txt:
Hi! My name is Mike,and i live in Athens,Greece.
I am a painter,tattooer and ink illustrator and usually go under the nickname ''Never Brush My Teeth''.
Sugar Coated Damage is the first comic book i aspire to publish, after a series of illustrated zines i have made the previous years. As a fan of zines and self publishing,i found the idea of crowdfunding suitable for this project and decided to give it a shot :)
To make this project alive,i will need any help that can be provided with this campaign to grab these comic pages i have drawn and conjure a risograph printed comic book out of them :)
 

 
About the Comic
 
Sugar Coated Damage is an ever twisting abstract story,that dives deep into thoughts and comes back to the surface with an uncertain confidence that being damaged or causing damage in any way, may or may not be nicely awful. It is more or less a psychedelic chain of events that transform and fuse together without any good reason.
 

 
It was fully drawn by hand,using a calligraphy brush and sumi ink,spontaneously capturing the abstract flow of the story,as i didn't use any planning sketches.
The whole book is black and white and silent (does not contain dialogue boxes).
Measures approximately 18 x 25,5 cm and is 52 pages long.
This project is entirely personal and of a ''DIY'' nature.When the campaign is completed,the edition will be printed by me using our risograph machine here at Sleep On It Press studio and will then be bound and shipped to you,along with the perks :)

 
What You Get
To make this book real,i will need your support,which you can provide me either financially by selecting one of the perks on the right column or by spreading the word.
I know of course that not everyone is capable of supporting economically, so sharing this campaign with people who might be interested is just as helping and i am just as grateful for :)
All the items in the perks are crafted with love.
These are all the items and more details about them:
 
Computer Screen Wallpaper 
An exclusive,never before published high definition illustration i made just for this project that you can decor your computer screen with.
It will be sent to you via email after the end of the campaign.This is the only non physical item provided in the perks.
Included in ALL the perks excluding the ''Thank you!'' perk.
 
                                                                         *^*^*

18 x 25,5 cm

paperback

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Barry Duffield, I'm an actor and some of you may know me as Lugo on Spartacus: Vengeance and the up coming season: War of the Damned. What you may not know is that I am also an optioned screenwriter. 

My dream is to bring my script 'Dead Man's Land' to life in full glorious colour and eventually, via the Graphic Novel, get it onto a big screen near you.

The Walking Dead & Hell Boy are a couple of successful examples of Graphic Novels that have made it to TV and the big screen - There are many more. 

Graphic Novels are a great way for producers to visualize a story rather than just reading it on the page.

Logline:

"A squad of WW2 Paratroopers, shot down behind enemy lines, are forced to stand against a pack of genetically created Nazi Werewolves before they can wreak havoc amongst the approaching Allied forces."

I need $35,000 to realise the dream of bringing this story to life and ultimately bringing it to the stores for you. This will pay for the...

* Script to Graphic Novel adaptation by LA based Steve Stern

--STEVE STERN, creator of Zen Intergalactic Ninja and author of the BEOWULF, A CHRISTMAS CAROL and WAR OF THE WORLDS Graphic Novels

"There’s never been a World War II story quite like DEAD MAN’S LAND.  What could be cooler than a bunch of courageous paratroopers in bloody combat with  a pack of genetically-altered Nazi werewolves, with the outcome of the War in the balance?  This is going to make a great graphic novel, and one hell of a film!"

[Click on the external "WEBSITE" link below  to read more about Steve Stern]

* Artist

* Colourist

* Publisher [self funded first run] 

* Promotional and point of sale Web Site

I have no doubt that each and everyone of you have a dream. I need your help to achieve mine.

If you can't help with funds please pass this forward to your friends. Your word of mouth could make all the difference.

story:
WE DID IT!

With your help, we raised the money to bring Pitchblende into the world!  We will be able to purchase the Wacom drawing tablet, Manga Studio, Final Draft, ISBN numbers, and get ART into your hands!  This has been an incredible experience, and we are filled with love and joy that our project has resonated with so many people.  

What to do next?

Please "like" Pitchblende on Facebook for sneak peeks, updates, and giveaways!  

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Pitchblende/178322592370910

And follow us on twitter!

https://twitter.com/_pitchblende_

This is just the beginning.  

XOXO,

Jade, Meff, and Eowyn


NEW NEW GOAL: $2500

Help us get to $2500, which will allow us to buy software programs we need to format and produce Pitchblende! We have a NEW perk at the $25 level. A 5-PAGE PREVIEW ISSUE OF PITCHBLENDE -- the first printed Pitchblende that will exist! 

UPDATE: Since we reached our first stretch goal of $2000, EVERYBODY who donates and has donated will receive a PDF one-page Pitchblende comic MONTHS before the first issue will be available!!! 

We Are Three Nerds Who Wrote a Sexy Comic About Genius Victorian Scientists

Jade is an award-winning author, poet, actor, and bon vivant. Jade's most recent projects include the autobiographical novel, Kissing Oscar Wilde (Write Bloody Press 2013), and the independent feature film (and corresponding novel) TEN. http://jadesylvan.com

Meff is an acclaimed playwright (28 Seeds), drag performer, and musician, currently performing with "steamCRUNK" band Walter Sickert and the Army of Broken Toys. http://facebook.com/dasmeff

Eowyn is a multimedia visual artist and Principle Prognosticator at Happy Ending Fortune Telling. Her art has been featured in solo and group shows throughout the East Coast. She has created a vast body of work exploring the impact of entities, real or imagined, on the mundane world. http://dandysexual.com

We love science, the occult, and sexual tension. We love badass Nobel Prize-winning chemist moms and neurotic, clairvoyant, pigeon-loving electric wizards. We love re-telling and breaking history. But more than all these things, we love comics. 

We spent last summer researching, developing and scripting Pitchblende, a graphic novel about two of the most influential and interesting scientists of the late 19th and early 20th Century, Marie Curie and Nikola Tesla, teaming up to fight the occult forces of Aleister Crowley and the Order of the Golden Dawn. Pitchblende is everything we ever want in comics––it's sexy, smart, post-modern, and very, very fun. We've truly loved and enjoyed every aspect of writing it. Now we want to bring it into the world. 


We Get a Machine. You Get a Comic.

Eowyn, our illustrator for Pitchblende, was diagnosed this year with a medical condition that effects her mobility and movement. We've explored several options, and have decided that the most practical way to allow Eowyn to draw in various positions and maximize efficiency is to buy a Wacom Cintiq 13HD Tablet. This is a tablet that will allow Eowyn to draw directly onto the screen with a special pen, streamlining the illustration process. Unlike traditional drawing on paper, Eowyn will not need to be hunched over a desk for hours on end, but instead will be able to move from chair to table to bed to standing, etc. This tablet is also unique in that the control and capabilities of the drawing itself is as close to drawing on physical paper that we've found. This is necessary for the organic 19th and early-20th Century look we're going for with Pitchblende.

A video about the Wacom Tablet: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qz8f-3HQN4U

This tablet is not cheap. It retails for around $1,200. See Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Wacom-Cintiq-Interactive-Display-DTK1300/dp/B00BSOSCNE 


We Need You.

We have already devoted hundreds of hours to this project. We love it and want to see it birthed into the world, but unfortunately this necessary device is an expense we cannot afford without help. 

Please help us buy this tablet so we can make Pitchblende a reality!

We are asking for $1300 to account for the 4% Indie Gogo takes from successful campaigns and sales tax. 


Help Spread the Word!

Please share this page to help make us look popular and important on Facebook so people will want to give us money so we can buy this magic future machine and create our mind-breaking, genre-defying love letter to science, discovery, and astral travel.

story:
Introduction

My name is Scott A. Ford, artist, designer, and storyteller from Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. I am the writer and illustrator behind the new graphic series, Romulus + Remus. 

Romulus + Remus is entirely independent. I do all the writing and all the art, but I also do all the layout and design, advertising, marketing, and event coordination.

The Campaign

Romulus + Remus is an action/horror comic set in the present day and inspired by Ancient Roman Society and Religion. The first instalment of Romulus + Remus, A Watcher in the Depths, is divided into two Issues. Issue 1 was released last April as a small first edition. Issue 2 will be complete by the end of April and I plan to release it in early June. This Indiegogo campaign will help fund the release of Issue 2 as well as a reprint of Issue 1, which is nearly sold out.

My campaign goal of $4500 will help fund:

 - Printing of Issue 2 and reprint of Issue 1

 - Advertising and promotion

 - Additional merchandise

 - Special events

Plot & Themes

Romulus + Remus follows the life of Roman, 'The Concrete Angel'. Dropped onto this Earth off the coast of Italy, he seeks to break free of the past that tries to control him. Roman’s struggle to define his own personal crusade proves to be a battle more internal than against the worlds around him.

Under the surface, the series explores concepts of duality: hero and villain, mythology and religion, old-world and modernity, but more importantly the threshold between these sides. Where do the poles reverse and one becomes the other? When do the boundaries disappear and lies therein the void between?

Perk Products

Buttons

Bookmarks

Digital and Hard Copies of A Watcher in the Depths: Issue 1 & 2

Digital Art Booklet [poster designs, drafts, and concept sketches]

A Watcher in the Depths Special Edition Sleeve [holds Issue 1 & 2]

Prints and Posters

Your Impact

Romulus + Remus is currently available internationally through my website scottaford.wordpress.com and is only available in-store here in Winnipeg. So with your help I will be able to keep this project independent and hopefully help it reach a wider audience. Money earned through Indiegogo will not only go towards the printing costs of Issue 2, the reprint of Issue 1, but also the cost of additional merchandise, advertising, and special events.

If the pledges exceed my goal then that means I can print more copies, produce more merchandise, advertise more, and maybe even go to more events in and outside of Winnipeg.

Thank You!

Any donations would be hugely appreciated! Donate if you can and share this campaign with your friends. Thank you for your support!

Find Out More

See a preview of Issue 1 and 2, as well as additional artwork from the series at scottaford.wordpress.com

LIKE Romulus + Remus on Facebook at facebook.com/RomRem for all the latest news, events, images, trailers, and more.

Under the surface, the series explores concepts of duality: hero and villain, mythology and religion, old-world and modernity, but more importantly the threshold between these sides. Where do the poles reverse and one becomes the other? When do the boundaries disappear and lies therein the void between?
Perk Products
Buttons

Bookmarks

Digital and Hard Copies of A Watcher in the Depths: Issue 1 & 2

Digital Art Booklet [poster designs, drafts, and concept sketches]


A Watcher in the Depths Special Edition Sleeve [holds Issue 1 & 2]

Prints and Posters

Your Impact
Romulus + Remus is currently available internationally through my website scottaford.wordpress.com and is only available in-store here in Winnipeg. So with your help I will be able to keep this project independent and hopefully help it reach a wider audience. Money earned through Indiegogo will not only go towards the printing costs of Issue 2, the reprint of Issue 1, but also the cost of additional merchandise, advertising, and special events.
If the pledges exceed my goal then that means I can print more copies, produce more merchandise, advertise more, and maybe even go to more events in and outside of Winnipeg.
Thank You!
Any donations would be hugely appreciated! Donate if you can and share this campaign with your friends. Thank you for your support!
Find Out More
See a preview of Issue 1 and 2, as well as additional artwork from the series at scottaford.wordpress.com
LIKE Romulus + Remus on Facebook at facebook.com/RomRem for all the latest news, events, images, trailers, and more.

story:
Short Summary

  • All materials, drawings and characters posted on this website are property of the LLC "Lost Legends"! 

  • ერთად გავაცოცხლოთ უძველესი ქართული ლეგენდა ამირანზე! 

  • "Amirani" graphic novel trilogy is in Kartvelian and in English languages. The first 100 contributors who`ll get 25$ & more perks, will get 2nd part of the trilogy for free in December, 2014! 

  • I`m Nikoloz Khomasuridze, Kartvelian Film DIrector/Producer and a creator of Lost Legends. I like History, Legends & Myths and after graduating from The Los Angeles Film School, I decided to become a filmmaker who`ll make alive an unique culture hidden and lost in historical events, antic legends & myths of my homeland SAKARTVELO!

The Legend about Kartvelian hero Amirani is around 5000 years old and there isn`t any good illustrated book published about him yet. Our campaign is our first try to use Indiegogo Platform to receive contributions and support from very kind heart people and it`s very important to reach our goal on our very first try. Our dream is to publish and introduce to the world this mystic legend and new heroes with our high quality graphic novel book, which is in Kartvelian and in English languages and it will be published in July 27th, 2014.  

"Amirani (Kartvelian: ამირანი) is the name of a Kartvelian Epic Culture hero  who`s story was used for the Classical Prometheus. The legend itself is from 3,000  years BC, at the beginning of the first Iron Age. Amirani  (godchild of God) and his brothers Usupi & Badri reunite people and Godsons to fight against army of dark powers leading by undefeated CloudKing and his general Kaji Rokapi". 

  • Our final goal with this first graphic novel is to create a company which will develop unique mythology story from Sakartvelo and Caucasian region into drawings and then based on them make great scripts and Hollywood quality big budget Films and Animations. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We would be so delighted to reach our goal and get the entire budget. What we need is to finish our project and make alive the oldest Kartvelian Legends & Myths and Heroes of these stories.  We already made half of drawings and we share the Promo video with you. We hope you already enjoyed watching it. 
  • This amount includes Publishing of the Book and all other expenses: taxes and fees for the project, to make and provide books, Thank You-Posters and T-shirts for our Indiegogo campaign supporters. We need this amount of money to make a high level and quality graphic novel and also make all of you happy with our perks. 
  • Our creative team will try to do our best to make these perks more unique and make you even more excited and surprised when you get the  items of our Graphic Novel, so you`ll be proud to be a part of this great journey through the history of the "Lost Legends: Amirani & Brothers!" 

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Book of the Graphic Novel "Amirani" is unique, for a few reasons: Story and style looks like when 300, Clash of the titans and The Lord of the Rings meet each others, but to make it we spent much less. We plan to attend Comic Con festivals around the world to show our story and talent. So, YOU as a contributor & supporter of Amirani Legend can be with us during whole our journey to success!
  • Graphic Novel "300" was published in 1988 & Movie "300" was released in 2007 / Graphic novel "Amirani" will be published with your Support in July 27th, 2014 & movie "Amirani" will be released ??? So, Please Contribute to our legendary project ASAP !!!
  • დაიცავი შენი ლეგენდა! - DEFEND YOUR LEGEND !!!

Other Ways You Can Help

I would like to ask everyone who`ll come across this page to help us spread the word about this Epic project and share it through your friends and if you know any Kartvelian (Georgian) person/s, please let them know about this page. 

Thank you very much for supporting us making our Legendary Dream!!! 

1. Media about us - Georgia Today Newspaper Article

2. Media about us - Studio Reportiori.ge Video Interview
