story:
All the material for this campaign is created a waiting to be shipped. With that said this campaign will start shipping immediately after it goes in demand.

 

2nd chance at Rockabilly Roadtrip!?!

If you missed out on the original Rockabily Roadtrip campaign here's your chance to get in on the action. The original Roadtrip campaign didn't stay in demand long. So I'm give everyone another shot at it. I'm offering a limited # of the TPB's and #1 of the new series.  all signed!

 

What's this 9 Devils all about?

Story

I created the world of 9 Devils back in 2012. I was recovering from a surgical procedure. I felt like crap and was heavily medicated. I couldn't draw, so I escaped into my head. What i found there was the world of  the 9 devils. Which contained "the Sisters of Mercy", a mutilated and mutated order of warrior nuns. Cathedral airships, fitted for war to serve the 9. Cybernetic foot solders, know as the hand of the 9. 

The 9 devils have invaded this reality, forsaken the laws of hell. To created their own kingdoms on earth. Man has no choice but to serve. Or do they? The reaper may have something to say about all of this!

 

 

 

What happened to 9 Devils?

9 devils was originally a kicstarter campaign. after the first issue was successfully funded & fulfilled. I had to abandon this title halfway through the 2nd issue. At the time i was going through a very nasty divorce. That combined with my day job. Well time wasn't something I had in abundance and my stress levels were off the charts.

 

What changed?

I started doing comics full time. My divorce is well and done with. I also teamed up with an amazing writer Brian Christgau (of Six Gun Gorilla fame),  we decided to revamp the entire project from the ground up. the all new 9 Devils is scheduled to be released mid 2021.

 

What is this campaign for?

i have around 150 issues left over from the original 9 Devils  kickstarter campaign. I'm clearing them out to help pay for some preproduction cost of the 2021 version. After this you will not be able to get your hands on this book ( my original vision of the 9).  no matter which perk you select you will also recieve a pdf version of the never before printed , unfinished second issue of 9 devils. Be aware this is an older project form a previous campaign.

 

Available Campaign perks:

 Signed metal chromium covers ( limited)

Sketch covers:

not a cover with a printed sketch on it! No, This is a real honest to goodness sketch cover. i will draw you a custom cover (very limited)

sketch cover example

 

chromium metal cards:

 

original art:

9 Devils cover art.

 

Concept Art

 

The best part! 9 Devils and Rockabilly will ship withing 2 weeks of it going in demand! How is that possible you ask? Because is finished, printed and ready to go? Here's proof!

story:
Who is this Moros character???


Moros is a vigilante who's real name is Edward Knight.  He is a detective in a corrupt city who decides to take the law into his own hands.  Moros uses any means necessary to rid his city of evil, even if his methods lack morality.

Who's the team behind Moros??

My name is Joshua Lucas and Moros is a passion project of mine.  I wrote this story two years ago, after facing many personal struggles.  The story is dark, reflective, and visceral.  
I think, in a world where comics have become watered down, Moros will stand out as something full of depth.  Every issue is a crazy ride, and the tale of Edward's first year of being Moros (which takes place over 12 issues) is simply EPIC!!
In the course of two years I have been through five different illustrators.  I have also attempted to do the art myself.  All of these efforts, though at times frustrating, have brought me to work with the brilliant Tamal Saha.

Moros looks great!!  Who is the artist??

Tamal Saha, an illustrator and comic lover working out of India, is the amazing talent that brings Moros to life.  I met Tamal online and together we worked a half a world apart to complete  Moros: A Hard Boiled Hero issue one.

So, who are we really?

Plainly put, we are just two guys who love comics.  We haven't worked on anything you would know, though both of us have been working on our craft for years.  I feel like we've created something special, something that I am proud of and something that I believe people will truly enjoy.  If you like what you see in our video and Facebook, then I urge you to help however you can.  

How are you going to use the cash, and what goodies are you offering???


We are trying to raise $1,000 United States Dollars, and here is what it will be used for:

  • The illustration of issue two.  Issue one is done and payed for, but I need to raise some money in order to pay Tamal for his time and talents.  He is absolutely worth every penny!!
  • ISBN number for digital and print publishing and distribution.  It costs money to get these!!
  • A soft printing of the first issue.  200-500 copies, which will cost a couple of hundred, depending on where we print.

We have several goodies that will give a contributor a sense of exclusivity and their name in the Moros archives forever!  They are as follows:
  • A thank you and the supporter's name printed in the back of Moros: A Hard Boiled Hero issue one!!
  • An exclusive variant cover that will only be available through pledging to this campaign.  This cover was done by an American artist, Kirk Feretzanis.
  • Special addition versions of the first issue.  These issues include a copy of the script and sketches done along the two year journey to the book being finished.
  • Signed copies of both the regular and special edition of the comic!!
  • Signed original art work paired with a signed bracketed script.  A nice combo with original artwork signed by THE Moros illustrator, Tamal Saha, and a script signed by me, Joshua Lucas.

Why Moros?


Helping Moros continue his journey is important.  It means supporting indie art, creator owned comics, and small business.


Moros has no agenda and tries to make no over all points (it's just a good story), but there are certain people who may find a special connection to the work.  They would be:

  • Anyone who has dealt with addiction, either personally or by way of family or close friends.  Moros develops chemical dependency issues that are central to his character and his struggles.
  • Members of the Military.  Our protagonist is ex-military and he suffers from PTSD, and has difficulty adjusting to a civilian world.  This is a book that Military people will relate to.
  • Bohemian artist/writers.  Moros is a VERY risky, mature book.  It's extremely dark, with depth.  I think anyone who likes bloody, strange, and horrific entertainment will be right at home with this comic!!

    A Tree in the Forest..


    In truth, we are one of many great indie comic books out there.


    Today's world is full of great entertainment in massive quantities.  It is easy for good work to go unnoticed and word of mouth is still the best advertising.  EVEN IF YOU CAN'T GIVE US A DIME, if you like what you see, share it!  Tell others about Moros!  Retweet us!  Like our Facebook!  The readership for any indie book is more of a family than a fan base.  We need YOUR help!!

  A Tree in the Forest..

story:
Who are we?

We are OTP Manga. A group of writers, artists, voice actors, sound designers, and general anime and manga nerds who have come together to create new original manga series in a unique and exciting way.

  • How many series do you have right now, when I only see one?
We currently have 9 series in varied stages of production. Infinity's Light is the only series in post production for the first chapter and production for the next 3 chapters.

  • Why do you need to have an indiegogo goal of $25,000 for a manga project?
First, if it were just one manga series it would be a lot lower, but with 9 series all needing the same programs, equipment, and personnel it becomes a lot more costly. In addition, we need to hire on more people to help out with all of the series. Artist's assistants and lead artists for other series need to be hired on as well, and we can't afford to bring them on with what we have right now. In addition to artists there are voice actors, manga editors, and equipment that need to be added to make the series even better than what we're capable of making right now. Keep in mind that this is still less than the budget for a full anime episode. 

  • How much is it going to cost me to read/watch the newest chapters of a series when they come out?
That's the really cool part. Nothing at all, we want you to check out each series the same way you would watch a video on YouTube or read comic strip online.

  • So how are you going to make your money if it's free online? 
While reading it is free, we will be making money from YouTube views, and website attention, but that will only get us so far. Since OTP Manga owns all of the content we can make money through merch, the OSTs for each series on iTunes or your favorite place to get music, as well as through our outtakes. Also, we understand that you may not like every series that OTP Manga puts out, everyone has their preferences and favorites. So each series will be getting it's own patreon so that fans can help contribute to it and help the creators keep going.

  • Why is this such a big deal to you?
Not only does this help us greatly to get this project truly off of the ground, but it sends a message to people all around the world that online manga and comics is the way to get your series a lot of attention and giving creators the freedom to bring you new content without charging you crazy fees to check it out.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money we receive from your generosity will go towards programs more suited to making manga easier and more quickly, as well as making sure our artists, and voice actors, and audio engineers have the equipment  they need. Everyone working on this project has been working with enthusiasm for over a year and a half now, donating their time, and energy into this project for free. And while that's awesome, it's not something we can continue if we want to keep doing this.
  • We have lots or awesome perks ranging from early interviews before anyone else, personalized shoutouts, character voicemails, t-shirts, crocheted mascots, abridged series give aways, and having your very own character in a series of your choice.
  • If we don't reach our goal the funds don't suddenly disappear. We will still receive the money you have sent us, but a larger percentage will be taken out for IndieGoGo's cut. And we will still purchase the equipment and programs we need, we just may have to wait on hiring on more personnel. However if we're can't make half of our goal we won't be able to even continue from here and the project would either slow down to a crawl until we can find a suitable investor that may not let us keep control of our stories, or the project may end entirely.

Why this matters to you

  • One of the biggest reasons we want this campaign to succeed is because, many of you write fanfiction, draw fanart, or want to do voice over for anime and games, but don't live near places where making manga or voicing for anime and games is possible. This is a chance for all of you to reach those dreams from where you live right now! We're looking for artists who want to make manga, and voice actors who want to get into the industry, but maybe don't have the money to move.
  • We're not just claiming to be nerds and otaku to get your support. The staff of OTP manga is comprised of people from the Fairy Tail Podcast, multiple abridged series, and gaming voice over.

Mini goals (If we reach "X" amount)

$5,000 - If we reach $5,000 before the end of Akaicon, August 9th, Richie will get pied in the face by OTP Manga staff and crew. We will film it and post it on our channel.

$10,000 - When a series reaches chapter 10, we will start releasing chapters without word bubbles for fans to parody. Let the abridging begin! (At the discretion of the series creators.)
$15,000 - If we reach $15,000 we will begin releasing the manga format in Spanish, as well as adding Spanish subtitles to the video.
$20,000 - If reach $20,000 we will do a live reading of chapter 1.

If we surpass our goal, we will release the soundtrack for Infinity’s Light for free on soundcloud for 2 weeks before we put it up on iTunes.

If we surpass our goal, Anthony, will snort wasabi, record and post it the OTP YouTube Channel.

Otaku are broke, we know. You can still help!

  • We know that a lot of you out there are just as broke as we are from cons, cosplay, the dealer halls, and buying anime. But what the nerd community is truly known for, is being able to spread the word about things very quickly to help a project they like reach it's goal. The best thing you can do right now is the share this campaign so that as many people see it as possible.

While reading it is free, we will be making money from YouTube views, and website attention, but that will only get us so far. Since OTP Manga owns all of the content we can make money through merch, the OSTs for each series on iTunes or your favorite place to get music, as well as through our outtakes. Also, we understand that you may not like every series that OTP Manga puts out, everyone has their preferences and favorites. So each series will be getting it's own patreon so that fans can help contribute to it and help the creators keep going.

 Why is this such a big deal to you?

Not only does this help us greatly to get this project truly off of the ground, but it sends a message to people all around the world that online manga and comics is the way to get your series a lot of attention and giving creators the freedom to bring you new content without charging you crazy fees to check it out.
   What We Need & What You Get  The money we receive from your generosity will go towards programs more suited to making manga easier and more quickly, as well as making sure our artists, and voice actors, and audio engineers have the equipment  they need. Everyone working on this project has been working with enthusiasm for over a year and a half now, donating their time, and energy into this project for free. And while that's awesome, it's not something we can continue if we want to keep doing this. We have lots or awesome perks ranging from early interviews before anyone else, personalized shoutouts, character voicemails, t-shirts, crocheted mascots, abridged series give aways, and having your very own character in a series of your choice. If we don't reach our goal the funds don't suddenly disappear. We will still receive the money you have sent us, but a larger percentage will be taken out for IndieGoGo's cut. And we will still purchase the equipment and programs we need, we just may have to wait on hiring on more personnel. However if we're can't make half of our goal we won't be able to even continue from here and the project would either slow down to a crawl until we can find a suitable investor that may not let us keep control of our stories, or the project may end entirely.    Why this matters to you  One of the biggest reasons we want this campaign to succeed is because, many of you write fanfiction, draw fanart, or want to do voice over for anime and games, but don't live near places where making manga or voicing for anime and games is possible. This is a chance for all of you to reach those dreams from where you live right now! We're looking for artists who want to make manga, and voice actors who want to get into the industry, but maybe don't have the money to move.

 We're not just claiming to be nerds and otaku to get your support. The staff of OTP manga is comprised of people from the Fairy Tail Podcast, multiple abridged series, and gaming voice over. 

Mini goals (If we reach "X" amount)

$5,000 - If we reach $5,000 before the end of Akaicon, August 9th, Richie will get pied in the face by OTP Manga staff and crew. We will film it and post it on our channel.$10,000 - When a series reaches chapter 10, we will start releasing chapters without word bubbles for fans to parody. Let the abridging begin! (At the discretion of the series creators.)
$15,000 - If we reach $15,000 we will begin releasing the manga format in Spanish, as well as adding Spanish subtitles to the video.
$20,000 - If reach $20,000 we will do a live reading of chapter 1.

If we surpass our goal, we will release the soundtrack for Infinity’s Light for free on soundcloud for 2 weeks before we put it up on iTunes.
If we surpass our goal, Anthony, will snort wasabi, record and post it the OTP YouTube Channel.



    Otaku are broke, we know. You can still help!  We know that a lot of you out there are just as broke as we are from cons, cosplay, the dealer halls, and buying anime. But what the nerd community is truly known for, is being able to spread the word about things very quickly to help a project they like reach it's goal. The best thing you can do right now is the share this campaign so that as many people see it as possible.

story:
The Project

   PostHuman is an on-going comic book series from Hound Comics created by Andrew Armelim and Tristan Nall which tells the story of INTERPOL's Agent A.D.A.M. as he works with various law-enforcement agencies around the world to battle the global terrorist group, ARGUS.

 We have a full creative team on board, with Tristan Nall writing, Andrew Armelin doing the pencils and letters, Alfonso Pinedo inking, and Kendall Goode on colors. 

Throughout the story we wanted to deal with the themes of what it means to be human, especially when so many facets of our identities are represented through the Internet and social media. But as new generations become more in tune with the digital world, they are increasingly criticized for being unable to relate to people on a physical, personal level. These are the issues that challenge Adam every day of his new existence, literally, as his mind was moved from his physical human body to one of metal. 


Our Goal

   With the funds graciously donated by you, we hope to produce, print and distribute the first fully-colored issue of PostHuman. Creating the finished product for you to enjoy is our utmost concern, and appreciate whatever help you can supply to make this a reality.

   We have developed several exciting and unique perks for those of you who are able to contribute, from free digital downloads of the first issue to cool behind-the-scenes extras and even the opportunity to write something in the book itself.

 Even if you are unable to donate, please share this project with your friends and colleagues so that we can make PostHuman a reality!

 Creating a comic has been a long-time dream for the entire team and PostHuman has been a labor of love for everyone involved. We cannot express our gratitude enough for those of you who are able to help us out in any way possible.

Thank you!

 

The Risks

As with any comic book project, the biggest challenge we will face is that of delays. Right now we are already working on the first script so that we can begin working on the art the moment we meet our desired goal. With character designs and plotting done, we are positioned to produce our final product as quickly as possible without sacrificing the quality of our work. While we do not foresee any issues or delays, we will be sure to update with any news if it does occur.


Please like the official PostHuman facebook page:
www.facebook.com/posthumancomic

story:
RUNX TALES #3 will be a beautiful full-size comic book with a letterpress cover and a 4-page full-color spread! It includes an interview with writer Jincy Willett, stories of failed rent-boy attempts, a psychic exploration of San Jose, and a tribute to a drugstore that existed for reasons other than profit.

I'm having a lot of fun working with color and experimenting with different textures, and I'm excited about how this book is going to look. Right now, though, I'm trying to figure out how to cover printing costs. I'm not waiting tables anymore, which basically means I'm broke, and so that's why I'm here spange-ing on Indiegogo!

Because RUNX TALES #3 will look so fancy, I have to charge $8 a copy, so for only 2 bucks more, you can pre-order yourself one and make sure I can cover the printing bill. That's only $10! I hate charging so much for it, especially after the first two issues were the 20th-century price of $3, but believe me, this one's gonna be so nice, it will be worth it!

If you're new to RUNX TALES, you can check out excerpts from #1 & #2 here. The first issue came out of nineties zine culture, and was tag-lined as telling stories about what it's like to be broke and gay in America. Since then it has evolved into a comic book that embraces its own book-ness. As web comics grow in popularity, the pieces featured in RUNX TALES #3 are stories that demand a tactile interaction, that are both textured and liberated by the turn of the page.

RUNX TALES #3 is going to be something you can't experience on a screen, something that will only translate in a physical book. Keep reading for an exciting preview!

PART ONE: The Drugstore Is Officially Dead

If you're familiar with Oakland, you'll remember the old Super Longs drugstore, a place that can only be described as enchanted. A vanity centerpiece for the Longs chain, the store offered everything from hotdogs to flu shots, sewing notions to exotic statuary, art supplies to aisles and aisles of tropical foliage. It was open 24/7, which gave it that special late-night weirdness, and it was a resource both loved and depended on by the citizens of Oakland. When CVS bought out Longs in 2010, they stripped the store of its stock, giving it a slow, humiliating death before they finally close its doors for good. In this piece, a memorial of sorts, I take you on a tour of the old Super Longs, complete with barren shelves and lovingly drawn merchandise you can cut out and arrange yourself to bring those shelves to life again.

PART TWO: The Accidental Humorist

Jincy Willett is a writer who published a book of short stories, Jenny & the Jaws of Life, in 1987. It was a book that caught the eye of then unknown David Sedaris as he was browsing the library shelves. He was so enthusiastic about it, he wanted to adapt one of its stories into a puppet show, and he asked Willett for permission by writing her her first -- and for a long time, only -- fan letter. Years later, Willett had long since completed a novel which was languishing without a publisher. Sedaris, meanwhile, was using his fame to talk up Jenny & the Jaws of Life. His endorsement allowed Willett to finally publish that novel, Winner of the National Book Award. I, in turn, happened on Winner in 2007, and sent the author another fan letter, this one asking for an interview. I then adapted the conversation, where Jincy Willett describes her theory of a slapstick universe, into this full-color comic, layering paper to create illusions of dimension. Here's Jincy's website.

PART THREE: My Two Daddies: Failed Rent Boy's Secrets Revealed

In this piece, I use a split-page format to tell parallel narratives of two less than lucrative sugar daddies I had. Both of them were nice men who had very little money themselves, and the comic examines the strange power dynamics involved: the race and class issues, the windows into different kinds of loneliness, and the gray area between the needs for cash versus human contact.

PART FOUR: A Psychic Collaboration with Nora Benson-Glaspey

In RUNX TALES #2, you met Nora Benson-Glaspey, who told the tale of Crow, a nightmarish weirdo who continued to haunt her life for several years. In this yet-untitled piece, I've teamed up with Nora again to examine the psychic landscape of San Jose, California. We take a tour of the Winchester Mansion, discuss the Rosicrucian Egyptian Museum, and later visit a psychic fair to interview some of its tablers. The investigation ends up raising more questions than answers: about the space between kitsch and sincere spiritual longing, as well as the ways a metaphysical landscape exists in a culture as materialistic as ours. This comic, in fact, is laid out like the labyrinthine Winchester Mansion, recurring among multiple dimensions, allowing the reader to either get lost or follow it in the manner of a choose-your-own-adventure. To read an interview with Nora, visit my blog.

I'm so excited about this issue of RUNX TALES, I've lined up a bunch of really awesome incentives: 

The broadsides available for gifts of $25 or more are all original works of fiction and are letterpress printed on recycled materials. To get an idea of what you could receive, click here! $50 or more gets you a really nice sampling: a grab bag of 6!

For $75 or more, not only do you get the broadsides grab bag, you get the complete set of RUNX TALES #1-3. The first issue is now out of print and really hard to find! Don't miss its stories of my life as a Crust Puff, spending a Summer of Love in Portland, and hawking Mama Mia merch at the SF Pride parade.

For $100 or more, you get the broadsides grab bag, all three RUNX TALES, and you can commission me to draw a picture of anything you want! Size, materials, and colors are up to you, and I will incorporate pop-up elements so that it'll look so 3-D, you'll wanna duck!

You're really gonna want this book -- it'll be a treat not only for the eyes, but also for that good old-fashioned, page-turning sense of touch! Pre-order yourself a copy today for only $10, and if you can, consider giving more! You'll be happy when you open your mailbox later this year and find a handmade, only slightly sarcastic package waiting for you!

story:
Who Am I?

I am a Comic Book artist, web and graphic designer:

My name is Keith, I am an artist. I'm father to two wonderful girls who may or may not also have a passion to create. I am a husband to my beautiful wife who indulges my artistic passions and whims. Yet, my ability to create has been stalled.

I started this idea of funding because my graphics tablet stopped working. Anyone who works with Wacom and Cintiq knows how difficult it is to function without it. My family and I were hit hard by hurricane Sandy and all of our time and money has gone to rebuilding, as it should. 

I need to get back up to working speed. So, I started this campaign. A friend suggested to me that rather than go hat in hand, which I am not a fan of, that I might offer, as incentives, sketches, collectible action figures and whatnot, as a means of paying my way. So that is what I am going to do.

Here is what I am looking to do, how you can help and what you can receive

I need $3000 to purchase a Wacom Cintiq that I will use for creating comic book art for an upcoming title I have created. 

I will also use portions of this funding to purchase Windsor Newton Series 7 brushes, the industry standard for inking comic book pages.

A drafting table to work at.

In exchange for your generous funding, I have levels of perks that include:

A handwritten note expressing my gratitude.

A card drawn by my daughters, expressing all of our gratitude.

A pencil head sketch of a comic character of your choice.

An ink head sketch of a character of your choice.

I am also offering an assortment of Transformers action figures, from different eras and rarities. Some are MISB, some are loose complete, but they are ALL cherished by me. The thought of having to part with them tears me up, but I have to get my studio running.

What does all of this mean?

I started my career in comics back in the early 1990's. I moved on to web and graphic design for about 10 years and now I spend most days doing instructional development and design, yet comic book art has always been at the heart of my passion. 

Helping me achieve this funding goal will also be helping me to realize my dream of creating comics once again, using the technology available today to do so.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that times are tough and if money were readily available, I wouldn't be doing this, so if you can't donate, I absolutely understand. There are still ways that you can help, if you want to.

Please share this campaign with others, help me spread the word.

Use the share tools located on this page, the more people share using the social media buttons, the better chance I have of becoming visible on the Indiegogo main page. That would be a GREAT help.

I am also accepting your well wishes in running a successful campaign. Every good thought counts!


Thank you so much for taking the time to read and to help.


Keith Smith

story:
The Yaoi Army proudly presents...


Chapter 1 of the manga can be viewed here: 

Chapter 1 Link

Misa Nanase is a normal senior high school student except for the fact that she is a self-proclaimed ultimate-mega-ultra-omnipotent fujoshi queen of the intergalactic multiverse. 

One fateful day, she saves an old lady from getting hit by a car. In return, the old lady gives her an ocean green pendant and mentions that she can make any wish using it. 

Later on, the curiosity of the fujoshi gets the best of Misa...and she wishes to become a guy! 

How will Misa survive and navigate the world as a guy? 

Will she finally be able to do a live action BL that she has once fantasized? 

 I guess you have to read and find out ;)

The Yaoi Army Logo (1 in x 1 in) will be embroidered in these garments.

The Yaoi Army is a start-up publishing group focusing on Yaoi, Boys Love, and Shounen-ai.

The Yaoi Army is founded by Seru in December 2015. He is a low-key fudanshi and has read a wide variety of Yaoi stories. He enjoys fantasy, romance, supernatural and comedy.

Someday, Seru hopes and dreams of creating a story of his own. In July 2015, he starts writing random stories with different plots and over-the-top characters on Wattpad.

His first story is called “Seme Trapped in an Uke’s Perfect body,” a romantic comedy that revolves around Haru Arata, who claims to be a seme but has a perfect uke’s body. That story has laid the foundation to create his second story called “Fujoshi Trapped in a Seme’s Perfect Body,” a story about Haru’s parents.

Seru wants to take “Fujoshi” to the next level and adapt it into a manga-style format.

He has tried to reach more than a hundred artists (156 artists to be exact). Unfortunately, he has been ignored, politely rejected, or “seen-zoned.”

Nonetheless, he didn’t give up and eventually found Joberu, an artist from the Philippines. They talked and connected….and The Yaoi Army was born

Hello guys! I'm Joberu, a 21-year-old fujoshi and artist from the Philippines. I am a book illustrator for a local publishing company, a freelance artist on DeviantArt, and also a member of the Black Monkey-Pro (I mostly draw posters and pinups).

I specialize in drawing ikemen/handsome guys, especially the seme type :>. Sometimes I draw BL but I can't draw hardcore Yaoi. If you wanna know why I don't do it, try asking Seru XD. 

You can find my artworks on Facebook, DeviantArt, Tumblr, and Instagram. (Just search Joberu)  

I became a part of The Yaoi Army last January 2016 when I met Seru on Instagram. He asked me if I could illustrate one of his stories. At first, I declined his offer but I changed my mind afterward. (Blame Seru XD). 

Now, I am his illustrator for "Fujoshi Trapped in a Seme’s Perfect Body". It was an honor that he considered me as one of his illustrators. It’s my first time drawing a manga, so don’t be too harsh with me Q^Q. I am sure you will really enjoy the story as much as I did :).

Our mission is to bring unique, entertaining and extraordinary yaoi experience to you, our readers.

Currently, we are planning to do a four-chapter volume with 120+ pages. The storyboard and manuscript are completed. We just need to do our sketching, line art, adding screen tones, shading, editing etc. Here is the worst-case-scenario:

  • March – Organizing and Planning / Storyboarding and Sketching
  • April – Storyboarding and Sketching
  • May – Finishing, Polishing, and Finalizing
  • June – Organizing, Sample Printing, and Production
  • July – Production 
  • August – Buffer 
  • September – Fulfillment and Delivery*

*Subject to change.

Someday, Seru hopes and dreams of creating a story of his own. In July 2015, he starts writing random stories with different plots and over-the-top characters on Wattpad.
His first story is called “Seme Trapped in an Uke’s Perfect body,” a romantic comedy that revolves around Haru Arata, who claims to be a seme but has a perfect uke’s body. That story has laid the foundation to create his second story called “Fujoshi Trapped in a Seme’s Perfect Body,” a story about Haru’s parents.
Seru wants to take “Fujoshi” to the next level and adapt it into a manga-style format.
He has tried to reach more than a hundred artists (156 artists to be exact). Unfortunately, he has been ignored, politely rejected, or “seen-zoned.”
Nonetheless, he didn’t give up and eventually found Joberu, an artist from the Philippines. They talked and connected….and The Yaoi Army was born


Hello guys! I'm Joberu, a 21-year-old fujoshi and artist from the Philippines. I am a book illustrator for a local publishing company, a freelance artist on DeviantArt, and also a member of the Black Monkey-Pro (I mostly draw posters and pinups).
I specialize in drawing ikemen/handsome guys, especially the seme type :>. Sometimes I draw BL but I can't draw hardcore Yaoi. If you wanna know why I don't do it, try asking Seru XD. 
You can find my artworks on Facebook, DeviantArt, Tumblr, and Instagram. (Just search Joberu)  
I became a part of The Yaoi Army last January 2016 when I met Seru on Instagram. He asked me if I could illustrate one of his stories. At first, I declined his offer but I changed my mind afterward. (Blame Seru XD). 
Now, I am his illustrator for "Fujoshi Trapped in a Seme’s Perfect Body". It was an honor that he considered me as one of his illustrators. It’s my first time drawing a manga, so don’t be too harsh with me Q^Q. I am sure you will really enjoy the story as much as I did :).
Our mission is to bring unique, entertaining and extraordinary yaoi experience to you, our readers.
Currently, we are planning to do a four-chapter volume with 120+ pages. The storyboard and manuscript are completed. We just need to do our sketching, line art, adding screen tones, shading, editing etc. Here is the worst-case-scenario:

March – Organizing and Planning / Storyboarding and Sketching
April – Storyboarding and Sketching
May – Finishing, Polishing, and Finalizing
June – Organizing, Sample Printing, and Production
July – Production 
August – Buffer 
September – Fulfillment and Delivery*

*Subject to change.

story:
THE Z-BOYZ

 

Twin brothers on a summer adventure they won't soon forget. A tale of family, friends, life, love, sex and shenanigans all en route to meet a long lost father and kick him in the balls.

I am telling their story in a black & white 52 strip arc representing their 40 days of summer before college.  Read as they live life to the fullest and without regret. 

I love these boys and the eventual 5 year / 260 comic strip journey I desire to ultimately take them on is a tale not to be missed.  It is about growing, about understanding pride in who you are, about sex, about love and most importantly about family.

Follow their journey on FACEBOOK:

http://www.facebook.com/TheZBoyz

 

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET

What I Need:

  • Artists!  The money you contribute helps me hire artists to pencil and ink the projects.
  • Promotional materials to get full distribution beyond campaigning here and facebook.
  • If I don't make and exceed my target goal whatever funds are generouslly provided for Z-Boyz and my other comic endeavors will still be used to get it out their. 

What You Get:

  • First and foremost, my appreciation. 
  • For $2.00, a shout out from the Z-Boyz Facebook page thanking you for your contribution.
  • $3.00 gets you a printed thank you as well.
  • Starting at $5.00, a copy of the Z-Boyz's first 8 strips printed and bound.
  • At $15.00... Well, go have a look at the perks!

 

ABOUT ME

Being a writer has always been a passion of mine.  I have so many stories that I want to tell with the basis on human nature, capturing those little moments in time we can relate to. This piece specifically falls into that catagory. I am very proud of this project and hope to launch it as the inaugural title for my comic book line. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP SUPPORT

Spread the word! Share the campaign via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, MySpace -- Haha. Remember MySpace? Good times.

If you know an artist that may be interested, please refer them. Every dollar counts on making this dream reach fruition. Any and all support is greatly appreciated.

 

*** If you contribute to get a free copy of the sampler, please email your Name & Address to KennGalati@gmail.com.

story:
Here's a Gift I just gave to my fans-- one of the animations for this campaign!

Update (7.3): I'll be moving into my new apartment and will be needing to get ink and everything ready. I've posted an estimate of when I believe I should be able to ship everything out to you guys. I will be posting video updates to let you guys know what's going on with that here on youtube!

Hello there! I’m Olive Dugan, a quirky, passionate artist who has been attending University of the Arts since Fall 2010 for Animation. I’m 20 years old and am currently disabled by means of Tinnitus in my right ear, depression, anxiety, and a back condition that has yet to be diagnosed. I live with my lovely mother, my sister and two brothers of mine, but I plan on moving into an apartment. Nothing personal! I just want to get closer to school because Animation is an increeedibly stressing major. 

I’m a silly lass, but when it comes down to it, this is a project that has been keeping me motivated for years. I’ve been adding to it and refining it for half a decade now and am still trucking. TwistedFates is important to me because it’s a collection of snippets of inspirations of my childhood mixed with elements that intrigue and inspire me today told through my creative mind in story format. It’s taken on different formats; I’ve self-published two novels on Lulu.com (and am in the process of rewriting one), am working on a webcomic (three, if you count these side comics), have started writing a wiki, and have even written small literature sketches and held contests to help my fans dive deeper into the world of TwistedFates. I actually look forward to getting to animating the project after I finish the webcomic, A Rose for Shurinai.

 

 

What is Cup of Sugar? 

Cup of Sugar is a campaign with the purpose of raising money to support the project while entertaining the lots of fans. It’s a cute comic with adorable lovable characters that a friend and I have just started recently. I wanted to start this campaign because I don’t have connections unlike most people to get my project noticed. I want to raise funds to get supplies such as sketchbooks and drawing equipment and to advertise on topwebcomics.com and project wonderful. Sometimes, we all just need a little push.

What I'm Going to Need

Baby steps!

I wanted to start with a relatively small goal: $650. I wouldn’t mind if I got to at least $500, but I figured $1000 was too big of a goal for now. Tbh I'd love to get 100 copies of my novel printed, but again, I want to take this one step at a time! 

 

Here’s where the funds are going:

>Sketchbooks and drawing equipment: my webcomic, TwistedFates: A Rose for Shurinai is a multimedia project; I do line work traditionally and the like, but I also like to save some of the supplies I have to provide them to artists in need or to have a little fun with artists on deviantART and provide them as prizes. It’s one way I like to interact with my fans.

>Advertising: I like to draw potential readers to my comic and even my deviantART group by means of project wonderful or deviantART’s service, adCast. The clicks add up, but it ends up being worth it! Sometimes, you just need that extra push! 

>Hosting: I am hosting my project on custom domains and need to pay for the costs to do so-- without Ads. Ads are annoying and mess up your reading process. You guys don't like ads.

So how about them perks? Oooo, I have some treats for you. Bookmarks, prints, stickers, novels, sketches and all that good stuff.

 

If I don’t reach the goal, that’s totes fine. Every little bit helps, and you’ll sure enough get what you came for, and more. Did you know that while this campaign’s going on, if we hit at least $50 a week, we’ll update this website with a cute little comic or several for you to enjoy? (http://cupofsugar.twistedfates.net)

 

Your Importance to US!

Let’s get straight to the point: I love my fans!

Words can’t explain how much I love to interact with them. Your contributions not only help me to reach out to a wider audience, but you also help me to gain the tools I need to enhance the conversation between creator and fan. You guys are a vital part in this. Not only will I be able to continue to take care of myself with medications and treatment, but I will be able to purchase supplies, support artists, and reach potential readers. You guys will be supporting a talented artist and college student who will then pass on her love to her fans! 

It feels good to be able to log on and talk to your fans and learn that you’ve inspired them. Here’s some feedback from my fans as proof that I have inspired them; perhaps they can touch your heart too! They’re such sweet gems to me. <3

 “The project as a whole has inspired me to top hiding in the closet about having original characters. I think that by seeing someone else be so proud of their characters, I was able to be proud of my own. c:
Through Remy and Gale's relationship as friends, I learned that no matter how much people change you and authority speaks against it, you can always maintain a friendship. c:
And through a few characters, like Kuroi, Remy, and Ash, I learned that just because you're part of a group known for something notorious, doesn't mean that you don't have to follow that attribute.
So I guess I could say in short that the series teaches you small things that a person may not have thought about before. c: <3
As a side note, it was through this project that I learned that people on the internet turn out to be amazing friends. <3”

—Enya S. (US)

"This series has inspired me to the bone. I have learned to step over my artistic bounds and create more than just fan characters. Truth be told, ever since I got onto dA I have been that "OC every now and then" type of artist. However in 2007 when I started following TwF's story from the beginning to this current day, I have been able to develop and create more characters with stories than I can even keep up with. The Twisted Fates and the artist behind its creation is my core inspiration to create new characters, develop them, and keep track of the majority of my older characters."

—Octayvia D. (US)

"when i read/see parts of your story it brings so much inspiration to me just to see your characters come to life the way that they do, and to see the bonds that they create as stated is truly a work of something beautiful. and the fact that you can relate to some the characters make it even better. And just how you individually focus on such details on a character even a simple one makes me wanna do more to make my characters unique ;w; but when i do see the art alone it brings back something to life in me....it brings back spark in a way to try to achieve at fulfilling my dreams of trying to do something great. so in a way i wanna say thank you for being such a big inspiration to me :)

—Elizabeth D. (US)

These young people and even older fans have found intrigue, comfort, and inspiration in their stories, going on to chase after their dreams. Some of them are attending art college for illustration, some are using art as a means to communicate their own creativity, and I just love to reach out and support these types of people because to see them grow inspires me as well!

 Can’t Contribute? No problem!

I understand that some of you are in situations where you can’t contribute to the campaign, and that’s completely understandable! I would love it if you guys spread word about this campaign; it would mean so much to not only me, but to my loving fans. Please feel free to follow the project on twitter and retweet it (http://twitter.com/twistedfatess), become a fan on Facebook ( www.facebook.com/TwFRoseforShurinai), follow the project's blog (http://twistedfatesnewsies.blogspot.com) and share this campaign and my other projects on facebook, twitter, tumblr, and all that good stuff!

THANK YOU ALL AHEAD OF TIME for your consideration and contribution to this campaign; everyone, even those who can't donate, play a massive part in this! Let’s do this thing! <3

story:
THREE COVERS TO CHOOSE FROM!

 

 

YOU HAVE NEVER EXPERIENCED A TALE LIKE THIS BEFORE...

Wart The Wizard is the ultimate interactive adventure that has never existed until now! You will begin your adventure into Brightmoore by being introduced to the main character, Wart, as he gathers what items he has at home and places them into his INVENTORY to pursue an average day as a LEVEL ONE WIZARD. Wait, what?

That's right! Wart The Wizard was inspired by the video game series, "King's Quest", and MMORPG's such as "EverQuest" and "World of Warcraft"! Wart has BOTH an EXPERIENCE BAR AND an INVENTORY! EVERY character in Wart The Wizard has LEVELS, ID CARDS, and can be further researched in the compendium in the back of the book! In addition, Wart will have to endure the arrogant nature of overachieving GUILDS as well as guide us through the shamelessness of NINJA LOOTING!

Wart will find himself on a legendary QUEST that he is nowhere near prepared for, and must use both his wit and the items he finds along the way to discover a hidden castle containing the most powerful relic in Brightmoore, as well as the most sinister dark wizard of all time, Gravemoss!

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

$15,000 - FREE 6X9 PRINT BY VIC KING!

$17,500 - LOCKED!!

$20,000 - LOCKED!!

 

HOW WAS WART THE WIZARD CREATED?

Years ago when my daughter was younger, I would read to her every night at bedtime. Hundreds and hundreds of stories later, when it seemed like there was almost nothing left to read, she demanded a custom tale and Wart The Wizard was born! Night after night, when most children were already asleep, we'd stay up late laughing and joking about Wart's misfortune, and agreed that EVERYONE has a little bit of Wart The Wizard inside of them. He's the humor we find when things are sometimes at their worst, and the proof that anyone can overcome life's challenges if you look within yourself and dare to dream.

IS WART THE WIZARD A CHILDREN'S BOOK?

Yes and No! Wart The Wizard is a fun, adventure-filled tale that is age-appropriate for EVERYONE!

IT WAS WRITTEN WITH ADULTS & PARENTS IN MIND so that if they chose to read it to their family or children, they would have something in a comic book format, age appropriate for EVERYONE, so that it may help younger readers develop the same love for comics that we have!!!!

Adults will enjoy Wart's quirkiness, personality, and frequent nostalgic references while kids will love the antics, characters, jokes, and more!

WART THE WIZARD CUSTOM FUNKO POP BY @JOHNHAZEART !!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If you can't back Wart The Wizard, that's okay! Your tweets, retweets, likes, and comments go a long way!

Thank you so much for joining me on this adventure!!

Love, Mandy <3

story:
About Me and my goal

My name is Marcus J. Mosley and I wrote Angelic Wars.  I have already published and printed Angelic Wars Vol #1 and getting ready to publish and print Angelic Wars Vol #2.

The main goal of my campaign is to provide free copies of Angelic Wars to our Disabled Veterans.  This goal is very important and personal to me because I myself is a Disabled Veteran.

Your Contributions will help me publish and print Angelic Wars comic books and graphic novels to give free to our brave wounded warriors who gave so much and ask so little.  Each copy sent to our Disabled Veterans will be personally signed by myself.

 

What We Need

We need about $50,000 to make this happen.  But any funding would greatly be appreciated because I will find some way to make this happen with or without support or additional funding.

Most of the money will be spent to provide free comic books and graphic novels to Disabled Veterans. 

Some of the money will also be spent to promote Angelic Wars and 10% of all sales of the comic books and graphic novels will go to the DAV (Disabled American Veterans).

If I don't reach my goal, I will use whatever funding I do receive to print free comic books for our Disabled Veterans.

The Impact

Your contributions will impact thousands of our Disabled Veterans returning home with numerous physical and mental issues caused while serving and protecting us all...  Our Disabled Veterans didn't just sacrifice for Americans, but people all around the world!

I have already managed to publish and print Angelic Wars Vol #1 and Vol #2 with my own funds.  I will make sure all contributions are used efficiently and with maximum effectiveness. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those who are unable to contribute, please help by getting the word out to your family and friends.

You can also buy Angelic Wars comic books and graphic novels and 10% of those proceeds will go to help our wounded warriors.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out...

Thanks,

Marcus J. Mosley

For those who are unable to contribute, please help by getting the word out to your family and friends.
You can also buy Angelic Wars comic books and graphic novels and 10% of those proceeds will go to help our wounded warriors.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out...
Thanks,
Marcus J. Mosley

story:
Short Summary

Hope Flood is one of the top females in the industry with her commitment and dedication to females in comedy as well as her numerous ventures to keep comediennes upwardly mobile in the entertainment business. Hope has had a successful career in comedy for over 25 years. Surviving in any business for 25 years is an accomplishment within itself, especially in the male dominated business of comedy. Hope has accumulated a wealth of knowledge as she has paved the way for up and coming female comics and has been inspired to pass her experience on.

This inspiration is what gave birth to the Females In Comedy Association (FICA).

FICA is a group designed for the comediennes to develop, refine and build on their craft as they learn how to break into or to stay in the business. FICA’s sole purpose is for comediennes to network, mentor, and collaborate with one another as they learn to implement the skills of success. The Females in Comedy Convention (FICC) brings awareness and exposure to the talents of females in comedy. This group has spread world-wide and gained the attention of many comediennes all over the globe from the novice to the established seasoned professional. The only requirement is that you must be a Female Comedian who is open to learning and growing.

The FICC brings together female comedians for all across the US and Canada for a week of educational and career advancing opportunities. With intensive and accelerated workshops, seminars and information sessions, industry attended showcases, a variety of networking events and exposure in some of the top comedy clubs in LA. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10,000 to cover the expenses of production. Needless to say producing a convention of this magnitude is no small feat and there is great cost involved. One of FICC’s main goals is to be able to allow all comediennes who wish to take advantage of this opportunity to participate regardless of their ability to pay. As you can imagine many of these women are working mothers who frequently put the needs of their children/family above their own.

We would like to provide partial scholarships based on the financial needs of the comediennes so we can provide professional support for as many women as possible. FICA supplemented the fees of 50% of the women who attended the 2013 convention.

Details of the convention please go to: www.femalesincomedyconvention.com

If you know of any female comedians that you feel can benefit from this convention please feel free to have them contact us.

         

The Impact

Your contributions will  support female comic's, live comedy and keep the laughter alive. With all the stressors and challenges that life can present us with, laughter is healing and the best medicine that can be prescribed. In addition a portion of this fundraising campagin funds will also go to A NICKEL OF HOPE, INC - a mentoring program for at-risk girls in the Los Angeles & surrounding areas. Go to www.anickelofhope.org for details.


Other Ways You Can Help

    • Share this campaign to all comedy lovers and supporters of the arts and live entertainment.
    • Share this campaign with all your friends, family,co-workers, neighbors etc.
    • No contribution is too big or too small
    • Some of your donations may be tax deductable
    • If you would like to be a sponsor of the 2013 FICC, a full sponsorship package can be provided by contacting Hope Flood,  please email: hope@femalesincomedyconvention.com

 

 We THANK YOU for your support, your time, and your donation.

story:
What is DUMB?

In October of 2012, after a vague doctor's assessment and much googling, I decided to stop talking for all but 15 minutes a day. See, usually my throat pain goes away quickly, but this pain showed up in May, and it stayed. Over the summer it got worse, and worse, and worse, until it was constant and unbearable.

In order to get better as quickly as possible (and to not be in pain), I stopped talking. I stopped singing. I stopped everything. 

Take a moment to imagine what this would be like for you. How would you feel? How would you communicate with your loved ones, friends, coworkers, neighbours? Could you do it?

 

IN JUST ONE WEEK OF THIS CAMPAIGN, I HAVE MET MY FIRST GOAL

Thanks to everyone who gave, who shared, and who read -- now let's keep the momentum going and see how far we can take this thing!

My NEW goals!

Now that I know I can print DUMB #1 and #2 and bring them out to CAKE (The Chicago Alt Comics Expo, June 15-16), I'm looking further. With your support, and the support of the people around you, any (or ALL) of these wonderful things could happen!

IF I REACH...

  • $2,500 I will go to MECAF, the Maine Comic Arts Festival, in Portland, Maine on May 19th! More sales to be made, friends to connect with, and exposure to industry folks, all in the lovely town of Portland.

  • $3,000 will make sure that I get a real website up, which will give me a platform from which I can continue to spread the word about DUMB and my other ventures! I will also print a limited run of DUMB translated into French to bring to the Festival de la Bande-Dessinée de Montréal, June 1-2!

  • $4,000 will see DUMB #3 and #4 printed and published by August - check out some of the new perks, your copies could be included!

  • $5,000 will ensure that I bring all four issues of DUMB (don't worry, it's just the first four in the series) to both SPX (Bethesda, Maryland) in September, and the Brooklyn Comics and Graphics Festival in November!

 

From there, I dare to say, I'll be some kinda real cartoonist!

 

What this means to me

I'm... desperately in love with comics. AND I'm also really attached to my voice. These two major parts of my identity coming together is significant to the point that I can't even express it in words, and I really want to share it with you!

Any bit of support you can provide, even if it's just linking to this campaign somewhere, will keep me on track.While you're at it, maybe tell someone about it WITH YOUR VOICE! Don't neglect your precious vocal cords, go vibrate some air at someone you like!

story:
As in the tradition of our CKY / Jackass films, we refuse to compromise the artistic vision! We've never done that, and we never will!

"The Brandon Novak Chronicles" graphic novel is a 100% independent production, we have bypassed the suit-and-tie publishers who will edit our work and prevent you from experiencing the raw nature of these true stories.

In return for your donations, we giving you SPECIAL LIMITED EDITION NOVAK / CKY ITEMS that are unavailable anywhere else, cool stuff to treasure and show your friends! For us, there's no better way to show you how much we appreciate you for your love and support!

Currently, the graphic novel is one-half complete. Your donations will go towards the completion of the project and printing costs. If we achieve our goal, all additional funds will go towards the second graphic novel in the series!

story:
"I've had the honor to be associated with [Vampirella] many times since I first broke into comics 25 years ago." - Billy Tucci

Vampirella #1 hit store shelves on July 17th with an amazing 130,000+ copies sold and it continues to sell across the world! Written by Christopher Priest, with interior art by Ergun Gunduz, the new Vampirella is the "IT" book to read this summer.

Supplement your summer reading with Billy Tucci's Vampirella/Shi cover signed exclusively on INDIEGOGO and no where else! 

Billy is a dear friend of ours, with many Dynamite covers to his name. When the new Vampirella series became a runaway success, Billy wanted to know how he could help make this series even bigger and we both agreed a limited edition cover would make a great "love letter" to our most iconic character. And when you combine Vampirella with his beloved creation, Shi, you're really got something special!

"[This cover] not only celebrates VAMPIRELLA's 50th anniversary, but also the 25th anniversary of my own creation, SHI." - Billy Tucci

Billy is offering fans a few different versions of his cover and you have your choice between them! Don't forget to have Billy sign them with signature reward levels!

Billy is also signing these two highly-limited covers...

...an 18x24" heavy paper stock lithograph...

Add this lithograph to any perk level by increasing your order by the following:

  • UNSIGNED LITHOGRAPH: $50
  • SIGNED LITHOGRPAH: $100

And for Billy's biggest fans... he'll be doing original, hand-drawn sketches on copies of the "Black & White Virgin" cover!

Billy Tucci is an award-winning cartoonist best known for his modern-day samurai fable, “Shi”.  Through Billy’s Crusade Fine Arts, the multi-Eisner Award-nominated Shi has been printed in five languages sold more than 3 million comic books.  He has also worked on a litany of projects for DC Comics’ including “Sgt. Rock”, “Harley Quinn”, “Flash Vs. Superman” and “Batman.” 

His earnest retelling of the Christmas story, “A Child Is Born” has quietly turned into a international blockbuster after winning the Christian Small Publisher Book of the Year Award.

2019 celebrates Billy’s 25th Anniversary in comics with the release of the “Shi – Return of the Warrior”, “Zombie-Sama!” and “Appalachian Apocalypse.” He also illustrated  “Wonder Woman ” for DC Comics and is writing the script for the return of golden age icon, Miss Fury for Dynamite Entertainment.

MAKE SURE YOU'RE FOLLOWING BILLY ONLINE TO SEE HIS OTHER COVERS AND PROJECTS!

FACEBOOK

TWITTER

INSTAGRAM

YOUTUBE

OFFICIAL WEBSITE

Risks & Challenges

"Each and every one of these extremely limited edition comics have already been printed!"

- Billy Tucci

We've been publishing comic books and developing products for a long time and there is always a chance for issues to arise, but Dynamite has always found a way to produce our products. We've filled many successful crowdfunding campaigns to-date and more are being filled all the time. Our commitment to our fans is what's kept us successful for so long!

story:
Rocket Gal and the Mole Men of Mars is a retro-style out of this world adventure from Wyatt Holliday (Ardanna) and Peter Gilmore (The Case of The Littlest Umbrella).

  • 32 pages
  • Full color


Current Status: Fulfillment Complete

$15k Stretch Goal Unlocked!

Exclusive Print by Peter Gilmore

The Story

When the galaxy's greatest scientists are lost on Mars, Rocket Gal is tasked with discovering their fate and returning them home. Accompanied by her faithful companion, Booster, Rocket Gal must face the subterranean denizens of the Red Planet - The Mole Men of Mars!

Rocket Gal draws inspiration from classic sci-fi like Flash Gordon, Barbarella, Buck Rogers, animation in the spirit of Dragon's Lair and Space Ace, and cliffhanger movie serials. Join us for a timeless sci-fi adventure featuring action, danger, and excitement, all in the spirit of classic Good Girl Art and animation. Written by Wyatt Holliday (Ardanna), with art by Peter Gilmore (The Case of the Littlest Umbrella).

The adventures of Rocket Gal contain sci-fi action violence, suggestive themes, likely alcohol use, and is suggested for readers ages 13+.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back us right now, you can also help by following and sharing this campaign on your social media!

story:
Update 4:  Achievement Unlocked! $2400.00 Stretch goal met!  All orders 30.00 and up will receive a Casually Kayla papercraft  doll!

Update 3:  OMG!  WE DID IT!  WE DID IT!  We met the goal!  WHOOO!  I'm truely thankful for all your donations and we couldn't have made it without you!  Continue to donate though, all extra funds go right back into the book. 

    

Update 2:  Achievement unlocked!!!!  We've broken 1, 100.  So you know what that means?  Eveyone who has backed, will now get an Aceo portrait drawing.  XD

Update 1:  Additional perk level was added.  It's for people who want a double copy of the books to give to your friends as a gift. 

The Mission:

Hi! My name is Kayla Davis!

I have been running an autobiographical webcomic about my married life online since 2009. I open the doors and let everything just spill out. You get to see what it's like to be the new age odd couple living in the bible belt of the south. Somethings are funny, somethings are sad, something are just weird. Like my obsession with murder mysteries, my husband's love of all things Mecha, and my current quest to get a mini horse!

I am now trying to get an anthology of the comics put together in a new book called: Casually Kayla Anthology. Also, I am trying to produce a book about our recent trip to Japan.

 

Your Mission, if you choose to accept it:

I need donations to cover the cost and production and marketing of the books. You're not getting 1 book, but you are actually getting 3 books in this project.

All proceeds will go to Casually Kayla, the books, and going to conventions in the near future to get more fans of the comic. All extra funding goes right back into the books making them better and better-er! I said it, better-er!

I am looking to print at least 500 books total, and that cost some mad cash. But believe me, you are investing in quality products and all around funny stuff!

Everyone who donates will be kept in the loop with updates on the book progress and updated on the goal chart.  Yes!  we have a goal chart!  Check back often to see how long my scarf grows!  Stretch goals will also be announced there.

 

What's in the books?:

Casually Kayla Anthology: Comics from the 4 years that Casually Kayla has been online. Also, exclusive comics not seen online or by anyone else, but me. The book will be 96 pages and will be in full color. Soft cover book with a matte finish.

Casually Kayla in Japan: This is our travelogue of our trip to Japan. This book will document all our experiences and fights and make ups along the way. Experience some of the beauty and things we saw and ate! OOOO! Pictures of food! This book will be 88 pages and will be in full color. Soft cover book with a matte finish.

Daniel's big Adventure: Daniel felt left out that he didn't have anything for just him and the boys, so here it is. A 20 page mini comic about Daniel's big Mech adventure. See Daniel sitting in the cock pit of a big robot. This will be a self printed mini comic in 3 colors. Books will be stapled together.

 

What do you get for your donation?:

Tons. For each level of the Perk, you will get certain rewards. Incentives include:

Casually Kayla Mouse Pad (Kayla on a pony!)

Digital PDF's at web resolution

Name on the thank you page

The books

Casually Kayla Mugs- 15 oz ceramic coffee mugs

Casually Kayla t shirts- a shirt with the casually kayla logo across the chest.

Casually Kayla plushes crafted by the wonderful Ambitiouslove Boutique!

Casually Kayla buttons and more.

(***Some items have different colors: Pink, Green, Blue, Black.  If you would like a certain color, let me know and I will try to accomadate that.)

 

Why Donate?: 

So you can say you're one of the first, of course!  Also, this is essentially a pre order and with that, everyone who donates is getting items at a very deep discounted rate.  Once the pre orders are over, all items go up for their regular retail price. 

What happens if we meet our Goal?:

That would be so awesome! The books will be printed and all perks and books will be distributed by February 1, 2013.

If we happen to meet and then exceed our goal, stretch goals will be added and that means more goodies and/or more quality added to the books-- the books will already be at 100% quality, so wouldn't it be awesome to up the quality to 9000?!

 

What are Stretch Goals?:

Stretch Goals are like achievements in a video game.  They will unlock once we reach and exceed our target goal. The secret goals will effect all orders with special gifts.  Everyone knows that I like to include tons of freebies in my orders, so just imagine getting freebies and more presents for exceeding our goal!

 

What happens if we don't meet our Goal?:

I will be one sad Kayla, but I will understand.

Well the production of the books will be pushed back and then the funding will be treated as a pre order. Meaning, everyone who has donated will still get their gifts but I will have to use Print on Demand.

 

Can't donate?:

That's okay! Word of mouth is just as good. So tell everyone you know about Casually Kayla and the book and tell them how much you love it! Link your friends to the campaign or directly to the comic.

(***Some items have different colors: Pink, Green, Blue, Black.  If you would like a certain color, let me know and I will try to accomadate that.)
 
Why Donate?: 
So you can say you're one of the first, of course!  Also, this is essentially a pre order and with that, everyone who donates is getting items at a very deep discounted rate.  Once the pre orders are over, all items go up for their regular retail price. 
What happens if we meet our Goal?:
That would be so awesome! The books will be printed and all perks and books will be distributed by February 1, 2013.
If we happen to meet and then exceed our goal, stretch goals will be added and that means more goodies and/or more quality added to the books-- the books will already be at 100% quality, so wouldn't it be awesome to up the quality to 9000?!
 
What are Stretch Goals?:
Stretch Goals are like achievements in a video game.  They will unlock once we reach and exceed our target goal. The secret goals will effect all orders with special gifts.  Everyone knows that I like to include tons of freebies in my orders, so just imagine getting freebies and more presents for exceeding our goal!
 
What happens if we don't meet our Goal?:
I will be one sad Kayla, but I will understand.
Well the production of the books will be pushed back and then the funding will be treated as a pre order. Meaning, everyone who has donated will still get their gifts but I will have to use Print on Demand.
 
Can't donate?:
That's okay! Word of mouth is just as good. So tell everyone you know about Casually Kayla and the book and tell them how much you love it! Link your friends to the campaign or directly to the comic.

story:
Over the last year and a half I have produced three short stories in graphic form for three different authors.

'After The End' is penned by Tauriq Moosa and deals with a secret scientific experiment.

'Two Little Boys' concerns an intriguing coincidence linking the lives of Adolf Hitler and Ludwig Wittgenstein and is written by Christian David. It first appeared in Issue 29 of The Illustrated Ape.

The final story 'The Bleeding Horse' is an adaptation of a macabre story by Brian J Showers about a haunted Irish pub. 

I want to publish these in full colour as an anthology. I have posted examples of the art in the gallery section of this campaign so that you can form an idea of how the project will look.

I need $2000 to cover the printing and shipping costs. By pre-ordering a copy of Black Cloud via Indiegogo you will be entitled to various perks depending on how much you wish to chip in to the campaign. The perks are listed below. If you can't contribute money but like the look of the project please tweet about it and mention it on Facebook.

That's all there is to it really, thank you for taking the time to look at my campaign!

The final story 'The Bleeding Horse' is an adaptation of a macabre story by Brian J Showers about a haunted Irish pub. 
I want to publish these in full colour as an anthology. I have posted examples of the art in the gallery section of this campaign so that you can form an idea of how the project will look.

story:
Short Summary

Dear Readers,

My name is Mark Conner and I am the writer and photographer of Chamber of the Soul. I also play the part of Braxton Sinclair. I began working on this project with my friends our senior year in high school.  Over a year has passed and now we've almost finished. But not quite. Chamber of the Soul was funded entirely out of our own pockets with most of the money going to paying for the 35mm film it was shot on. So the last thing I want to do with this project is make it real. Right now it exists solely as a webcomic but with your help I can print it as a real book for all of you!

If I don't answer any of your questions below please feel free to ask!

What We Need & What You Get

All of the money we earn is going to pay for the costs of printing these books.

  • We are using Ka-blam digital printing to publish these books and have already received two copies from them as proofs. This company has been incredibly helpful with this project and we are happy to be using their services. 
  • It costs about $15 to print each book the additional money we are charging for the book is going directly to paying for shipping costs because the books have two trips to make: 1) From the printer to me and then 2) from me to you. 

Risks & Challenges
  • The only challenge we anticipate is that of time. It will take up to month for the books to get from the printer to us and then our small team working out of a dorm room will do our best to get the books out to you as quickly as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone is capable of giving money but if you would still like to help there is something you can do. Spread the word using your favorite form of social media whether that Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter or proclaiming it from the rooftops and I will be forever grateful. Thank you.
story_txt:
Short Summary Dear Readers,
My name is Mark Conner and I am the writer and photographer of Chamber of the Soul. I also play the part of Braxton Sinclair. I began working on this project with my friends our senior year in high school.  Over a year has passed and now we've almost finished. But not quite. Chamber of the Soul was funded entirely out of our own pockets with most of the money going to paying for the 35mm film it was shot on. So the last thing I want to do with this project is make it real. Right now it exists solely as a webcomic but with your help I can print it as a real book for all of you!
If I don't answer any of your questions below please feel free to ask!   What We Need & What You Get All of the money we earn is going to pay for the costs of printing these books.


We are using Ka-blam digital printing to publish these books and have already received two copies from them as proofs. This company has been incredibly helpful with this project and we are happy to be using their services. 


It costs about $15 to print each book the additional money we are charging for the book is going directly to paying for shipping costs because the books have two trips to make: 1) From the printer to me and then 2) from me to you. 

 If we have any extra money we will be purchasing more copies of the book which we'll keep to sell in local bookshops and things. 
For the most part we are only giving away copies of the books because that is what this campaign is for, we don't want to waste your money on other perks. 
If you give any amount between $1 and $19 you will receive our most sincere thanks and this money will directly help pay for the printing and shipping of the books.
For $20 you will receive the Chamber of the Soul book
 For $25 the author Mark Conner and cast member Robin Kovac will sign it.
The only perk that includes something other than a book is the $50 perk, if you give this amount you will receive a film negative from Chamber of the Soul. One of the things that makes this project unique is that it was shot entirely on 35mm film and we want people to be able to have a piece of that.

Risks & Challenges
 
The only challenge we anticipate is that of time. It will take up to month for the books to get from the printer to us and then our small team working out of a dorm room will do our best to get the books out to you as quickly as possible. 
  Other Ways You Can Help I realize not everyone is capable of giving money but if you would still like to help there is something you can do. Spread the word using your favorite form of social media whether that Facebook, Tumblr, Twitter or proclaiming it from the rooftops and I will be forever grateful. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Alicia Smith and I am the creator of Quarter Kids Handmade dolls. My dolls have been featured on the Bad Girls Club season 7,and Criss Angel Mindfreak. They have been placed in the hands of tons of rockstars, and tv personalities such as.. Morgan Freeman, Martin Atkins, Oprah Winfrey, Robert Englund, Norman Reedus. Just to name a few!
  • I am finally creating a comic book! We need your help to get this accomplished! This comic will be issue 0 of many to come! This is an introduction into the lives and personalities of my characters. Watch them as they come to life in this 16 page comic book.
  • It has been a dream of mine, for a long time, to get this comic book finished and with a little help from my friends, family, and fans, I hope to accomplish this.


What We Need & What You Get


  • In order to get this comic finished we have a goal of $6,000. This will include all the costs of the artist, writers, and printing.
  • The perks! The perks! There will be life size dolls, replicas of the comic book characters, and artist pick dolls! We will even have posters! ooooo la la :)

The Impact

With my track record of previous endeavors, I have not doubt that I can make this comic book a success. I am aiming to get it made into an animated series in the near future!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
My name is Alicia Smith and I am the creator of Quarter Kids Handmade dolls. My dolls have been featured on the Bad Girls Club season 7,and Criss Angel Mindfreak. They have been placed in the hands of tons of rockstars, and tv personalities such as.. Morgan Freeman, Martin Atkins, Oprah Winfrey, Robert Englund, Norman Reedus. Just to name a few! I am finally creating a comic book! We need your help to get this accomplished! This comic will be issue 0 of many to come! This is an introduction into the lives and personalities of my characters. Watch them as they come to life in this 16 page comic book.

It has been a dream of mine, for a long time, to get this comic book finished and with a little help from my friends, family, and fans, I hope to accomplish this.


   What We Need & What You Get  
In order to get this comic finished we have a goal of $6,000. This will include all the costs of the artist, writers, and printing.  The perks! The perks! There will be life size dolls, replicas of the comic book characters, and artist pick dolls! We will even have posters! ooooo la la :)


  The Impact With my track record of previous endeavors, I have not doubt that I can make this comic book a success. I am aiming to get it made into an animated series in the near future!

story:
In this installment of The Oswald Chronicles: My Time With Clive issues 3 & 4 we find Oswald wandering dream and finding himself in the midst of some very troubled minds with some deep dark ancient one mysteries. While in issue 4 Oswald takes a trip down memory lane to see a present that could have been.

And for those of you who missed out on the first 2 issues we're making them available again :D

 We also have our next installment of the Star Trimmer tales available "A Country Knight in NYC." Featuring illustrations by Daphne Lage, Jade Gonzalez, and Eryono Tilis
