Featuring illustrations by Daphne Lage, Jade Gonzalez, and Eryono Tilis

story:
155% FUNDED!
English? Please scroll down. 

Kampanjen som pågick i 14 dagar blev en riktig succé.
Mycket glädjande att inte bara kunna genomföra investeringen att ta hem 1000 exemplar av nya boken, utan att dessutom få skicka iväg över 100 exemplar direkt när böckerna kommer.  Leveransen till oss är beräknad till den 17 December och vi skickar alla böcker senast den 18 December.

Fortfarande öppet att beställa böcker.
Officiell release för denna bok blir en bit in på på 2016, men så länge vi kan leverera böcker före jul, via denna kampanj, så låter vi möjligheten stå öppen att beställa förhandsexemplar till de otroligt låga priser som vi satt för "perks". Gäller så länge det finns perks kvar.

Tack Allah!
Nej, jag menar tack alla!!


Sjung och triumfera! 
Crowdfundingen är lyckad tack vare ert fantastiska stöd,
men vi stänger inte butiken för det.
De fina erbjudanden om att få boken flera veckor för officiell lansering 
till ett löjligt lågt pris är kvar kampanjen ut. Så skynda att fynda! 

Vi har också bestämt för att lägga ut ett några så kallade stretch goals.

Stretch Goal 1.
Om vi skulle nå förbi € 1400 
Då skickar vi med ett unikt julkort till samtliga backers designat av Fredrik Andersson, exklusivt för denna kampanj.

Stretch Goal 2.
Om vi skulle nå förbi € 2000
Då får alla som varit med och backat denna kampanj en värdekod vilket berättigar till en extra gratis bok av Volym 2, vid backning av nästa bok i serien Tokiga Bibelord - Volym 2.

Stretch Goal 3.
Om vi skulle nå förbi € 3000
Då skänker vi böcker till samtliga konfirmander i valfri kyrklig konfirmationsgrupp, oavsett antal.


Mitt namn är Jakob Ståhle och jag jobbar som magiker och underhållare. Efter att ha växt upp i kyrkans värld granskade jag bibeln och blev då befriad från min gudstro. Tillsammans med illustratören Fredrik Andersson och över 200 backers på Indiegogo har vi skapat en humoristisk satir och citatbok med 50 tokiga bibelord livligt illustrerade i färg.

Boken är en flerfaldig bestseller på Amazon Kindle som e-bok och har varit tillgänglig i häftad mjukpärm via print on demand. Nu har det alltså blivit dags för en riktig bok i hårdpärm. Och det till ett lägre pris dessutom! I och med en lyckad kampanj här blir böckerna klara och levererade i god tid före jul.


Pengarna går till den sista delen av kostnaden för de 1000 exemplar av boken som ska tryckas i ny utgåva. Men denna gång får boken ett hårt omslag, bättre kvalitet och detta till ett lägre pris eftersom vi kan får ner tryckkostnaden per bok.

Planen att släppa en nyutgåva har funnits där hela tiden men för att få ut boken innan jul har vi valt att köra denna crowdfunding som ett eget projekt och som ett erbjudande, både till alla er som stöttat oss innan och till nya backers.  

Alla backers som valt att få boken som en del av sin PERK (belöning) får den så klart hemskickad innan boken når ut till distributörer, handlare och andra läsare. Vi har satt ihop några olika paket (PERKS). 

Välj bland perks längs högerkanten, eller längre ner om du läser i en mobil webbläsare.


€ 5 - Julkort

Vi skickar ett julkort till dig med ett eget unikt motiv och ett stort tack!

€ 10 - Boken!

Du får boken Tokiga Bibelord som ett hårt paket från oss...och jultomten!

€ 10 - Boken + T-shirt

Du får en bok OCH en gratis T-shirt med ett motiv från boken. Finns i begränsat antal. Vi skickar ett mejl till dig med en förfrågan om val av motiv och storlek.

€ 20 - 3 st Böcker

Julen är räddad! Du får tre stycken böcker så att du kan ge bort två av dem i julklapp. Känner du någon i behov av vass satir och lite hårdare fakta om bibeln i ett lättläst format? Då är detta rätt val för både dig och dina nära och kära.

€ 45 - 8 st Böcker

Alla högtider är räddade! Du får åtta stycken böcker som du kan ge bort vid flera högtidliga tillfällen, t.ex. julafton, födelsedagar, dop, konfirmationer, skolavslutningar, etc.

Citat: 50 tokiga bibelord med tillhörande illustrationer i färg indelat i sju olika kategorier. Alla citat är tagna från mindre kända och okända verser ur bibeln med tillhörande källhänvisning så att du lätt kan slå upp knasigheterna i sin kontext. 

Fakta: Som grädde på moset finns det även flera faktarutor med intressant och ofta okänd information kring bibeln och kristendomen. Här är några exempel:

  • Under vilket tidsspann bibeln skrevs.
  • Hur många författare som ligger bakom bibelns böcker.
  • När man fastställde urvalet av böcker som skulle få ingå i bibeln.
  • När bibeln delades upp i verser.
  • Hur många av bibelns personligheter som blev mer än 175 år,
    och hur många som blev äldre än 900 år gamla.
  • Att Nya testamentets böcker skrev på grekiska och vilket språk Jesus talade.
  • Hur många gånger treenigheten nämns i bibeln.

Nytt Omslag: Vi har ett nytt omslag på denna nyutgåva, tack vare värdefull feedback från våra läsare. Nu är det ännu tydligare att det är just vår glada Jesus på framsidan av boken och att innehållet är mer riktad till vuxna läsare även om ungdomar absolut också borde få läsa boken, särskilt om de är konfirmander. ;)

Uppdateringar: Vi har också passat på att göra justeringar och andra uppdateringar av texten i boken.

Syftet är att roa, bilda och utmana.

Bibeln är världens mest sålda, och stulna bok. Ändå är det en bok som väldigt få har läst ordentligt. Faktum är att väldigt få kristna vet vad den innehåller förutom de fina delar om kärlek och förlåtelse som vi får serverade i våra kyrkor.

Bibeln har stor påverkan på samhället i vår värld. Regeringar tar beslut med bibeln som stöd. Mänskliga rättigheter kränks och barn skräms med "hjälp" av bibeln. I sekulariserade Sverige ser vi tecken på detta, men i andra delar av världen är detta ett mycket mer påtagligt faktum.

Således är det väl rimligt att vi får möjlighet att bilda oss en bred bild av innehållet i  bibeln. Med hjälp av boken Tokiga Bibelord blir perspektivet på bibeln helt enkelt bredare och förhoppningsvis roligare.

Boken är utformad så att det skall vara lätt att läsa, dela eller visa upp för att starta diskussioner och tankar. Vilken trovärdighet kan vi ge bibeln? Tokiga Bibelord hjälper kanske till att reda ut den frågan...


Engelska

This project is about offering an updated and upgraded re-print of Nutty Bible Quotes vol.1 in Swedish. The goal is to raise enough extra money to able us to print 1000 copies.

The biggest changes in this updated re-print is that the book will get a very nice hard-cover instead of a soft-cover and it also includes a general upgrade of the paper and print that will increase the overall quality and feel of the book. This version will also get a new modified front cover based on feedback from our readers.

If successful our backers will receive their chosen perks as gifts in time for Yule, which is what us Swedes and other scandinavians call "Christmas".

story:
Edit: Any Super Donations of $100 or more will also receive a unique art card featuring the Amya character of your choice drawn by Rebecca.

Our Story

Thank you for taking the time to view this campaign. My name is Savannah Houston-McIntyre, and I am the writer and producer of ï¿½Amyaï¿½. I work alongside my co-writer Andrew Hewitt, as well as my illustrator Rebecca Gunter.


Amya is a high-fantasy graphic novel that my comrades and I have dedicated our time and skill to publishing since mid-2009. In the first chapter, ï¿½Amya: Unexpected Meetings,ï¿½ readers were introduced to a ragtag team of adventurers who were brought together by chance.  In Chapter Two we follow Faye, Accel, and Kaden as they are pulled into an adventure that is greater than any of them could have anticipated; or ever expect to fulfill.


What We Need

As an independent publisher, printing comics at the level of quality that readers expect is financially challenging.  I was fortunate to be able to fund the first chapter out of pocket.  However, because of medical concerns surrounding my son, I have taken an extended leave from work. Iï¿½m afraid that I will not be able to put these forty seven pages of Chapter Two in your hands without help from you.


It is my hope that you will help me raise 1/3 of the cost to print Chapter Two, or $750 USD.   Anything we raise above that amount will aid in printing the project sooner, or add to the amount we are able to print.


What You Get

We have a number of pledges and rewards listed to the right. Please review the options and consider extending your support. Anything you give is appreciated - as every dollar pushes us toward our goal. If you cannot donate financially, please consider donating your time and sharing this project with another. 


For those of you who are able to donate towards either the digital or print editions, weï¿½re pleased to be offer five bonus pages of additional content! 

I wish to thank you again for taking the time to consider this campaign. Amya has been a labor of love - and it's our dream to see it to its end, which is still 10 chapters away. The coming years will be full of more hopes, sore fingers, and tight timelines; but it will all be worth it. Not only does our love for the project propel us forward - but your support. You make it all worthwhile.

Best regards,


Savannah Houston-McIntyre


_ _ _ _ _ _ _

story:
What is Norhend?

Norhend is a Chilean Manga in which we have been working for about 3 years. Itâ€™s basically a heroic-fantasy story, but with a lot of surrealist touches that makes difficult to completely identify it in that category. 


About the authors

FÃ©lix Ahumada is in charge of drawing and Jorge Vega is in charge of the story. We are both Chilean but also eager to show our work to the world. We have a lot of fun with what we do and we wish to share it with as many people as possible.


About the story

Many centuries ago, the world was divided by the gods in six continents, each one of them protected by its own god. The gods gave life to all the planet's creatures as well as peace and wisdom. All that was created was good and noble until the arrival of a being called Ubel, who created evil creatures to destroy the gods' creation.

Ubel faced the gods, showing them to be superior, but they combined their power and managed to lock Ubel in a runic prison. With their last strength, the gods created their final legacy: six blood blacksmiths, who will be responsible of stopping Ubel if he ever managed to escape his prison.

Balkar is one of these blacksmiths, almost as old as the world where he lives. He travels to find adventures, enjoying his favorite T.V. shows and the company of every maiden he can rescue. However, his life will soon change, since Ubel will not be locked forever.


What We Need 

The funds we ask for are for printing and distribution of the first volume (Spanish and English version, 5.5 x 7.75 inches, 48 pages 100 pages)


Negotiating again with the printing house, we managed to reduce some printing costs (we also had to reduce the amount of volumes we wanted to print), which will allow each volume to have 100 pages, four chapter per volume. The prices of the perk will be the same, except for those who ask for Aluminum, who will also have an original drawing!


Help us make this dream come true!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this Project in Facebook, twitter, directly with your friends, etc.


Thank you very much!!!

Ubel se enfrentÃ³ a los dioses, demostrando ser superior a ellos, pero los dioses unieron sus poderes y lograron encerrarlo en una prisiÃ³n rÃºnica. Balkar es uno de estos herreros, casi tan viejo como el mundo en el cuÃ¡l vive, viaja en busca de aventuras, disfrutando de sus programas favoritos de televisiÃ³n y de la compaÃ±Ã­a de cada doncella que pueda rescatar, sin embargo su vida cambiarÃ¡ pronto ya que Ubel no estarÃ¡ encerrado para siempre.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
This week the Internet watched as an attorney tried to halt charitable giving and attack the First Amendment rights of a web comic, because said attorney’s feelings were hurt.  What started as an amazing charity, which proved beyond a shadow of doubt the lengths the Internet is willing to go to preserve our rights to freedom of speech and help out great causes in the process, quickly became a legal circus, with the butthurt attorney as the ring leader.  As a result of his legal shenanigans two charities that might have received sizable donations, now will not.

Suggested Reading

To see the saga through my perspective, and for more information about why I am starting this fundraiser, please visit my blog.  For actual legal savvy regarding the case, visit the indomitable Pope Hat.

Who Will Benefit

All money from this fundraiser, less IndieGoGo’s fee, which you would have to be a complete imbecile not to decipher from their crystal clear Terms of Service and Fee schedule, will go to the following two charities:

The first is Americans for the Arts.  Hopefully, by increasing the number of arts programs available to kids, the world can look forward to more people like Matthew Inman, who use humor and creativity to fight battles, in lieu of litigiousness and bullying.

The second is the Electronic Frontier Foundation.  I think it goes without saying the importance of the work this group is doing, to preserve the first amendment rights of bloggers, satirists, and web users everywhere.

What You Are Effectively Saying by Donating

  • My intentions for donating my money are my own business and no one else’s, especially douche bag attorneys.
  • I support the right of web comics to satirize and parody public figures.
  • I don’t need a vigilante lawyer to do my homework for me into the validity of a charity or the trustworthiness of an individual acting solely of his own accord, thank you very much.
  • I accept that the possibility exists that this Ann person could be a complete fraud who will abscond with my money, but that this possibility only exists in the mind of one attorney on the face of the earth, because Ann knows full well that if she does not give the money to the charities she has claimed that the wrath of the Internet will be upon her.

(Campaign image from Creative Commons by emmadiscovery. Use of this image does not suggest the photographer endorses this fundraiser.)

story:
LATEST UPDATE:

First lot of comics has arrived, yay!

Also a quick update on the exclusive print – pretty much finished with Alusius and the skulls, so time to start work on the background. 
You can get one with the comic here and they will also be available in limited capacity at London Comic Con this weekend.

Thanks ever so much to those who have contributed so far!

 

Don't miss out, order your copy now!

-----------------------------------------

Greetings comic fans!

Many thanks for landing on my humble project page.

This year will see the launch of my comic series Soulsnatchers, a story about group of former humans turned reapers who run the black market soul trade in the underworld.

The pilot issue was released back in 2006 and has since made the convention rounds. Now Issue #1 will be making its debut at London MCM Expo with issue #2 to follow in October

A free sneak preview for issue #1 is now avaialble both online and in paper form at conventions with the rest of the sixteen pages being pencilled and inked as we speak.

What I will need from you fine people

Basically I'm looking for a little bit of help in getting at least the first issue printed and shipped, 100 copies of an 8"x10" comic with 16 pages in black and white and a full colour cover. Including shipping this should cost no more than £160. Anything extra will go towards future issues of Soulsnatchers.

What you will get in return

The exciting bit! Here are the perks you'll get for your kind donations:

Up to $7 - A PDF copy of Soulsnatchers #1

$8 - Both a PDF and physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1.

$15 - PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1 and a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website).

$25 - PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website) and an exclusive Soulsnatchers print.

$40 - PDF and a physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1 signed with a small sketch, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website) and an exclusive Soulsnatchers print (will be limited to 5).

$50 - PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website), an exclusive Soulsnatchers print and a pencil and ink drawing of your choice (will be limited to 3).

$75 -  PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website), an exclusive Soulsnatchers print, a pencil and ink drawing of your choice and all further issues of Soulsnatchers for free (will be limited to 2).

$100 - PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website), an exclusive Soulsnatchers print and full colour digital drawing of your choice and all further issues of Soulsnatchers for free (will be limited to 2).

$250 - The ultimate perk! PDF and signed physical copy of Soulsnatchers #1, a "thank you" in the back of future issues (with a link to your website), an exclusive Soulsnatchers print, a full colour digital drawing of your choice, all further issues of Soulsnatchers for free AND a cameo appearance in issue #2 (will be limited to 1).

Shipping is included with all perks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

No worries if you can't contribute at this stage. Tweets, FB posts, journal shout-outs or any other communication methods from the big wide world of social networking will be very much appreciated. :)

You can read the preview of issue 1 in my blog and DeviantART gallery linked below:

http://ryuuza.blogspot.co.uk/2012/04/soulsnatchers-issue-1-taster.html

http://ryuuza-san.deviantart.com

 

All the best!

- Giuseppa

story:
Ryan Ferrier - Writer, Letterer
Matt McCray - Artist
Vic Malhotra - Artist
Adam Metcalfe - Colorist 

TIGER LAWYER Explained:

What is this Tiger Lawyer, you ask? Well, it’s simple. Tiger Lawyer is a tiger... who is also a lawyer. And a damn good one too. But it’s more than just a concept, it’s an original comic book series that reaches out into different genres, styles, and tones, and features multiple artists and creators, namely the amazing primary art team of Matt McCray, Vic Malhotra, and Adam Metcalfe.

The format for TIGER LAWYER comics is what makes it special. Each deluxe print issue comes in a flip-book style, meaning there are two front covers. Each “side” of the comic features a different Tiger Lawyer story presented in a different genre, with art from different artists. For example, one side of the comic, with its own cover, will feature a courtroom-action-comedy story, while the other side will feature a gritty, hard-boiled crime noir story. And the meat in the middle of the two stories comes in the form of several pin-ups from artists all across the globe.

Tiger Lawyer #1 was released in April 2012, and we sold out of our first printing of 150 copies over the course of the Vancouver and Calgary comic conventions, not including the additional 100 copies purchased through the online store. Tiger Lawyer has also garnered some good buzz around the internet, including a nod from Image publisher Eric Stephenson and a featured interview on CBR’s Robot 6 blog. But the coolest thing to happen to Tiger Lawyer is its inclusion in HELL YEAH from Image comics (Joe Keatinge, Andre Szymanowicz), in the form of one-page back-up stories, beginning this July in Hell Yeah #4.

This campaign:

This campaign is for TIGER LAWYER #2, which will further the adventures, excitement, thrills, and comedy of the first issue. We’re going even bigger and better with issue two, creating a single issue so jam-packed with comics, you’d think it was two comics jam-packed in one. Oh wait... it is!

The single stories in TIGER LAWYER #2 are longer, zanier, and grittier than before, and we’ve got some truly wonderful talent committed to contributing pin-up artwork, and more on the way. As a bonus, the issue will also include an all-new REVENGE ROOSTER mini-comic from writer Fabian Rangel Jr. and artist James Gilmer. 

TIGER LAWYER #1 was just the start.

What we need:

Tiger Lawyer is (as of right now) completely self-published under my (writer-creator Ryan Ferrier) independent self-publishing imprint Challenger Comics. Simply put, making comics is not cheap, and very rarely will you make a penny at the end of the day. Everything that costs something, is incurred by me, including artist fees, printing, shipping, marketing materials, convention fees, travelling, etc. So why do I do it? Because I love it, and feel I have to do it. If you’ve got a story you want to tell, do it. I love comics so much, I will go broke to make them. I’d rather not go broke however... so here’s where Indiegogo comes in. 

Hopefully, with your help and generous donation, we can continue to make Tiger Lawyer comics, as well as provide you with some awesome rewards and keepsakes. Everybody wins, and we all have comics and fun. 

Our goal is to raise $3,000 for Tiger Lawyer #2. This will cover artist fees and printing of the book. If we don’t reach our goal, the book will still be printed, and all perks will still be awarded. Any funds exceeding our goal will go towards keeping our online store afloat, as well as being put aside for the inevitable TIGER LAWYER #3.

Keep an eye on the campaign, as I’ll be posting updates on the project over the next 45 days. Maybe some new incentives too.

Thank you so much for checking this campaign out, and for your consideration. We all truly appreciate your help and support, and hope you enjoy the world of Tiger Lawyer

About Us

Ryan Ferrier is a comic book writer and letterer based in Calgary, AB, Canada. His work includes Terminals for Penny-Farthing Press, The Brothers James for 215Ink, and Tiger Lawyer.

Matt McCray is an illustrator and designer from Dallas, Texas (USA), and he loves drawing comics! He's known for his fun cartoony style.

Vic Malhotra is a Canadian comic book artist. His first published work was in Ed Brisson's Murderbook II. Since then he has had work featured in various anthologies and is currently one of the artists for Tiger Lawyer.
 
Adam Metcalfe is an illustrator and colorist based in Toronto, ON, Canada. Some of his color work can be seen in Zombies vs Cheerleaders #6 (cover B), Voltron: United and Drawn, the upcoming Cobble Hill, and Tiger Lawyer.
story_txt:
Ryan Ferrier - Writer, LettererMatt McCray - ArtistVic Malhotra - ArtistAdam Metcalfe - Colorist 
TIGER LAWYER Explained:
What is this Tiger Lawyer, you ask? Well, it’s simple. Tiger Lawyer is a tiger... who is also a lawyer. And a damn good one too. But it’s more than just a concept, it’s an original comic book series that reaches out into different genres, styles, and tones, and features multiple artists and creators, namely the amazing primary art team of Matt McCray, Vic Malhotra, and Adam Metcalfe.
The format for TIGER LAWYER comics is what makes it special. Each deluxe print issue comes in a flip-book style, meaning there are two front covers. Each “side” of the comic features a different Tiger Lawyer story presented in a different genre, with art from different artists. For example, one side of the comic, with its own cover, will feature a courtroom-action-comedy story, while the other side will feature a gritty, hard-boiled crime noir story. And the meat in the middle of the two stories comes in the form of several pin-ups from artists all across the globe.
Tiger Lawyer #1 was released in April 2012, and we sold out of our first printing of 150 copies over the course of the Vancouver and Calgary comic conventions, not including the additional 100 copies purchased through the online store. Tiger Lawyer has also garnered some good buzz around the internet, including a nod from Image publisher Eric Stephenson and a featured interview on CBR’s Robot 6 blog. But the coolest thing to happen to Tiger Lawyer is its inclusion in HELL YEAH from Image comics (Joe Keatinge, Andre Szymanowicz), in the form of one-page back-up stories, beginning this July in Hell Yeah #4.
This campaign:
This campaign is for TIGER LAWYER #2, which will further the adventures, excitement, thrills, and comedy of the first issue. We’re going even bigger and better with issue two, creating a single issue so jam-packed with comics, you’d think it was two comics jam-packed in one. Oh wait... it is!
The single stories in TIGER LAWYER #2 are longer, zanier, and grittier than before, and we’ve got some truly wonderful talent committed to contributing pin-up artwork, and more on the way. As a bonus, the issue will also include an all-new REVENGE ROOSTER mini-comic from writer Fabian Rangel Jr. and artist James Gilmer. 
TIGER LAWYER #1 was just the start.
What we need:
Tiger Lawyer is (as of right now) completely self-published under my (writer-creator Ryan Ferrier) independent self-publishing imprint Challenger Comics. Simply put, making comics is not cheap, and very rarely will you make a penny at the end of the day. Everything that costs something, is incurred by me, including artist fees, printing, shipping, marketing materials, convention fees, travelling, etc. So why do I do it? Because I love it, and feel I have to do it. If you’ve got a story you want to tell, do it. I love comics so much, I will go broke to make them. I’d rather not go broke however... so here’s where Indiegogo comes in. 
Hopefully, with your help and generous donation, we can continue to make Tiger Lawyer comics, as well as provide you with some awesome rewards and keepsakes. Everybody wins, and we all have comics and fun. 
Our goal is to raise $3,000 for Tiger Lawyer #2. This will cover artist fees and printing of the book. If we don’t reach our goal, the book will still be printed, and all perks will still be awarded. Any funds exceeding our goal will go towards keeping our online store afloat, as well as being put aside for the inevitable TIGER LAWYER #3.
Keep an eye on the campaign, as I’ll be posting updates on the project over the next 45 days. Maybe some new incentives too.
Thank you so much for checking this campaign out, and for your consideration. We all truly appreciate your help and support, and hope you enjoy the world of Tiger Lawyer
About Us
Ryan Ferrier is a comic book writer and letterer based in Calgary, AB, Canada. His work includes Terminals for Penny-Farthing Press, The Brothers James for 215Ink, and Tiger Lawyer.
Matt McCray is an illustrator and designer from Dallas, Texas (USA), and he loves drawing comics! He's known for his fun cartoony style.
Vic Malhotra is a Canadian comic book artist. His first published work was in Ed Brisson's Murderbook II. Since then he has had work featured in various anthologies and is currently one of the artists for Tiger Lawyer.
 
Adam Metcalfe is an illustrator and colorist based in Toronto, ON, Canada. Some of his color work can be seen in Zombies vs Cheerleaders #6 (cover B), Voltron: United and Drawn, the upcoming Cobble Hill, and Tiger Lawyer.

story:
Note: For a better description into this, watch the above video.

  • Who I am and why I made this

     As I say in the video, I am Cohen Babcock, a young man who wants to make his dream of writing and drawing comics come true. Ever since I was a kid, I've believed the best part of anything was laughter, that most pure sense of happiness. My entire goal is to create a comic, and in the future several others, all to bring happiness to people and to spread the joy I've felt in reading other stories whenever I've needed the help. All I need is the equipment and a chance.

     I made this campaign because I felt that this is the best choice. I'm at a point in my life where I've practiced for years to where I'm satisfied enough to release it, and I have the time and energy to do it. It's just that I can't afford to get the stuff I need to be able to do this.

  • The campaign idea

     The entire point of this, then, is to share my made up stories with people, to entertain them. If I can reach my goal, I'll release this comic a page a week, chopped into chapters, all for free as a webcomic. This means every week you'll be able to read and enjoy, and share it to all who want to read it.

     After this comic, if the equipment holds and people still want to read, I'll keep making more. This is going to be an initial fund, and I won't need anything other than the base equipment. So unless I've been run out of the country, I'll keep making comics for you, even bigger and better than before.

  • The Comic

     A world where magic never died out, magical creatures sprawl throughout the world, enjoying the ease of technology. A man simply known as The Shade tricks an orphaned child into becoming a genie, a being with immense power. A man today, known as Artem, is given the genie, now hundreds of years captured and skilled in all forms of magic, to use as he will. Artem decides the best course of action is to allow him freedom while he decides on a wish, and to leave him unsupervised. It was a poor decision to say the least.

     Written as a comedy with a darker side, you can follow these two as they get in awkward adventures and try to settle down into a crazy situation they've created for themselves, every week starting 2014.

What this campaign does for me, and you!

     I can go on and on about how you'll be helping the creative community, but it boils down to this: I want to make comics, you might like to read comics, and that's why. If I can get the funding I can begin to create and make these stories for everyone who's interested. It's my dream to create stories, to make you laugh with me in this, so if I earn the money, that's what I'm going to do.

Now for the money 

  • What I'll get

      Aside from money, I'll get something else. I'll be using that money to gain equipment for the site. Most prominently I need to get a new computer, tablet, and the adobe programs. Now, due to a great friend, I can get the tablet and adobe for $500 and the extra bit goes to a computer to run this. The extra fifty is then to balance out the cost of the indiegogo, so I can afford everything still. Notice that this is the cheapest I can work with.

     I will update you guys on every purchase with this money. If I buy a sandwich, I will tell you everything from the toppings to the crumb number, because you are sending me this money for a reason, and I want to ensure you get what you're promised.

Any extra money will be used for:

  • Upgrading the tablet and computer
  • Paying my web-designer and technician for his service
  • Investing for further purchases that may be needed, repairs and internet cost etc.
  • Fulfilling the perks! (below)

o    Stretch goals

For every $100 we achieve, I will release a page of the prologue in the gallery, up to $1,200, to be released starting on the 12th of March.

  • $1,200
  • I'll fulfill all perks and begin release of the comic by January 1st, 2014, along with releasing the first 12 pages of the 21 page prologue. 
  • $2,000
  • I Will finish all of Modern Magic's writing by the end of 2013, and begin writing and drawing up things for my second story, to be announced.
  • $3,000
  • *Will reveal after reaching 1,200*

 

Storyboards Sample:

 

 Want to see the other pages? Check the gallery!

 

  • How I'll repay you

Of course donating on its own is nice, but I owe you for every cent, so like many, I've used perks to give you a little gift. Most of them are drawings or involving the comic, but please understand that's the best I can do. These commissions and drawings will be done to the absolute best of my abilities, so to adapt to the program, it may take up to two or three months before I'm able to fulfill it all, and I apologize, but I want that to be clear that patience will be required

Also, all perks require a valid email address to reach you by. If your indiegogo contact info is invalid, please message me by email or this site and I'll try to confirm it.

Any ideas for perks you want to see? You donate more than I set as the highest perk, and want a deal? Email me, and if you guys would like it, I'll set it up if I can.

  • How else you can help

While donating is fantastic, I understand not being able to donate money. Lack of money is why this campaign exists!

Any way you can help is wonderful, and if you can't afford a perk, please just share the project, or even just share the comic once it's done. Every bit counts, and thank you for at least reading this far.

And of course, wish me luck.

 

Commission Details:

How Do Commissions Work?

First, it depends on the type. A character commission is my way of saying I will draw one person with some accessories and items, no backgrounds or multiple characters. A full commission will be characters, backgrounds, multiple panels, etc.

All commissions will be within 12x12 inches, more than likely in a 11.5x8 inch format for printing availability unless otherwise requested.

After the campaign, I will begin setting up the new equipment and website, and as soon as I'm comfortable with the equipment, I will begin emailing you individually (starting with the basic commissions and working up to the full color multiples) talking about a basic idea. I will take creative license over this with certain details, but I'll try to make what you want as well, so expect some decent contact using the provided email.

What is appropriate?

To make sure I don't agree to draw inappropriate content by misunderstandings, please stick to these rules with commissions:

  • No sex
  • No nudity
  • No gore
  • No monstrous abominations that will haunt my very nightmares

I feel that this is just and fair, to keep everything appropriate. Please don't push the envelope, because unless you genuinely don't understand me there shouldn't be any issues with what I mean by appropriate.

Questions, Comments, Concerns, Suggestions? Email me at FancyEvilsOwner@gmail.com

Any and all relevant questions will be put below and the response placed below.

Questions answered:

Q:I'm not sure if you mentioned it or not - but will you be releasing this as a webcomic?

A: Yes, it will all be on the site fancyevils.com when I set it up by the end of the year, and released weekly, a page per week, until it's finished. Dependent on response, I may eventually sell full copies by PDF or paperback, but it will always be free online for anyone.

story:
My Story

(The Females in Comedy Association (FICA) & Miss Rich Entertainment are proud to present the â€1stAnnual Females in Comedy Convention (FICC)â€. This groundbreaking historical event will take place April 26-29, 2012 in Los Angeles CA. Female Comediennes will be participating from all over the US and Canada for this four day convention.There will be daily workshops, seminars, taught by top Comedy Professionals and nightly showcases. Special events include a Panel Discussion entitled â€œDISHING THE â€œTâ€, MEET & GREET PARTY and the 1st ever LEGENDS OF COMEDY AWARDS (LOCA) Luncheon, honoring veteran female comediennes. I am so excited because there has never been a convention of this magnitude for females in comedy and with your contribution I will be able to take part in this history making event).


Why I Must Go!

(This campaign will help me enhance my comedic writing skills and could open up many doors in the industry for me. I can be hired on as a writer, sketch performer, etc. for gospel movies, stage plays and various sitcoms on Networks like TBN, GMC, Day Star, BET, TBS, NBC, FOX, HBO and other cable networks. To have doors open like this for a Christian Comedian can help me spread The Gospel, while encouraging others to share their Faith in mainstream. The Lord has called me to minister The Gospel/Good News to the World, not just to my fellow brothers/sisters in Christ. Help me create a Christian Comedian platform in the Gospel and Mainstream Communities. Christian Comedy is considered to be the last frontier in comedy, help me to make this historical Convention and trail blaze this type of comedy into Mainstream America and the World).


What I Need & What You Get

(By contributing to this campaign it will allow me to pay for my convention registration fees, round trip air fare, hotel, Showcase registration fees, food allowance (It's expensive to eat in Los Angeles...LOL!), Expense money (tips, cab fare, luggage fees, etc..) and Award Luncheon registration fees. If I can raise at least 75% of funds I can register for the conference, book a flight and pay for my hotel. I can go on a 3-day Fast if I don't make my campaign goal. I can eat when I get back to Dallas...LOL! If I make my campaign goal, I will forever be grateful to everyone who contributed to the success of this trip. I will send many many shout outs on Facebook, Twitter and for those of you who still have a MySpace, I will send a shout out to you too via snail mail. I will also video my activities and post videos on You Tube in order for you to see how your contribution funds were spent. AGAIN, Thanks for your support and may God continue to richly bless you).


Help Spread The Good News

(During a Christian Women's Leadership Class in the Spring of 2002, a prophetic word of laughter was spoken into my life. As I have been afforded the opportunity to perform comedy all  over the world, I have found out that being funny is an elusive art. Every performance is a unique experience. The challenge as I continue to grow in my Faith is to discover my authentic comedic self and bring the ministry of comedy to the Gospel/Mainstream Stage. I have a calling to do Christian Comedy. So, I ask you to PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD WITH ME!

story:
I'm so thrilled to announce that thanks to all you lovely folks, the project is funded! I hope I do you and Oscar proud with this comic, and appreciate your help in getting it off the ground. 

There's still a few days left to claim a goody from the rewards here, and every bit helps to make this book a bigger and better adventure into history and art.

Thank you all so much. 

-Lucy

 

About the project:

This project explores the geographical touchstones of the life of the poet, playwright and aesthete, Oscar Wilde. From the perspective of cartoonist and travelogueist, Lucy Knisley (a long-time Wilde fan), this project follows in his path from his birthplace and college to the city of his theatrical triumphs, and on to the site of his imprisonment and the hotel where he died in exile. Part travelogue, part historical study, part personal exploration of his writing and life, Lucy will write and draw about the places where Wilde lived and worked, creating a book about Wilde's history and the adventure of tracing his life.

The plane tickets are already taken care of (thanks, Dad!), but there's still a bit to go before this trip can take place. Please consider making a donation to raise the funds for hostels and train tickets, art costs for labor and supplies, and help to make this book a reality. In exchange, you'll have your pick of art prints, a preview chapter, postcards from the journey, kudos in the book, a custom portrait, and a page from the actual travelogue!

Thank you for your consideration.

 

About Me:

I'm a comic book artist and author, who loves to write about food and travel and adventure.


My first book, "French Milk," (Simon and Schuster, 2008) is a graphic travelogue about staying in Paris with my mother. In the book, I spend my birthday briefly visiting a couple of the Parisian Wilde landmarks (the site of his death, and his tombstone. Cheery birthday!).

I've loved Oscar for most of my life, and hope to find and explore the traces of him left on the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you a Wilde scholar? Want to talk more about him and contribute your story of how he's impacted your life? Email me-- I'd love to chat!

Got a couch or like to cook food for a rambling comic artist? Live in London, Dublin or Paris? I love meeting people and chatting with other artists or comics fans or Wilde enthusiasts, and any hospitality will be welcome and repaid in art.

Are you a Wilde scholar? Want to talk more about him and contribute your story of how he's impacted your life? Email me-- I'd love to chat!


Got a couch or like to cook food for a rambling comic artist? Live in London, Dublin or Paris? I love meeting people and chatting with other artists or comics fans or Wilde enthusiasts, and any hospitality will be welcome and repaid in art.

story:
The Project

Hi I am Laura a Spanish-Swiss illustrator mother of two, I am the official designer of the cartoon versions of Bentley and Farah, This pair of famous Pembroke Welsh Corgis!

In the Corgi lover circles they are well known for their acting roles in television and movies. Bentley joined BBC AMERICA’s television series “Dirk Gently’s Holistic Detective Agency” (starring Samuel Barnett and Elijah Wood) Shortly after, Bentley’s sister Farah started to appearing on film sets as well. The two pups have filmed for mainstream movies, commercials as well as television series like “Legends of tomorrow” and their work has views on the 8 figures range. This Corgi pair is extremely popular at conventions and Corgi beach days, meeting fans and signing pawtographs. They are also the main characters of my webcomic “Corgi One-Liners”.

To further develop the comic I designed this calendar with 12 beautiful illustrations about the pups’ adventures, that’s up and ready to be printed. It originally had a publisher, who, sadly, went restructuring during project development, and ended up waiving it, now thanks to you we are producing it independently.

 

 

The calendar is 21X42 cm (8.25X16.5 in) with 12 beautiful illustrations printed in really vibrant colours on a heavy premium print paper, the finishing is excellent with a hanger so its very durable design Shipped worldwide at no additional cost from 16 euros (18$).

the pages contain one illustration, a customisable calendar, and a list of the main holidays around the world (as a plus Googling those can stimulate multicultural curiosity)

 

Stretch Goals

1500€ This will allow us to finance the expenses to put the site (and the project) out of Beta and pay for another year of the servers and services we use to run the project. As thank you everyone will receive a digital edition collecting the first cycle of corgi one-liners webcomic.

2500€ the comic will be translated immediately in Spanish and Italian we and you will be receiving an eye-catching sticker!

5000€+ We will begin working on the monthly comic number 0 and every backer will have a special access to exclusive previews and art!

The Impact

We need your support to finance the development of the webcomic! So your calendar will ensure everybody can continue to enjoy the webcomic twice a week and if stretch goals are reached you can look forward to the future monthly adventures, too! the best thing is that the cute, colourful pictures of the calendar will accompany you with nice vibes all year long, as it's common knowledge that Corgis bring joy!

the calendar is ready to go so not really a big risk there, we already began preparing the print and will be packing and sending as soon as the first half of November so everybody can have it before Christmas!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute to our campaign, other than financing it, please share our updates with friends on social media as much as you are comfortable with, and remember that Indiegogo has sharing tools that ease the process!

story:
The 70's are back!

Cooper & Paco both served with the Marine Corps in Vietnam. They disliked the lack of political will to win the war and the ultimate disastrous 'welcome home '. Investigating the death of one of their comrades *Ride Fast Die Last* is the first 24 page installment of a three book story arc that tells a veteran's story from a different perspective than the standard narrative. The Napalm Brothers combines history, political commentary and humor in a dynamite 1970's setting!

Who are we?

The book was done entirely by Sixth Scale Combat, who we will call Six for short. He wrote the story, did all the artwork and the colors. Gravestone Press will be shipping the books, and we are excited to be working with Six.

Go to know Six

The book is already finished!

Are you tired of waiting on campaigns to finish the books you paid for? Six has already finished the book and it's ready to go to print! As soon as the campaign ends the order is placed and the books start going out as soon as they are in our hands!

$10 shipped in the USA!

 

Stretch Goals

At $1500 we unlock the Charlie in the wire ashcan!

Once we hit $2500, we will unlock the Death Card! Featuring art by Tony Sizzle!

story:
It's that time of year again...

Every fan's favorite holiday is back and Dynamite has plenty of great, collectible comics to choose from! We have incredible signed special editions and original art comics that will make your collection complete! 

CELEBRATE MAY 4TH WITH DYNAMIC FORCES!

CHOOSE-YOUR-CHARACTER SKETCH COVER

The "choose-your-own" sketch cover reward offers you the choice of your favorite character, sketched by Ken Haeser!

(official Marvel Star Wars blank covers for remarques and original art. You will be asked to choose your character at checkout)

KEN HAESER SKETCH COVERS SIGNED BY STAN LEE!

That's right, we've got just FOUR blank covers signed by the late, great Stan Lee and sketched with an iconic SW character by Ken Haeser.

(official Marvel Star Wars blank covers for remarques and original art)

story:
The next exciting graphic novel from the creator of JAWBREAKERS- LOST SOULS!

IRON SIGHTS is a hard-boiled action drama set on the border...told in the trashy tone and fun style of a 1990s Straight-To-Video DVD!

If you like Quentin Tarantino crime flicks, John Woo Heroic Bloodshed movies or modern films like NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN, HELL AND HIGH WATER or SICARIO, then you'll love IRON SIGHTS!

 

 

Interior Art is complete! No long wait!

All 120 interior pages are complete. 66% of the pages have been lettered and 95% of the pages have had greytones applied. This book will be complete and ready to ship to the printers immediately after the campaign ends on July 15th. Quick printing and shipping are a rare luxury in the world of crowd-funded Comics and Graphic Novels. Don't pass this up!

 

List of Creators

Story by Richard C. Meyer and Carlos Ivan Silva

Script & Lettering by Richard C. Meyer

Art by Ibai Canales

Cover by Kelsey Shannon

Esme poster by Sasha Perdigao

Promotional Art/Temp Cover by Bob Stone

 

Cast of Characters

RAMADI- an Iraq vet addicted to the thrill of combat.

 

WOODS- Veteran of numerous clandestine Special Forces operations in Central and South America in the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s. Worked for the cartels in Mexico for the past 20 years. Coming home to the United States for the LAST time.

 

ESME- a young woman targeted by the cartels. In desperate need of help from ANYONE.

 

ZICK- Former Marine Scout/Sniper. Wood's former protégé. Driven insane when Woods ripped his tongue out with a pair of pliers for giving away their position while on a contract.

story:
My Story

I have been drawing my own comics since about second grade. I was first inspired by anime such as Dragonball. I am completely self-taught. I have also been practicing martial arts and competing in combat sports since a young child.

When I was 18, I left a full ride to the University of Illinois to pursue my passion as a boxer. I excelled at boxing and even became a Chicago Golden Gloves champion.

After dropping out of school, I continued drawing and studying on my own. I developed an interest in learning Japanese. I took two years at the local community college and excelled and have been self-studying since then. I am now able to speak, read and write Japanese.

 

Study in Japan

In August, 2017, after deciding to take my art seriously, I quit my job and flew myself to Japan for one month. While there, I studied the manga storytelling style and trained at a professional boxing gym.  My experience in Japan inspired me to go back to school.

 

What Am I Doing Now?

When I came back to the states last fall, I immediately got to work drawing and studying manga. I completed several short stories and the first edition of my series, Azuki. I also started teaching a manga workshop about the differences between the Eastern and Western storytelling style that I learned while in Japan.

I finished community college in 3 semesters and started studying Studio Art at Eastern Illinois University this fall. All of my free-time is dedicated to working on my manga series.

 

Cost

I am now ready to release my series Azuki but do not have the funding to do so. Printing copies and advertising cost quite a bit so I finally decided to start this fundraising campaign.

Any funding that I do receive goes toward the following:

Book printing fees; My goal is to sell 500 copies of each of the 4 books

Fees for travelling to conventions

Fees for travelling to teach workshops

Website maintenance

Social Media promotion and advertisements

 

What makes Azuki so special?

There are many Black people all over the world that love Anime and Manga, but there aren't very many Black characters. Azuki is a strong and determined young Black girl who breaks down stereotypes, yet her story is accessible to all ages and all colors.

My goals is to bring Japanese and American culture together. I believe that we have so much to learn from each other culturally, philosophically and artistically. Azuki is the first step that I am taking at a large-scale in this regard.

I want to share my love of Manga and shed new light on it as a truly intellectual medium to a wider Western audience.

 

Risks & Challenges

Becoming a manga artist is no easy task for a Japanese person. It is even more difficult for a foreigner. Further, the life of an artist in general can be difficult.

But, I have learned from boxing that if you believe in yourself and your dream, that you can overcome any hurdle. It takes work, grit, effort and determination to succeed. I had to work very hard to complete community college while working and boxing and drawing manga in order to start art school this semester.

I didn't have to go back to school but I decided to humble myself and receive classical training. As you can see by my voyage to Japan, I am willing to do whatever it takes to make my vision a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money to contribute, but would still like to help don't fret!

I greatly appreciate any and all supporters. After all, it's not just about the money.

If you like my story and like what I have to offer, then please share share SHARE!

story:
There's no secret that a lot of people are fed up with the 2016 Presidential election and it's not even really begun yet.  I follow politics, but more like a spectator sport.  You couldn't dream up the narrative, mis-steps, outrageousness, and pure comedy of the US political process.  It's the best form of entertainment.

On a practical level, though, a lot of people are pretty upset with the choice of Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump.  They're not exciting candidates.  There's talk of an independent running, but the time for a serious third candidate is already passed.

I know, because I looked.  Getting on the ballot in most states is really tough.  Colorado, though, will put any eligible person on the ballot for $1,000.  That's it.  No signatures or other qualifications.

I figured, why not?  This will be a great story to tell someday, plus, I went to high school in Colorado, much of my family still lives there.  My Dad could vote for me for President - how often can someone say that?

I also feel like it's a great statement of social protest.  I mean, if Donald Trump can run for President, why not me?  I'd certainly rather vote for me than any of the other options.  I won't win, of course - but that's the point.  These elections often just give us the illusion of control - why not make a statement about the futility of voting by voting for a guy who can't win?

The biggest problem is money.  I don't have $1,000.  I'm a stay at home dad, freelance writer, and pastor from Delaware.  I'm poor.  But this idea is a funny one and I went to the trouble to research it (I even contacted the Federal Election Commission to make sure it's both doable and legal - it is).

The challenge will be to raise all the money.  I'm asking for an extra $100 to cover most of the Indiegogo fees.  But, I think with your help and the sheer absurd humor of the idea, word can get around.  It's only 100 people giving $10 or a few more generous souls giving more.

I've set it up as a restricted campaign, so if we don't raise the total needed, no one will be out any money.  I promise not to waste your dollars.  It's name on the ballot or nothing in 2016.

On a personal level, I'm a registered independent who's never voted for a name on the ballot (mostly write-ins).  I could go through my political ideas, but that's pointless - this is just for fun and I'm not going to win.  You can learn more about me and connect on IG, Facebook or Twitter - all @ryanalanscott.

So, will you help me do this crazy thing?

Give to get Ryan Scott on the Colorado Presidential Ballot or at least share the link and spread the word.


Thanks!

story:
Vampirella's History

Vampirella is one of the most iconic comic book characters ever published.  Created in 1969 by horror icon Forrest J. Ackerman, she has thrived for nearly 50 years delivering classic tales of terror in comics, graphic novels, and magazines.  And over those years the art and covers of Vampirella Magazine defined the horror genre with master illustrators like Frank Frazetta, Sanjulian, Bill Hughes, Jose Gonzalez, Enrich, Esteban Maroto, and Paul Gulacy along with a host of other legendary artists.  Now Dynamite Entertainment celebrates the vibrant history of the one and only Vampirella with a functioning Tarot Card Deck that captures these timeless images in a unique and enjoyable collectible.

This first game offering from Dynamite Entertainment is a fun and exciting way to immerse yourself in the world of Vampirella.  This set of 78 Vampirella Tarot cards comes in a unique Kickstarter exclusive illustrated box for our supporters.  The cards are built in a beautiful art deco style that embraces the vintage look and feel of the classic Vampirella Magazine covers.  

 

Stretch Goals:

We love  Stretch Goals because they give all of the supporters who make the projects possible even more value as the program grows.  For this IndieGogo we will be revealing several new stretch goals as we achieve the levels.  Watch here for the announcements of each new level!

Stretch Goal #1 - $2500  Print Editions of The Expanded Arcana! 

We are very happy to announce this stretch goal in which if we can reach the $2,5000 mark by the time the program is complete, everyone at the print pledge level ($35) and above will receive three printed playable Expanded Arcana Tarot Cards and instructions on how to use them! These cards are unique to IndieGogo and Kickstarter and feature art from Jae Lee, Joe Jusko, and Amanda Conner.  Note - if we reach this goal - the Kickstarter supporters will also receive the additional prizes!

Stretch Goal #2 - $7000  To Be Revealed

 

The Mystic Tarot

These cards are part of a fully functioning set of major and minor arcana tarot cards.  The complete box set comes with instructions for playing the divination game and provides everything you need to use the cards.  Whether you believe in the power of the cards or not, this unique collectible is both an entertaining game and a truly vintage collectible.  

 

This set of Vampirella tarot cards contains art from some of the all-time masters of the craft and are a fun way to collect a piece of comics history in a unique collectible package.  Now you can enjoy the images that defined an iconic character in one deluxe package.  And you can entertain friends with the discussion of the tarot cards as a game or a divination tool.  You can interpret the cards and decide the fates being revealed through the game.

 

This is the first offering by Dynamite Entertainment into the collectible games category.  We are very thankful to all of our friends and fans that help to make this possible and we are working to bring other fun and entertaining gaming opportunities to you soon.  Thanks for helping us to make this first project a success and to allow us to share this vintage Vampirella art with you.

 

The Levels:

$5 - Vampirella Blast from the Past

For helping us at this pledge level, you will receive a free digital pdf of Vampirella Magazine #1 from 1969! This is where it all began with the very first horror magazine to feature the iconic vampire. You will also receive our thanks and be added to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter.

$20 - Tarot Card Digital Destiny

At this level we unlock the secrets of the unknown with a full digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card deck. You will be able to enjoy the 78 beautiful classic Vampirella face cards crafted in art deco style and making up the full major and minor arcana of the tarot!

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

$35 - Fortune Telling Level

The mysteries of the unknown will unfold before you at this level with the print edition of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck. This beautifully designed deck of 78 tarot cards consists of classic art from the heyday of horror comics and includes illustrations from a host of masters including Frank Frazetta, Sanjulian, Enrich, Jose Gonzalez, Bill Hughes, and many more. The Vampirella Tarot Card deck is a fantastic collectible and a usable game that comes in a special exclusive box with instructions for use. Enter the world of the uknown with Vampirella as your guide!

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Digital pdf of the full 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

$50 - Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner Mini Prints Level

Celebrate the history of Vampirella with two incredible mini-prints - one each of Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner's beautiful art. These mini-prints are exclusive to supporters and are perfect for framing and displaying among your collectibles.

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

$100 - Jae Lee Signed Mini Print & Digital pdf Library Level

We pile on the values here by adding a second exclusive mini-print of Jae Lee's beautiful Vampirella art work signed by the artist and a ready made Vampirella digital art book library consisting of: The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years! This package of Tarot Cards, signed print, and art book pdfs is over $200 value for our awesome  supporters.

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

 

$150 - Art of Vampirella Print Library

Add the masters of Vampirella art to your bookshelf with a print edition library of three amazing hardcover art books! The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years will make incredible additions to your Vampirella collection! This package of Tarot Cards and art book pdfs is over $300 value for our fantastic supporters.

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Jae Lee signed Kickstarter exclusive Vampirella Mini Print -Digital Vampirella Art books library of The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years pdfs -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter.

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

 

$200 - Vampirella Premium Comics Level

Be enveloped in Vampirella's embrace with the ultimate comic collector's level. You will receive 3 rare Vampirella variant cover edition comics added to your package from the vaults at Dynamite Entertainment including the Rare J.Scott Campbell Vampirella 1-in-50 Virgin Cover ($100 value), Vampirella Strikes #1 High-End Virgin Photo Ultra Limited Cover ($50 value), and the Vampirella #1 1 in 40 Linsner Virgin Cover ($75). Many of these comics are lost to time and were originally comic shop exclusive incentive editions which are impossible to find. Jump your comic collection to the head of the class with one easy pledge and enjoy some truly scarce collectibles at this level! With the addition of these comics the value of this pledge level leaps to over $500!

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Print Vampirella Art book library of hardcovers including The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years -Jae Lee signed exclusive Vampirella Mini Print -Digital Vampirella Art books library of The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years pdfs  -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner Kickstarter exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

 

 

$250 - Comic Shop Bundle Package

You must be an active comic book shop to take advantage of this level of the program. You will receive 15 exclusive edition Vampirella Tarot Card Decks for your shop.

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

$275 - Instant Vampirella Graphic Novel Collection

You get double the bang for your buck at this level! Jump start your Vampirella Graphic Novel collection in one easy step with seven volumes of Vampirella Graphic Novels in BOTH print and digital formats! That's a $280 value in all as you get copies of Vampirella Vol 1 - 7 graphic novels added to your collection. In all this level is a whopping $750 value!

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -3 vintage collectible Vampirella rare incentive comic books  -Print Vampirella Art book library of hardcovers including The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years -Jae Lee signed Kickstarter exclusive Vampirella Mini Print -Digital Vampirella Art books library of The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years pdfs  -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

$375 -  Vampirella Master Collector Level

So you want to be a master Vampirella collector? Well we make that possible here with a level that adds BOTH the print and digital pdf editions of Volumes 1-8 of the Vampirella Masters Trade Paperbacks! Stories from comic industry giants including - Grand Morrison, Warren Ellis, Mark Millar, Alan Moore, Kurt Busiek, James Robinson, and Mike Carey are included in this library of tales! This level is valued at an unbelievable $1100!

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Vol 1-7 of Vampirella Graphic Novels -3 vintage collectible Vampirella rare incentive comic books -Print Vampirella Art book library of hardcovers including The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years -Jae Lee signed exclusive Vampirella Mini Print -Digital Vampirella Art books library of The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years pdfs -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

 

$750 - Ultimate Vampirella Collector Level

If you dare open the crypt to this massive level you will be in truly rare company. This level is the ultimate one stop Vampirella collection and is valued at an unbelievable $2590! We add all 15 of the beautiful hardcover editions of Vampirella Archives in both print and pdf editions to the package! This truly is a ready made vault of Vampirella goodness that will make your collection the envy of all your friends.

You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Vol 1-8 of Vampirella Masters Trade Paperbacks in both print and digital pdf editions -Vol 1-7 of Vampirella Graphic Novels in print and digital pdf  -3 vintage collectible Vampirella rare incentive comic books -Print Vampirella Art book library of hardcovers including The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years -Jae Lee signed Kickstrter exclusive Vampirella Mini Print -Digital Vampirella Art books library of The Art of Vampirella, The Art of Vampirella the Warren years, and the Art of Vampirella the Dynamite Years pdfs  -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter  

*See Rewards for shipping costs.

 

Risks and challenges

We would like to thank everyone who considered supporting Dynamite Entertainment's first game offering, the VAMPIREALLA TAROT CARD SET! 

Production on the Vampirella Tarot Cards is well under way and we expect them to ship to fans starting in October this year. That's just a few months from IndieGogo to doorstep. All digital prizes will be fulfilled by Dynamite Digital. We will package and ship the higher level goods accurately and carefully so you know how much we appreciate your support with all of our projects.

A big part of the success or failure of expanding into collectible games is based on the support of our fans and friends through social media word about our projects. It is thanks to you, the comic book fans and Vampirella supporters that we are able to keep developing new and fun ways to enjoy the pastime we all love. Thank you!

Please visit us at www.dynamite.com to see the full list of comics and outreach. We appreciate every share and post that helps spread the collectibles we are working on.
story_txt:
Vampirella's History
Vampirella is one of the most iconic comic book characters ever published.  Created in 1969 by horror icon Forrest J. Ackerman, she has thrived for nearly 50 years delivering classic tales of terror in comics, graphic novels, and magazines.  And over those years the art and covers of Vampirella Magazine defined the horror genre with master illustrators like Frank Frazetta, Sanjulian, Bill Hughes, Jose Gonzalez, Enrich, Esteban Maroto, and Paul Gulacy along with a host of other legendary artists.  Now Dynamite Entertainment celebrates the vibrant history of the one and only Vampirella with a functioning Tarot Card Deck that captures these timeless images in a unique and enjoyable collectible.
This first game offering from Dynamite Entertainment is a fun and exciting way to immerse yourself in the world of Vampirella.  This set of 78 Vampirella Tarot cards comes in a unique Kickstarter exclusive illustrated box for our supporters.  The cards are built in a beautiful art deco style that embraces the vintage look and feel of the classic Vampirella Magazine covers.  
 

Stretch Goals:
We love  Stretch Goals because they give all of the supporters who make the projects possible even more value as the program grows.  For this IndieGogo we will be revealing several new stretch goals as we achieve the levels.  Watch here for the announcements of each new level!
Stretch Goal #1 - $2500  Print Editions of The Expanded Arcana! 
We are very happy to announce this stretch goal in which if we can reach the $2,5000 mark by the time the program is complete, everyone at the print pledge level ($35) and above will receive three printed playable Expanded Arcana Tarot Cards and instructions on how to use them! These cards are unique to IndieGogo and Kickstarter and feature art from Jae Lee, Joe Jusko, and Amanda Conner.  Note - if we reach this goal - the Kickstarter supporters will also receive the additional prizes!
Stretch Goal #2 - $7000  To Be Revealed
 
The Mystic Tarot
These cards are part of a fully functioning set of major and minor arcana tarot cards.  The complete box set comes with instructions for playing the divination game and provides everything you need to use the cards.  Whether you believe in the power of the cards or not, this unique collectible is both an entertaining game and a truly vintage collectible.  

 
This set of Vampirella tarot cards contains art from some of the all-time masters of the craft and are a fun way to collect a piece of comics history in a unique collectible package.  Now you can enjoy the images that defined an iconic character in one deluxe package.  And you can entertain friends with the discussion of the tarot cards as a game or a divination tool.  You can interpret the cards and decide the fates being revealed through the game.

 
This is the first offering by Dynamite Entertainment into the collectible games category.  We are very thankful to all of our friends and fans that help to make this possible and we are working to bring other fun and entertaining gaming opportunities to you soon.  Thanks for helping us to make this first project a success and to allow us to share this vintage Vampirella art with you.

 
The Levels:
$5 - Vampirella Blast from the Past
For helping us at this pledge level, you will receive a free digital pdf of Vampirella Magazine #1 from 1969! This is where it all began with the very first horror magazine to feature the iconic vampire. You will also receive our thanks and be added to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter.

$20 - Tarot Card Digital Destiny
At this level we unlock the secrets of the unknown with a full digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card deck. You will be able to enjoy the 78 beautiful classic Vampirella face cards crafted in art deco style and making up the full major and minor arcana of the tarot!
You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter

$35 - Fortune Telling Level
The mysteries of the unknown will unfold before you at this level with the print edition of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck. This beautifully designed deck of 78 tarot cards consists of classic art from the heyday of horror comics and includes illustrations from a host of masters including Frank Frazetta, Sanjulian, Enrich, Jose Gonzalez, Bill Hughes, and many more. The Vampirella Tarot Card deck is a fantastic collectible and a usable game that comes in a special exclusive box with instructions for use. Enter the world of the uknown with Vampirella as your guide!
You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Digital pdf of the full 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter
*See Rewards for shipping costs.

This package of Tarot Cards, signed print, and art book pdfs is over $200 value for our awesome  supporters.
You will also receive all of the prizes from the previous level: -Joe Jusko & Amanda Conner exclusive Vampirella Mini Prints -Print edition of the 78 card Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital pdf of the Vampirella Tarot Card Deck -Digital Vampirella Magazine #1 pdf -Our thanks for helping make this possible -Addition to the Dynamite Entertainment newsletter
*See Rewards for shipping costs.

story:
The Premiere Edition of issue #2 is a 64 pg, black and white, saddle stitched comic. Each copy is uniquely numbered, indicated by a corner foil stamp on the front cover. (Rated T+)







In the last issue of Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb...

Saaya Volkova, ramen shop waitress by day, high kicking karate girl by nature, finds herself caught within a web of deception when her uncle, Dr. Albert Vogel, is attacked by a group of armed mercenaries led by a hulking wall of muscle called Brecher.

Shot in the back, Saaya is fatally wounded. Vogel's hand is forced as he administers an experimental mutagen in an attempt to save Saaya's life. The Godhand Serum enhances the body and bestows the subject with a Vagary - a mysterious power unique to each subject. Saaya's explosive power manifests and takes out half of the facility in the process.

Coming to grips with her new body and abilities, Saaya fights to protect her uncle from the Black Sun Mercenaries and to live to see tomorrow!

C2 Supplement

A 48 page, manga digest-sized booklet delving into the beginnings of the Murakumo Comic Universe. The book contains supplemental story, character and setting information from Battle Maiden Knuckle Bomb and Ehrgeiz. The book will also feature some exclusive artwork, as well as the original 12 pages of the cancelled 2015 Ehrgeiz webcomic.

ICYMI

The Standard Edition of BMKB #1 is NOW AVAILABLE on Etsy!
Due to popular demand, the newsprint edition of the first issue is now available on our Etsy shop. Since the launch of the issue #2 campaign, these books have been selling fast!

Gratitude

Thank you so much to everyone who backed our previous two projects and to those who can contribute to this one. None of this is possible without you, and don't let anyone tell you otherwise! It is a privilege to create entertainment for you all and Murakumo Comics strives to maintain a high level of quality in our products.
